Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT BRUNEL




Founded in 1975, Brunel has developed into an international group with 12,000 employees and a turnover of €1.4 billion. We deliver Project and Consulting Solutions, Workforce Solutions and Global Mobility Solutions that transform global projects in Renewables, Conventional Energy, Mining, Life Sciences, Future Mobility, Industrials & Technology and many other sectors.




Brunel is listed on Euronext Amsterdam NV and is included in the Amsterdam Small Cap Index (AScX). The organization has grown into a renowned global brand with more than 120+ offices in over 40 countries on 6 continents.




ABOUT THE TEAM




You’ll be joining Brunel’s Market & Business Intelligence (M&BI) team, part of our Global Sales Enablement function. We’re a lean, high-impact team enabling faster, smarter, and more strategic decisions across the business.




At M&BI, we combine market research, consultancy, and data analytics to support Brunel’s strategic priorities and growth execution. Our mission is to turn data into decision intelligence, driving value through insight, efficiency, and innovation.




Reporting to Manager of M&BI, this role helps expand our impact by advancing strategic awareness and analytical capabilities.




ABOUT THE ROLE




We’re seeking a hands-on, execution-focused data analyst to accelerate our transition from descriptive reporting to diagnostic and predictive analytics. You'll build models, design dashboards, and run experiments that prioritize growth initiatives and inform high-impact decisions.




This role is ideal for someone who thrives in execution, bring strong technical expertise, and is curious to understand the "why" behind the data.




WHAT YOU'LL DO




Client - Focused & Client-Facing Reporting and Analytics (40%)




Build intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports that are:

Client-focused: based on client-related data (e.g. customer behaviour, chum, BD targeting)
Client-facing; visually polished, presentation- ready, and aligned with required communication standards




Trend Analytics & Modelling (40%)




Perform root cause analysis, forecasting, and segmentation to uncover performance drivers
Conduct segmentation and clustering analysis to identify behavioural or performance patters across regions, clients ortalent groups




Analytics Process & Tool Scaling (20%)




Build scalable (self-service) tools and templates for recurring insights needs
Support the evolution of our internal data ecosystem by contributing to data structure, quality, and integration efforts
Document processes and methodologies to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing




Evolving area (future-focused)




This evolving area includes hypothesis-driven analysis, pressure-testing assumptions, and scenario modelling. You'll partner closely with the M&BI Manager to explore emerging questions and translate them into data-backed insights that support strategic decisions




WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR




The ideal candidate will have academic-level intellectual and professional capabilities, with a minimum of 4 years of experience in a complex (international) organization. Key qualifications include:




Power BI Mastery: Advanced DAX, data modelling for experimentation, visualization design and performance tuning.
Data handling: Proficient in SQL and comfortable with Python
Analytical techniques: Solid foundation in segmentation, root cause analysis, and forecasting
Experience with Databricks or other cloud platforms(e.g. Azure, AWS)
Familiarity with data governance
Active listening & business communication
Growth mindset: Curious, adaptable, and open to learning advanced modelling and strategic analytics techniques
Model development: Exposure to or interest in building scenario models and statistical testing
Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field




INTERVIEW PROCESS




Two interviews and an online assessment




WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU




Competitive base salary
Hybrid (3 days in the office) & flexible working
Coaching and mentoring through weekly check-ins
Friendly, collaborative & supportive team environment
Laptop and smart phone with Microsoft powered IT tools
Benefits; including pension scheme, group health insurance, 26 paid vacation days with the option to buy upto 40 vacation days per year, travel allowance scheme, bicycle lease plan, gym discount
Through the Brunel Academy - Brunel's learning & development programme - you have every opportunity to continue to develop yourself, both professionally and personally
Show more

ABOUT BRUNEL


Founded in 1975, Brunel has developed into an international group with 12,000 employees and a turnover of €1.4 billion. We deliver Project and Consulting Solutions, Workforce Solutions and Global Mobility Solutions that transform global projects in Renewables, Conventional Energy, Mining, Life Sciences, Future Mobility, Industrials & Technology and many other sectors.


Brunel is listed on Euronext Amsterdam NV and is included in the Amsterdam Small Cap Index (AScX). The organization has grown into a renowned global brand with more than 120+ offices in over 40 countries on 6 continents.


ABOUT THE TEAM


You’ll be joining Brunel’s Market & Business Intelligence (M&BI) team, part of our Global Sales Enablement function. We’re a lean, high-impact team enabling faster, smarter, and more strategic decisions across the business.


At M&BI, we combine market research, consultancy, and data analytics to support Brunel’s strategic priorities and growth execution. Our mission is to turn data into decision intelligence, driving value through insight, efficiency, and innovation.


Reporting to Manager of M&BI, this role helps expand our impact by advancing strategic awareness and analytical capabilities.


ABOUT THE ROLE


We’re seeking a hands-on, execution-focused data analyst to accelerate our transition from descriptive reporting to diagnostic and predictive analytics. You'll build models, design dashboards, and run experiments that prioritize growth initiatives and inform high-impact decisions.


This role is ideal for someone who thrives in execution, bring strong technical expertise, and is curious to understand the "why" behind the data.


WHAT YOU'LL DO


Client - Focused & Client-Facing Reporting and Analytics (40%)


Build intuitive Power BI dashboards and reports that are:

  • Client-focused: based on client-related data (e.g. customer behaviour, chum, BD targeting)
  • Client-facing; visually polished, presentation- ready, and aligned with required communication standards


Trend Analytics & Modelling (40%)


  • Perform root cause analysis, forecasting, and segmentation to uncover performance drivers
  • Conduct segmentation and clustering analysis to identify behavioural or performance patters across regions, clients ortalent groups


Analytics Process & Tool Scaling (20%)


  • Build scalable (self-service) tools and templates for recurring insights needs
  • Support the evolution of our internal data ecosystem by contributing to data structure, quality, and integration efforts
  • Document processes and methodologies to ensure reproducibility and knowledge sharing


Evolving area (future-focused)


This evolving area includes hypothesis-driven analysis, pressure-testing assumptions, and scenario modelling. You'll partner closely with the M&BI Manager to explore emerging questions and translate them into data-backed insights that support strategic decisions


WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


The ideal candidate will have academic-level intellectual and professional capabilities, with a minimum of 4 years of experience in a complex (international) organization. Key qualifications include:


  • Power BI Mastery: Advanced DAX, data modelling for experimentation, visualization design and performance tuning.
  • Data handling: Proficient in SQL and comfortable with Python
  • Analytical techniques: Solid foundation in segmentation, root cause analysis, and forecasting
  • Experience with Databricks or other cloud platforms(e.g. Azure, AWS)
  • Familiarity with data governance
  • Active listening & business communication
  • Growth mindset: Curious, adaptable, and open to learning advanced modelling and strategic analytics techniques
  • Model development: Exposure to or interest in building scenario models and statistical testing
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field


INTERVIEW PROCESS


Two interviews and an online assessment


WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU


  • Competitive base salary
  • Hybrid (3 days in the office) & flexible working
  • Coaching and mentoring through weekly check-ins
  • Friendly, collaborative & supportive team environment
  • Laptop and smart phone with Microsoft powered IT tools
  • Benefits; including pension scheme, group health insurance, 26 paid vacation days with the option to buy upto 40 vacation days per year, travel allowance scheme, bicycle lease plan, gym discount
  • Through the Brunel Academy - Brunel's learning & development programme - you have every opportunity to continue to develop yourself, both professionally and personally

Title: Associate, Revenue Analytics - EMEA
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Revenue Analytics team provides the company with insights into what drives our past and current revenue and membership trends as well as an outlook on future growth. Internally, our analytical insights help inform our growth and monetization strategy. Our revenue and membership forecasts are critical components that feed into the corporate planning process for spending and resource allocation across content, commerce, and technology.

Netflix is looking for the best and brightest candidates to use data and business insights to inform and drive key strategic decisions. We believe that we derive a significant competitive advantage from the highly analytical approach we take to managing the company. Senior management relies heavily on the Revenue Analytics team to develop a data-driven perspective on the company's growth, and the outcomes of our analyses play a critical role in how we plan for and execute on the company's business objectives.

This role is based out of Netflix’s EMEA headquarters in Amsterdam. The role will include occasional travel to Netflix’s global headquarters in California.

Responsibilities


Support strategic value-added analyses to understand the drivers behind membership and revenue growth in the EMEA markets, derive actionable insights and feedback to collaborative cross-function stakeholders (Content, Partnerships, Ads, Payments, Product, Consumer Insights, Data Science etc.)
Assess and communicate the impact of business decisions such as price changes, content launches, and product innovations to facilitate planning and operational decisions
Analyze and evaluate the business impact of key external events such as competitor moves or country-specific events
Research, track and generate insights about the membership growth landscape
Be a key contributor to in-region pricing decisions, compiling internal and external intelligence to inform price and plan strategy
Collect cross-functional inputs to inform and support the revenue and membership forecasts (acquisition, retention, and market penetration)
Support efforts to centralize and standardize revenue performance reporting, helping identify cross-region best practices to enhance scalability and consistency in business analytics


Qualifications

A successful candidate should have the ability to combine comprehensive data analytics with sound business intuition and judgment, and effectively communicate analytical insights to stakeholders. Given the questions asked of our team are often urgent in nature and have an immediate impact on how the business makes decisions, the individual coming into this role must be able to deliver accurate results promptly. They must thrive in a fast-paced environment, possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, focus on generating results, and exhibit the highest personal and professional standards of integrity and ethics.


3+ years of experience in a quantitative role (e.g. business analytics, management consulting, banking, investment management, etc.)
Bachelor’s degree with an emphasis on quantitative coursework
Proficiency in MS Excel & SQL required
Experience building quantitative models in Excel or other modeling tools
Experience writing complex SQL queries to analyze large data sets
Other coding and technical experience (e.g. VBA, Python, Tableau, etc.) is a plus, but not a prerequisite
Ability to independently extract, explore, and analyze big data from both internal and external sources to guide the analysis of complex issues
Possess a high level of intellectual curiosity, discipline, and flexibility
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Highly skilled in preparing effective presentations (Google Slides, MS PowerPoint) with a clear narrative and impactful visuals
Team player with strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to build successful relationships at all levels
Experience and knowledge with various EMEA markets is preferred, but not required

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.
Show more

Description:
Junior Data Analist




Ben jij een junior data-analist met een passie voor finance en data science?

Wil je je carrière starten als data-consultant en heb je een achtergrond in data science, econometrie, of een andere data-gerelateerde opleiding? Dan zijn wij bij BrightStone Group op zoek naar jou!

0 tot 2 jaar werkervaring
Een opleiding in financiën of bedrijfskunde, of relevante werkervaring

Ruime mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke en professionele groei

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

3 to 5 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!
Show more

Title: Data Science Intern(Analytics)
Description:
About the job

Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life of people around the world. Founded in 1998 with its headquarters in Shenzhen China, our guiding principle is to use technology for good.




We are not only a major video game publisher in the world, we also produce other high-quality digital content, enriching interactive entertainment experiences for people around the globe. We offer a range of services such as cloud computing, advertising, FinTech, and other enterprise services to support our clients' digital transformation and business growth.




Interactive Entertainment Group (IEG) is responsible for the R&D, operation, and development of the company's interactive entertainment business including games and eSports. Through online gaming, live broadcasts, and offline eSports, IEG assists the company in leading the global interactive entertainment market to create better interactive entertainment content experiences for users.




Responsibilities:

Analyze large-scale datasets to solve complex business and technical challenges in gaming through analytics and provide actionable business insights to stakeholders.
Contribute to dashboard development and reporting solutions using internal and commercial BI tools like Tableau.
Collaborate with product and analytics teams to develop data-driven strategies and implement solutions that enhance business value.
Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines, ETL processes and data models.
Participate in code reviews, documentation, and best practice discussions to enhance data engineering and analytics processes.







Requirements:

Pursuing a M.S., or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python and expertise in SQL, including the use of window functions, CTEs, self-joins, and other complex SQL functionalities.
Knowledge and experience with at least one visualization tool (ideally Tableau).
Ability to communicate with the business to understand processes and tools and translate this into business logic.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts, ETL/ELT processes, and data modeling techniques.
Analytical mindset with attention to detail and problem-solving skills and strong communication and teamwork abilities, with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
Passionate about games and the gaming industry.




Equal Employment Opportunity at Tencent

As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

Requirements:

  1. Pursuing a M.S., or Ph.D. degree in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.
  2. Proficiency in Python and expertise in SQL, including the use of window functions, CTEs, self-joins, and other complex SQL functionalities.
  3. Knowledge and experience with at least one visualization tool (ideally Tableau).
  4. Ability to communicate with the business to understand processes and tools and translate this into business logic.
  5. Understanding of data warehousing concepts, ETL/ELT processes, and data modeling techniques.
  6. Analytical mindset with attention to detail and problem-solving skills and strong communication and teamwork abilities, with a willingness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
  7. Passionate about games and the gaming industry.


Equal Employment Opportunity at Tencent

As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

Title: Internship - Business Intelligence
Description:
Are you ready to kick-start your career at one of the world’s most iconic companies?

At Unilever, we’re not just about creating products – we’re about building dreams, opportunities, and innovation. With over 400 brands like Dove, Knorr, and Lipton, we’re committed to making sustainable living commonplace.

This is more than just an internship; it’s a chance to learn, grow, and leave your mark at one of the largest FMCG companies on the planet.

What makes this internship exciting?

As an intern in the Business Intelligence Department, your ideas will drive impact, and your creativity will take center stage.

The team will provide you with opportunities to support projects that will help you gain hands-on experience in data analysis, modeling, and developing data-driven solutions, enhance skills in collaborating with cross-functional teams and communicating data insights effectively.

This isn’t just about learning – it’s about leading! Here’s what your journey will look like:


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Create visual representations of data to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.
Ensure data quality and integrity by managing data sources and performing regular audits.
Identify opportunities to improve data processes and implement best practices.
Learn and apply tools and technologies such as SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and Excel.
Assist in various projects by providing data-driven insights and recommendations.


You’re The Perfect Fit If


You’re available for 5 to 6 months starting 25 of August or 1st September 2025 (minimum 32 hours/week).
You’re enrolled (3rd or 4th year) in Bachelor or Master of Economics, Econometrics, or Data Science.
You have strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Experience with SQL and/or Python is a plus.
You have experience with PowerBI.
Experience with AI (LLM or ML) is a plus.
You demonstrate innovation and creativity.
You have advanced Excel skills.
You are fluent in English.


Why you’ll love working with us?

We know internships are all about growth and exploration – and we’ve got you covered.


A €625 gross/month allowance.
Travel reimbursement (if you don’t have a student travel card).
Fun and engaging intern programs – onboarding, events, and activities with fellow interns.
Access to extensive training programs for personal and professional growth.
A flexible working environment tailored to your success.
A behind-the-scenes experience at one of the world’s largest and most innovative FMCG companies.


Application Process


Click "Apply now" and upload your CV and motivation letter. Don't forget to complete the questionnaire we send you. It's your chance to shine!
Our team will carefully review your application. We receive a lot of applications, so please bear with us as we give each one the attention it deserves.
If we think you might be a great fit, we'll schedule a friendly phone call to get to know you better and hear about your motivations.
We'll present your profile to the manager. If they’re impressed, you'll be invited for an interview to discuss the opportunity further.
After the interview, the manager will provide feedback on your performance. If you are selected, you'll receive an offer letter with all the exciting details about your internship.
Once you accept the offer, we'll guide you through the onboarding process, including any necessary paperwork, training sessions, and introductions to your awesome team.
You'll kick off your internship, get integrated into the team, and start working on your cool projects and responsibilities.


Unilever is more than a workplace – it’s a space to bring your passions to life while creating impact. Are you ready to be part of something extraordinary? Let’s make it happen together!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Gezocht: Senior Data / Business Analist | Utrecht | Salaris tot € 90K




Tech: Azure | Data Vault | SQL | Python




Voor een toonaangevende organisatie in financiële producten, zoals verzekeringen, pensioenen en hypotheken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Senior Data- Business Analist. Deze marktleider, die bekend staat om zijn sterke focus op duurzaamheid, bevindt zich momenteel in een complexe migratieperiode na de overname van een grote concurrent.




Als Senior Data- Business Analist maak je deel uit van het data-klantcontactteam, waar je verantwoordelijk bent voor het ophalen van business requirements en het vertalen hiervan naar Features/EPICS en User Stories. Je zorgt voor de automatisering van bedrijfsprocessen en bent op de hoogte van de lopende processen aan zowel de data engineering- als de businesskant.




Wij zoeken een kandidaat met:

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Business Analist.
Meerdere jaren ervaring in een rol als data engineering of data-analyse met tools als SQL, Python, Data Vault en PowerBI
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands.
Ervaring met SCRUM/Agile werken.




We komen graag met je in contact als je het leuk vindt om vanuit een technische data-achtergrond bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en de spin in het web te zijn tussen Data Engineers en Business Stakeholders. Solliciteer via nielsv@doghouse-recruitment.nl of via de "Nu solliciteren" button.




Salaris: Tot € 90K

Locatie: Utrecht (hybride)

Title: Internship Finance – Data Analysis and Technical Skills
Description:
Are you ready to kick-start your career at one of the world’s most iconic companies?

At Unilever, we’re not just about creating products – we’re about building dreams, opportunities, and innovation. With over 400 brands like Dove, Knorr, and Lipton, we’re committed to making sustainable living commonplace.

This is more than just an internship; it’s a chance to learn, grow, and leave your mark at one of the largest FMCG companies on the planet.

What makes this internship exciting?

As an intern in the Finance Department your ideas will drive impact, and your creativity will take center stage.

The team will provide you with opportunities to support projects that will help you develop technical skills essential for finance professionals, including advanced Excel proficiency, data analytics tools, and process automation. In addition, you will enhance analytical skills and understand cost models and rate negotiations.

This isn’t just about learning – it’s about leading! Here’s what your journey will look like:


Improve and master Excel skills, focusing on advanced functions and tools.
Develop proficiency in data analytics tools such as Power Query and Power BI.
Identify opportunities for automation and optimization within financial processes.
Enhance analytical skills through various financial analysis tasks.
Understand and apply cost models and rate negotiation strategies.
Support the finance team in day-to-day activities and strategic initiatives.
Provide strategic insights and contribute to business plan development.


You’re The Perfect Fit If


You’re available for 5 to 6 months starting 25th of August or 1st September 2025 (minimum 32 hours/week).
You’re enrolled (3rd or 4th year) in a university or applied sciences program during the internship.
You have basic finance and accounting knowledge.
You possess great Excel skills.
You are knowledgeable in PowerPoint and Power BI.
You demonstrate resilience and flexibility.
You have strong analytical and communication skills.
You are proactive and curious.
You can work independently and manage projects.
You are fluent in English.


Why you’ll love working with us?

We know internships are all about growth and exploration – and we’ve got you covered.


A €625 gross/month allowance.
Travel reimbursement (if you don’t have a student travel card).
Fun and engaging intern programs – onboarding, events, and activities with fellow interns.
Access to extensive training programs for personal and professional growth.
A flexible working environment tailored to your success.
A behind-the-scenes experience at one of the world’s largest and most innovative FMCG companies.


Application Process


Click "Apply now" and upload your CV and motivation letter. Don't forget to complete the questionnaire we send you. It's your chance to shine!
Our team will carefully review your application. We receive a lot of applications, so please bear with us as we give each one the attention it deserves.
If we think you might be a great fit, we'll schedule a friendly phone call to get to know you better and hear about your motivations.
We'll present your profile to the manager. If they’re impressed, you'll be invited for an interview to discuss the opportunity further.
After the interview, the manager will provide feedback on your performance. If you are selected, you'll receive an offer letter with all the exciting details about your internship.
Once you accept the offer, we'll guide you through the onboarding process, including any necessary paperwork, training sessions, and introductions to your awesome team.
You'll kick off your internship, get integrated into the team, and start working on your cool projects and responsibilities.


Unilever is more than a workplace – it’s a space to bring your passions to life while creating impact. Are you ready to be part of something extraordinary? Let’s make it happen together!

Data Analyst, Credit Risk, Finance SQL, Excel, Python, BI Tools, Finance

Data Analyst - 3 + years experience
SQL, Excel and Python - 3 + years experience
Credit Risk or Finance experience
BI tools experience

Dutch Speaking is essential

12 month initial contract - with potential to go perm after
Amsterdam Area - Hybrid working

Title: Data Analyst – Advertising
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol is always advancing its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our advertising propositions help shoppers discover products and advertisers reach customers – this is where you’ll make a difference. You’ll use data to help our advertising customers maximise visibility over their products on our platform where, how and to whom it matters. This also makes shopping journeys more relevant to our shoppers.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and is becoming an increasingly important channel for our advertising customers. Their need for data and insights are no exception. They rely on us to provide them with meaningful metrics, insightful analyses, and reliable predictive models to keep investing effectively.

What You’ll Do As a Data Analyst

You’ll join 15 analysts in Bol’s advertising analytics organization. Together you share a mission of making people performant through analytics. This role is for the versatile analyst, one that is equally comfortable talking to data as to stakeholders. Your stakeholders can be colleagues from the Advertising and Product domains as well as advertiser customers. Your days vary but at the core you’ll use SQL/Python/Tableau/dbt/git to provide metrics, analysis, and predictions that help advertisers make better decisions.

You’ll collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, identify key performance metrics, define high value use cases for analytics to help advertising customers make better decisions. Your work will be input for amongst others client meetings, white papers, webinars, and public industry appearances.


Analysing advertising KPIs in all stages of the Media Funnel and identifying relevant shopper behaviour across their journeys. You'll use your analytical skills to uncover patterns and insights in our data that help us understand how to optimize the effectiveness of our advertising propositions.
Working closely with internal stakeholders (Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing) and top advertising and agency customers to identify high value applications of analytics. You use your data expertise to help guide decision-making processes and ensure that data-driven insights and recommendations are central to retail media plans.
Developing extensive domain knowledge across our business to effectively manage and analyse advertising KPIs delivered through presentations, dashboards, white papers or public industry appearances.
Developing high-quality data pipelines for dashboarding and KPIs in collaboration with our analytical engineers (using dbt), ensuring that the data we use for reporting and analysis is accurate, complete, and up-to-date.
Writing high-quality and easily interpretable SQL and Python code that can be reused. You'll use your SQL skills to query large, complex datasets, extracting the data needed to answer key business questions. You'll also ensure that your SQL and Python code is reusable, well-documented, and easily interpretable by other members of the team.


Why you can make the difference?

You’re an enthusiastic team player who lives and breathes analytics. The ideal candidate for this role has a strong analytical mindset, a healthy appetite for making business impact and excellent communication and collaboration skills. You have experience working with SQL and dashboarding tools like Tableau and are comfortable navigating and analysing large, complex datasets. You also have a knack for translating complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations.

3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


- If you strongly value clarity No, if innovating, autonomy, and ambiguity sound terrifying to you.
- You only want to process data No, if you only want to process data and prefer someone else to handle project and stakeholder management.
- If you believe analysts don’t need domain knowledge No, if you don't want to dive into the world of advertising. Curiosity and willingness to learn about our domain and customers are key to your success.
+ You’re an analytics professional Yes, if you have 5+ year experience delighting decision makers with your analytical skills. SQL is a must, Python scripting is a strong plus.
+ Obsess over creating value for advertisers Yes, if you believe output does not equal outcome and judge success by value creation.
+ You get (and create) energy by working with others Yes, if you can translate technical information into language anyone can understand. You enjoy working with both data and people.


It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
You are

  • have a Master in Econometrics, Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics, Mathematics or a comparable degree;
  • have 0– 1 years of experience in Data-Consulting and have strong analytical skills;
  • are excited about big data, predictive analysis, process mining and continuous improvement;
  • are fluent in English and Dutch (pre);
  • have experience with SQL or Python;
  • like drinking beers as much as you like statistics.

You will be

  • analysing large data sets to optimise business processes through process mining;
  • creating value for our clients by building automated workflows and predictive models;
  • building business cases and presenting them to our clients;
  • receiving training in process mining (and get certified!);
  • spending your Friday afternoon in Witte de With;

Title: Data Analyst / Analytics Expert
Description:
Company Overview

Join WorldACD, a thriving and dynamic data company with 20+ employees on the forefront of the air cargo industry. We are expanding and seek highly motivated individuals to be part of our growing team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our data team. Based in the vibrant center of Amsterdam, WorldACD operates in a fascinating international environment, collecting, analyzing, and publishing market data about air cargo worldwide. As the world's largest air cargo market database manager, we are ambitious to further grow our benchmark information services and product portfolio, serving customers on all continents and engaging with diverse cultures. 

 

Position Overview

We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist / Analyst who is passionate about delivering the best possible market data on worldwide air cargo in all its colours and flavours. You will need to be eager to explore large datasets and find meaningful patterns. You will need to keep an overview, but also enjoy taking a deep dive without getting lost in the details. Even when the topic is complicated, you should be able to convey your insights in a clear story for colleagues and/or customers, making use of analytics & visualizations as necessary. 

 

Responsibilities

Production of market data: analyse trends, monitor data quality, investigate & solve data issues.
Participate in product development by exploring data, creating proof-of-concepts.
Support colleagues and customers in making optimal use of the data; Support new customers in delivering the best possible inputs according to our definitions.




Qualifications 

Master’s degree in Econometrics, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering or a related field. A high score in the quantitative subjects is very helpful.
Passion for analytics and business intelligence.
Structured, analytical approach to problem-solving and a high attention to detail.
Experience with SQL and one or more Business Intelligence tools, but also a Microsoft Excel expert.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.

 

Benefits  

Active in a fascinating & dynamic international environment.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Serving customers on all continents, dealing with a wide variety of cultures.
Working for a growing company, ambitious to further grow its benchmark information services and products. portfolio.
Office in the city center of Amsterdam.

 

How to Apply

If you are passionate about data and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply for this position at WorldACD. Please submit your resume and a (short) cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are a good fit for the role before Tuesday April 22nd. Speaking Dutch is not required, but it is required to live in the Netherlands within 1 hour traveling time to Amsterdam Central Station when you apply for this role. We look forward to hearing from you!

Show more
HTML:
Company Overview

Join WorldACD, a thriving and dynamic data company with 20+ employees on the forefront of the air cargo industry. We are expanding and seek highly motivated individuals to be part of our growing team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our data team. Based in the vibrant center of Amsterdam, WorldACD operates in a fascinating international environment, collecting, analyzing, and publishing market data about air cargo worldwide. As the world's largest air cargo market database manager, we are ambitious to further grow our benchmark information services and product portfolio, serving customers on all continents and engaging with diverse cultures. 

 

Position Overview

We are looking for a skilled Data Scientist / Analyst who is passionate about delivering the best possible market data on worldwide air cargo in all its colours and flavours. You will need to be eager to explore large datasets and find meaningful patterns. You will need to keep an overview, but also enjoy taking a deep dive without getting lost in the details. Even when the topic is complicated, you should be able to convey your insights in a clear story for colleagues and/or customers, making use of analytics & visualizations as necessary. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Production of market data: analyse trends, monitor data quality, investigate & solve data issues.
  • Participate in product development by exploring data, creating proof-of-concepts.
  • Support colleagues and customers in making optimal use of the data; Support new customers in delivering the best possible inputs according to our definitions.


Qualifications 

  • Master’s degree in Econometrics, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering or a related field. A high score in the quantitative subjects is very helpful.
  • Passion for analytics and business intelligence.
  • Structured, analytical approach to problem-solving and a high attention to detail.
  • Experience with SQL and one or more Business Intelligence tools, but also a Microsoft Excel expert.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.

 

Benefits  

  • Active in a fascinating & dynamic international environment.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Serving customers on all continents, dealing with a wide variety of cultures.
  • Working for a growing company, ambitious to further grow its benchmark information services and products. portfolio.
  • Office in the city center of Amsterdam.

 

How to Apply

If you are passionate about data and thrive in a dynamic, collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply for this position at WorldACD. Please submit your resume and a (short) cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are a good fit for the role before Tuesday April 22nd. Speaking Dutch is not required, but it is required to live in the Netherlands within 1 hour traveling time to Amsterdam Central Station when you apply for this role. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analist, Tilburg
Description:
Vacature Data Analist

Fixami Nederland: een e-commerce organisatie en hét adres voor de verkoop van gereedschap en verf aan professionals en thuisklussers. Met onze eigen webwinkels en via marketplaces zijn wij actief in Nederland (marktleider met Gereedschapcentrum), België en Frankrijk. Om de groei op de juiste manier te kunnen blijven ondersteunen zijn we continue bezig met innovatie en optimalisatie van onze techniek en organisatie. Dit kunnen we natuurlijk alleen bereiken met de juiste mensen. We zijn daarom opzoek naar een gepassioneerde data analist die ons kan helpen bij de BI-roadmap met als uiteindelijke doel het worden van een compleet data gedreven organisatie.

Dit Ga Je Doen Als Data Analist

Als Data Analist bij Fixami Nederland speel je een belangrijke rol in het ontdekken van inzichten die onze zakelijke beslissingen ondersteunen en de prestaties optimaliseren. In samenwerking met het Category Management- , Inkoop- en Marketingteam zet je ruwe data om in concrete aanbevelingen. Jouw werk heeft direct invloed op onze verkoopprestaties, voorraadbeleid, prijsstelling, marge en draagt uiteindelijk bij aan het verbeteren van de klantervaring.

Onze Tech Stack


Data-opslag & verwerking: Google Cloud Platform (CloudSQL, BigQuery, Dataform)
Analytics & tracking: GA4, Google Ads en Bloomreach (CDP)
Datavisualisatie: Tableau, looker Studio & Grafana
Samenwerking & rapportage: Microsoft 365 en Google Workspace


Je Bent Als Data Analist O.a. Bezig Met


Het maken van data analyses & inzichten;
Onderhouden en creëren van dashboards om gestelde KPI’s te monitoren.
Ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen en analyses om trends te identificeren, prestaties te voorspellen en verbeteringen aan te bevelen (bv prijsstrategie en voorraadbeleid).
Data inzichten vertalen naar duidelijke en bruikbare adviezen voor stakeholders.
Samenwerking tussen teams & afdelingen;
Samenwerking met de commerciële teams/afdelingen om data gedreven aanbevelingen te kunnen geven ter ondersteuning van de besluitvorming.
Complexe data vertalen naar een eenvoudige en begrijpbare inzichten om draagvlak bij de stakeholders te creëren.
Nauwe samenwerking binnen het BI-team om databronnen te verfijnen, de kwaliteit van data te waarborgen en nieuwe analytische tools of methoden te implementeren.
Continue verbetering;
Het herkennen van kansen om interne processen te verbeteren aan de hand van data-analyses.
Ontwikkelen van gestandaardiseerde rapportages en real-time dashboards die snelle besluitvorming mogelijk maken.
Actief volgen van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen op het gebied van analytische technologieën zodat we als organisatie voorop (blijven) lopen.

Je Herkent Jezelf In Het Volgende


Afgeronde HBO opleiding in een relevant vakgebied (Business Analytics, Econometrie, Data Science etc.);
Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als analist, bij voorkeur binnen een e-commerce of retail omgeving;
Ervaring met SQL, kennis van Google BigQuery is een vereiste;
Kennis van GA4, Google Ads of andere gerelateerde marketing analytics tools is een pré;
Programeervaardigheden (Python) is een pré;
Sterk probleemoplossend vermogen; je denkt in oplossingen en hebt oog voor optimalisatie;
Je bent bekend met agile werken, ervaring met JIRA is een pré;
Analytisch ijzersterk; je verkrijgt snel inzichten en bent in staat analytische resultaten te vertalen naar meetbare bedrijfsresultaten;
Beheersing van zowel de Nederlandse als de Engelse taal in woord- en geschrift.


Nu is het jouw beurt.

Hebben wij jou overtuigd van deze vacature en wil jij werken bij Fixami in Tilburg? Dan is de beurt nu aan jou. Solliciteer met CV, via of via het contactformulier. Solliciteer je liever via WhatsApp? Dat kan! Loes (contactpersoon voor deze vacature) is bereikbaar via .

Hier lees je meer over onze organisatie en de procedure.

Functie-voorstel

Vragen over werken bij Fixami?

+31 6 28 322 784

Of stuur een WhatsApp bericht

5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55wer

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist




Maak impact met data in de publieke sector! Wil jij met jouw analytische vaardigheden bijdragen aan betere zorg, onderwijs en overheidsdiensten? Bij Van Dam Datapartners zoeken we een Data Analist die data omzet in heldere inzichten en concrete adviezen.




Wat ga je doen?




Analyseren & inzicht bieden: je onderzoekt datasets van gemeenten, zorginstellingen en andere publieke organisaties om maatschappelijke trends en knelpunten te signaleren.
Datavisualisatie & rapportages: je bouwt dashboards en rapportages in tools zoals Power BI, Tableau, Qlik of Cognos, zodat besluitvormers direct aan de slag kunnen met jouw inzichten.
Adviseren & presenteren: je vertaalt data naar duidelijke en overtuigende adviezen en presenteert deze aan opdrachtgevers.
Samenwerken & verbeteren: je werkt in een dynamisch team, waarbij je samen met Data Engineers en BI-specialisten slimme data-oplossingen ontwikkelt.




Wie ben jij?

Minimaal 1 jaar ervaring binnen het publieke domein.
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met het analyseren van data.
Kennis van datavisualisatie, statistiek en SQL.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden: je kunt complexe analyses eenvoudig uitleggen.
Je houdt van een uitdaging en voelt je thuis in een dynamische commerciële omgeving.
Je bent proactief en neemt het initiatief om met klanten in gesprek te gaan, zowel op inhoud als op de relatie. Je signaleert kansen en zoekt samen naar de beste oplossingen.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Je komt te werken bij een ambitieuze organisatie, waar je samen met een enthousiast team werkt aan projecten die ertoe doen.




Een marktconform salaris (€ 3.750 – €5.500 bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week), afhankelijk van jouw werkervaring;
8% vakantiegeld;
NS-Business Card of reiskostenvergoeding (€ 0,23 per km);
Een laptop en telefoon;
25 vakantiedagen;
De mogelijkheid om (maximaal 5) dagen bij te kopen of te verkopen;
Pensioenregeling bij Nationale Nederlanden;
Een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,40 per dag en de mogelijkheid om een thuiswerkplek in te richten;
Toegang tot de Academy en de mogelijkheid om een persoonlijk opleidingsprogramma samen te stellen.




Heb je nog vragen, dan mag je altijd contact met ons opnemen via werkenbij@vandamdatapartners.nl.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij een gedreven Data Analist met een passie voor de financiële wereld die graag de cruciale rol heeft in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar het worden van meer data-driven? Wil je impact hebben door data te vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten en besluitvorming? Dan is deze rol als Data Analist binnen onze organisatie iets voor jou!




Data Analist




Als Data Analist speel je een cruciale rol in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar data-gedreven organisaties. Je identificeert de informatiebehoeften van de business en vertaalt deze naar relevante data-oplossingen. Met jouw technische expertise verzamel en analyseer je data en zet je deze om in waardevolle inzichten.

In jouw rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het integreren van klantdata met andere databronnen en het omzetten van deze gegevens in actionable insights. Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert zowel nieuwe als bestaande dashboards die onze opdrachtgevers ondersteunen. Hierbij identificeer je nieuwe databronnen, valideer je de verzamelde data en presenteer je deze op een overzichtelijke manier. Dankzij jouw analyses en inzichten kunnen onze opdrachtgevers hun proposities en processen verder verbeteren.

Je werkt nauw samen met je eigen team en diverse teams bij onze opdrachtgevers, waarbij je hen ondersteunt en adviseert op zowel tactisch als strategisch niveau.




Wat bieden we jou?




Jouw gedrevenheid binnen Novisource wordt beloond. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien. Jij bent daarin altijd in de lead! Naast vakinhoudelijke opleidingen bieden wij ook cursussen en trainingen op het gebied van diverse methodieken en vaardigheden aan. Daarnaast:

Een salarisrange van € 4.500,- tot € 6.500,- bruto per maand (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring) en een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling
Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget
Laptop, vaste onkostenvergoeding en telefoonvergoeding
Direct een vast dienstverband
Leaseauto of reiskostenvergoeding
Verbinding is één van onze kernwaarden, we investeren dus gedurende het hele jaar in inhoudelijke, inspirerende en vooral leuke events
Een hybride werk cultuur. We vinden elkaar zeker op ons gezellige kantoor in Amsterdam (vlakbij station Bijlmer Arena), maar stimuleren eigen verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit




Wat neem je mee?




Je bent nieuwsgierig van aard, denkt graag in oplossingen en bent resultaat gedreven. Uiteraard heb je een goed ontwikkeld organisatiebewustzijn en daarnaast neem jij onderstaande mee:

HBO/WO gediplomeerd
Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring binnen de financiële dienstverlening op het gebied van data
Je hebt een sterk analytisch denkvermogen en bent communicatief vaardig
Je hebt eerder gewerkt in een Scrum/Agile omgeving (sterke pré)
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift
Aantoonbare ervaring met de financiële sector
Ervaring met het werken binnen multidisciplinaire teams




Over Novisource

Novisource is een kleinschalige, ambitieuze en persoonlijke consultancy-organisatie. We bemiddelen intelligente, gedreven en gepassioneerde consultants die meebouwen aan de (digitale) verandering van morgen. Vooralsnog met name in de financiële sector, maar we werken hard aan uitbreiding van onze klantenportefeuille. We geloven dat onze expertises ook in andere sectoren hard nodig zijn en willen zo meer diversiteit bieden aan onze consultants wat betreft werkomgeving en opdrachten.

Daarnaast zitten we als organisatie zelf ook in een veranderproces, waarin we professionaliseren om de volgende stap te kunnen zetten in kwaliteit, zowel richting onze mensen als richting onze klanten. Houd je van ondernemen, meebouwen, de dynamiek die hoort bij groei en van direct verschil en resultaat zien van het werk dat je doet?

Dan is deze rol geknipt voor jou.

Show more

Je werkt nauw samen met je eigen team en diverse teams bij onze opdrachtgevers, waarbij je hen ondersteunt en adviseert op zowel tactisch als strategisch niveau.


Wat bieden we jou?


Jouw gedrevenheid binnen Novisource wordt beloond. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien. Jij bent daarin altijd in de lead! Naast vakinhoudelijke opleidingen bieden wij ook cursussen en trainingen op het gebied van diverse methodieken en vaardigheden aan. Daarnaast:

  • Een salarisrange van € 4.500,- tot € 6.500,- bruto per maand (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring) en een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling
  • Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget
  • Laptop, vaste onkostenvergoeding en telefoonvergoeding
  • Direct een vast dienstverband
  • Leaseauto of reiskostenvergoeding
  • Verbinding is één van onze kernwaarden, we investeren dus gedurende het hele jaar in inhoudelijke, inspirerende en vooral leuke events
  • Een hybride werk cultuur. We vinden elkaar zeker op ons gezellige kantoor in Amsterdam (vlakbij station Bijlmer Arena), maar stimuleren eigen verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit


Wat neem je mee?


Je bent nieuwsgierig van aard, denkt graag in oplossingen en bent resultaat gedreven. Uiteraard heb je een goed ontwikkeld organisatiebewustzijn en daarnaast neem jij onderstaande mee:

  • HBO/WO gediplomeerd
  • Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring binnen de financiële dienstverlening op het gebied van data
  • Je hebt een sterk analytisch denkvermogen en bent communicatief vaardig
  • Je hebt eerder gewerkt in een Scrum/Agile omgeving (sterke pré)
  • Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met de financiële sector
  • Ervaring met het werken binnen multidisciplinaire teams


Over Novisource

Novisource is een kleinschalige, ambitieuze en persoonlijke consultancy-organisatie. We bemiddelen intelligente, gedreven en gepassioneerde consultants die meebouwen aan de (digitale) verandering van morgen. Vooralsnog met name in de financiële sector, maar we werken hard aan uitbreiding van onze klantenportefeuille. We geloven dat onze expertises ook in andere sectoren hard nodig zijn en willen zo meer diversiteit bieden aan onze consultants wat betreft werkomgeving en opdrachten.

Daarnaast zitten we als organisatie zelf ook in een veranderproces, waarin we professionaliseren om de volgende stap te kunnen zetten in kwaliteit, zowel richting onze mensen als richting onze klanten. Houd je van ondernemen, meebouwen, de dynamiek die hoort bij groei en van direct verschil en resultaat zien van het werk dat je doet?

Dan is deze rol geknipt voor jou.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Do you want to help us on our journey to build the ultimate online playground?

Hey - we're Poki! We're a tech scale-up on a mission to create the ultimate online playground . Currently, more than 90 million monthly players around the world come to us for easy access to the best games, created by our thriving game developer community consisting of 500+ game developer teams. We're always looking for new insights and opportunities to increase the value we offer to players and game developers, and so we’re looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst.

What This Role Is About

Poki is a multisided platform designed so players from all over the world have easy and free access to the best games, while our game developer community is able to generate earnings. The developers release their games through our platform, Poki for Developers, where they can test, iterate and evaluate their games. In order to monetise the games we work with a select group of advertisers, ensuring quality advertisements on the playground.

Our analysts are responsible for providing the rest of the team with opportunities. Through actionable insights they help both the internal team, and our game developers to grow and create business value from petabytes of raw data.

Your Challenge As a Business Intelligence Analyst At Poki


Grow our player base by improving the efficiency of our marketing. Look into the ways that players find us so we can double down on what works and improve what doesn’t.
Help the team talking to game developers to understand what games to focus on. Which games can grow our playground. And do we serve the needs of our players when it comes to content.
Find ways to improve the value we deliver to our players on the playground. Help to improve the discoverability of games by evaluating common patterns and understanding how we can make the experience better.
Spot opportunities to improve our monetisation logic. We control the timing and placement of advertisements. Look into the monetisation patterns for different segments of players and help to find the right balance between play and ads.


You Could Be Our Business Intelligence Analyst If


You’re a critical thinker, and have 4+ years experience as an analyst
You’re business savvy, and eager to optimize for performance
You’re curious to understand the complex dynamics of a multi-sided platform (balancing the needs of players, game developers, and advertisers).
You have experience with structuring data with SQL (BigQuery, Snowflake or similar products).
You have experience with data visualization (Lookerstudio, Tableau or similar products).
You are based in The Netherlands, and able to work on-site regularly at our office in Amsterdam.


Why Work At Poki


Direct impact on the experience of our community of 500+ game developers, and our 90 million monthly players.
A lot of personal responsibility and freedom, plus the chance to work together with a diverse, international, talented and self-motivated team.
Play is how we learn; we make sure everyone is being challenged and and offer an annual training budget.
Opportunity to connect with colleagues through work retreats, drinks every Thursday and team activities.
A full time contract and opportunity to join our Employee Participation Plan
A hybrid work environment that includes a vibrant office environment with catered lunch, flexible working hours, work from home budget, and travel costs covered for those living outside of Amsterdam.


Are you curious? You may very well be our next Business Intelligence Analyst, so hit apply and tell us more about yourself!
Show more

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
Get acquainted with Eurofiber: the lifeline for the digital society. We consider it as our responsibility to help shape the digital society of the future and steer it in the right direction. Thanks to our connectivity and cloud solutions we ensure, among other things, that critical organizations, such as hospitals, schools and government agencies, are always up and running.




Job Description

As Commercial Data Analyst at Eurofiber, you'll be at the heart of driving commercial success across our organization. This pivotal role serves as the crucial link between sales and marketing teams, leveraging your analytical skills to optimize performance and identify growth opportunities.

As a self-motivated and proactive individual, you'll manage multiple activities while maintaining a big-picture perspective.

Your ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders, both internally and externally, will be key to aligning and executing commercial plans.

If you're passionate about data-driven decision-making, have a knack for identifying market trends, and thrive in a dynamic environment where your insights can directly impact business growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact at Eurofiber.

You will work in the Marketing Team and work with several international Commercial Business Units.

Core activities & responsibilities

Analyze market trends and customer behavior, leveraging internal and external data sources to improve commercial activities and strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, create data-driven business cases, and support strategic decision-making, including network rollout initiatives.
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to support marketing campaigns, customer retention, and lead generation efforts.
Support marketing and sales with targeted base and prospect selections, along with data-driven insights to optimize campaigns and decision-making.
Perform extensive (geospatial) analytics and statistical modelling on large datasets to identify market/business sector trends, customer buying patterns, etc. to support business, product development, and marketing decisions.
Engage in and develop data science projects that enhance the commercial performance of marketing and sales initiatives (churn prediction, cross-sell prediction, sales optimalization analysis).
Automate data processes, acquire and integrate datasets, and create visualizations to support and enhance data-driven initiatives.




Why you want to work at Eurofiber

Eurofiber gives you confidence. This gives you the freedom to decide for yourself how to do your work and reach your goals together with your colleagues. That’s our guiding principle. You’re in the driver’s seat, so how you develop yourself personally and professionally is up to you. Countless opportunities for you to explore. After all, the better you do, the more we can all achieve together.




This means:

A salary tailored to your talent, a bonus and a 13th month;
Work/life balance;
Actively develop your skills and competences through a wide range of training opportunities;
29 holidays a year with us, based on a 40 hour workweek.




Minimum qualifications

Master's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or another quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience in data analysis and reporting, business intelligence, or business and financial analysis, or a related function, or an advanced degree.
Experience in data visualisation, data modelling, big data analytics and programming languages, like: Python, R, or SQL.
Experience with data analytics and reporting tools, e.g. PowerBI.
Familiarity with MS Office, expert level MS Excel and PowerPoint.
Dutch native and proficient in spoken and written English.




Preferred qualifications

Strong communication, presentation and negotiation skills, including towards senior management.
Ability to self-direct work in an unstructured environment.
Experience with data science and engineering tools, e.g. Azure ML.




READY FOR YOUR NEXT STEP?

We see talent in everyone and believe that Eurofiber is a place where that talent can flourish. Are you ready to join us? Please send us your cv as soon as possible.

Working for Eurofiber means contributing to the digitalization of our society. Being part of an organization that strives to work in a 100% climate-proof and circular way.




DIVERSITY STATEMENT

As the engine of the digital society, we play a vital role in unleashing the full potential of people. At Eurofiber diversity, equity and inclusion are at the core of that potential. Our commitment to these values are vital. We believe that different perspectives within teams help us to provide smart solutions to companies, government bodies and non-profit organizations .Therefore we would love to meet any candidate with unique skills, opinions and ideas. Those who feel free to be themselves, collaborate and learn from others. Whether you're part of our IT or Engineering team, we are looking for new colleagues who live by our core values, and who are willing to carry these out in their daily work.

Show more

As the engine of the digital society, we play a vital role in unleashing the full potential of people. At Eurofiber diversity, equity and inclusion are at the core of that potential. Our commitment to these values are vital. We believe that different perspectives within teams help us to provide smart solutions to companies, government bodies and non-profit organizations .Therefore we would love to meet any candidate with unique skills, opinions and ideas. Those who feel free to be themselves, collaborate and learn from others. Whether you're part of our IT or Engineering team, we are looking for new colleagues who live by our core values, and who are willing to carry these out in their daily work.

Title: Data Analyst/BI Consultant
Description:
Can you turn raw data into actionable insights that drive real decisions? Are you the type who thrives at the crossroads of business and IT, and loves convincing others of the power behind smart data?




We’re looking for a hands-on, curious, and communicative BI Consultant / Data Analyst who wants to make an impact in a fast-changing environment. You’ll be part of a forward-thinking DevOps team where innovation, collaboration, and ownership are key.




What You’ll Be Doing

Building and optimising Power BI dashboards that drive decisions
Designing and managing data models and our data warehouse architecture
Helping steer BI projects from concept to delivery, with visible impact




What You Bring

A degree (HBO/WO) in Computer Science, Data Science, or Technical Business
3–5 years of experience with (Azure) SQL Database & T-SQL
Strong knowledge of ETL (Azure Data Factory), data modelling, and warehousing
Proven skills in Power BI, both front-end visualisations and back-end modelling
Great communication skills; you know how to talk data with tech teams and business users

Nice to have:

Experience with Power Apps, Python, or Agile/Scrum
Knowledge of CCS platform or insurance domain is a plus




If you're excited by the idea of making data come alive and driving business strategy through insights, we’d love to hear from you.




Apply now and be the bridge between data and decisions!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Who we are




The commodity world is complex—it is fast-moving but traditional. These everyday products, from your morning coffee to the grains in your pasta, play a critical role in the global economy and in our daily lives.




Vesper is disrupting the commodity game. We are the fastest-growing commodity intelligence platform, trusted by giants like Nestlé, Unilever, and Danone. We combine cutting-edge AI with real-world data to give our customers the insights they need to win in a volatile market.




What we expect from this role




As our Business Intelligence Analyst, your mission is to derive actionable insights and opportunities from our internal data. There is an emphasis on product and usage behavior, but also financial and commercial data play an important role. You will help us build a smarter, faster business by providing data-informed answers to key questions like “How can we improve our retention?” or “What is our churn risk from certain customer segments?”.




You will partner closely with other teams and play an important role by building automated data pipelines, creating actionable insights while also enabling self-serve analytics to support our strategic and business decision-making.




We are looking for somebody who loves getting “into the data”, improving data-driven decision-making processes, translating business questions into BI solutions, applying analytics rigour to strategic questions and collaborating effectively with others.




If you like to jump on a high-speed train, enjoy all the learnings that come from a rapidly changing environment, get energy from having autonomy and enjoy an environment where decisions are made in a minute, this role might be for you!




What you will be doing




Generate accurate and reliable data insights: break down business problems and turn raw data into actionable insights around user behavior (e.g. customer retention, cost-usage analysis)
Enable data-informed decision making: empower all departments and management to make data-driven decisions by providing relevant automated dashboards, tailor-made insights or self-serve analytics where needed
Build and maintain data infrastructure: develop and optimize ETL pipelines to consolidate data from various raw data sources and integrate them into a unified database
Secure data reliability: ensure data is consistent, accurate and trustworthy – from collection to reporting

What you will bring




2-4 years experience in a role in Business Intelligence, Analytics, or a related field – ideally with previous experience in a fast-paced environment (scale-up, tech or product-driven organisation)
Strong analytical and problem solving skills – you break down complex problems using data and can translate ambiguous business questions into measurable insights
Solid technical foundation — you have proven skills in SQL and Python and are comfortable with data modeling, setting up and managing ETL processes, and database design (ideally with previous experience with Airflow)
Solid stakeholder management skills – you love to say “yes”, but definitely know when to say “no”. You keep everyone in the loop and can create a shared understanding across the team
Excellent communication skills — you speak both “data” and “human” and can work with technical peers and non-technical stakeholders
Business intuition — you understand how different parts of the business connect and how to prioritize what matters most
Autonomy & initiative – you don’t wait to be told what to do. You seek out problems, validate assumptions and propose solutions
An eye for detail — you take pride in clean, accurate data and high-quality wor
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Business Analytics)




What you get




A fast-moving, high-growth environment with plenty of opportunity to learn
Full ownership of your domain, and the trust to shape your role
A collaborative culture that values speed, clarity, and impact
A chance to transform a traditional business impacting every day of our lives
A fantastic location in the city centre of Amsterdam
Great hangouts with brilliant people

Show more
