Title: Business Intelligence -specialist
Description:
Rollen:

Beställaren inom sin grupp på Karolinska, avdelningen Datalager och applikationsutveckling, ska börja göra datauttag för forskning från journalsystemet TakeCare. I arbetet ingår att följa hela processen från förfrågan om datauttag kommer in, till datauttaget är lämnat ut till forskaren. Processen är grovt sätt indelat i följande steg:


Forskaren begär ut ett datauttag. Region Stockholm ser över förfrågan. Gör nödvändig handläggning och tar fram ett beslut om datauttaget kan godkännas.
Ett litet team från Region Stockholm möter forskaren för att gå genom kravlistan. En genomgång av datauttaget görs för att bättre förstå detaljerna.
Datauttaget påbörjas, uttagsansvarig letar upp rätt datamängd i TakeCares databas Intelligence.
Det utvecklas en SQL-kod för att få ut rätt data från Intelligence, SQL-koden granskas, samt uttaget dokumenteras och lämnas ut.


Konsultstöd med rätt kompetens efterfrågas för att bemanna detta viktiga uppdrag. Ett team på ca 5 personer kommer jobba med att utföra datauttag i syfte att lämna ut rätt datamängd till forskare.

Ska-krav:


Mycket god förmåga att förstå och uttrycka sig på svenska i tal och skrift.
Ingenjörsutbildning eller motsvarande.
Minst 5 års erfarenhet med SQL-utveckling
Förståelse för vårddata


Meriterande:


Relevant erfarenhet av att utföra datauttag:
Tillvägagångssättet för att utföra datauttag från en databas.
Förståelse för utmaningar relaterade till jobb med datauttag och hur dessa ska hanteras.
Relevant erfarenhet av att hantera data från journalsystemet TakeCare som källsystem:
Förståelse för den datamängden som finns i TakeCare
Genomförandebeskrivning, innehållande Insikt och förståelse för uppdraget;


Genomförandebeskrivning av vad konsulten anser är viktig framgångsfaktor samt

tillvägagångsättet för att kunna leverera i detta uppdrag som beskrivs i punkt 1.1.3.1

Omfattning och beskrivning av IT-resurs konsulttjänsten.

Var god förklara hur du uppfyller alla kraven.

Omfattning: Minst 50%

Ort: Stockholm

Period: 25-04-2025-31-12-2025 med option på förlängning

Sista ansökningdag: 17-04-2025

Vi presenterar löpande. Om du är intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
Show more
HTML:
Rollen:

Beställaren inom sin grupp på Karolinska, avdelningen Datalager och applikationsutveckling, ska börja göra datauttag för forskning från journalsystemet TakeCare. I arbetet ingår att följa hela processen från förfrågan om datauttag kommer in, till datauttaget är lämnat ut till forskaren. Processen är grovt sätt indelat i följande steg:

  • Forskaren begär ut ett datauttag. Region Stockholm ser över förfrågan. Gör nödvändig handläggning och tar fram ett beslut om datauttaget kan godkännas.
  • Ett litet team från Region Stockholm möter forskaren för att gå genom kravlistan. En genomgång av datauttaget görs för att bättre förstå detaljerna.
  • Datauttaget påbörjas, uttagsansvarig letar upp rätt datamängd i TakeCares databas Intelligence.
  • Det utvecklas en SQL-kod för att få ut rätt data från Intelligence, SQL-koden granskas, samt uttaget dokumenteras och lämnas ut.

Konsultstöd med rätt kompetens efterfrågas för att bemanna detta viktiga uppdrag. Ett team på ca 5 personer kommer jobba med att utföra datauttag i syfte att lämna ut rätt datamängd till forskare.

Ska-krav:

  • Mycket god förmåga att förstå och uttrycka sig på svenska i tal och skrift.
  • Ingenjörsutbildning eller motsvarande.
  • Minst 5 års erfarenhet med SQL-utveckling
  • Förståelse för vårddata

Meriterande:

  • Relevant erfarenhet av att utföra datauttag:
  • Tillvägagångssättet för att utföra datauttag från en databas.
  • Förståelse för utmaningar relaterade till jobb med datauttag och hur dessa ska hanteras.
  • Relevant erfarenhet av att hantera data från journalsystemet TakeCare som källsystem:
  • Förståelse för den datamängden som finns i TakeCare
  • Genomförandebeskrivning, innehållande Insikt och förståelse för uppdraget;

Genomförandebeskrivning av vad konsulten anser är viktig framgångsfaktor samt

tillvägagångsättet för att kunna leverera i detta uppdrag som beskrivs i punkt 1.1.3.1

Omfattning och beskrivning av IT-resurs konsulttjänsten.

Var god förklara hur du uppfyller alla kraven.

Omfattning: Minst 50%

Ort: Stockholm

Period: 25-04-2025-31-12-2025 med option på förlängning

Sista ansökningdag: 17-04-2025

Vi presenterar löpande. Om du är intresserad av ett uppdrag rekommenderar vi att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

Title: Solution Design Analyst - Early Career
Description:
About The Role

Solution Design Analyst - Early Career

We are looking for a Solution Design Analyst with a background in Industrial Management or equivalent to join our team at OSTTRA. This is an early-career role focused on analyzing and improving our client service workflows, particularly within Salesforce. You will work closely with the client services teams to understand and analyze their tasks and processes. You will use data analysis, programming, and AI tools to identify inefficiencies and develop solutions. The position involves working with product development teams to design and implement technology solutions that enhance our operations. If you have a background in industrial management, an interest in finance, statistics and programming, and are keen to apply technology within financial services, we encourage you to apply.

Key Responsibilities


Operational Analysis and Data Gathering: Conduct detailed analyses of client service workflows, particularly within Salesforce, to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, manual processes, and areas ripe for automation and self-service solutions. Gather data, interview stakeholders, and document existing processes. Analyze historical support cases to identify trends and recurring issues, informing optimization strategies.
AI-Driven Analysis and Prototyping: Utilize AI and machine learning tools to analyze data, identify patterns, and develop prototypes for AI-driven solutions. Experiment with generative AI models for data augmentation, synthetic data generation, and automation of insights.
Development and Scripting: Develop scripts and basic applications (e.g., Python) to automate data collection, processing, and reporting. Create proof-of-concept solutions and prototypes to demonstrate feasibility and gather feedback.
Cross-Functional Solution Design Support: Assist in partnering with product development teams and product managers to design and specify technology solutions that optimize identified operational needs. Contribute to the design and enhancement of both central solutions and product-specific features and services. Help develop detailed specifications and documentation to guide technology implementation.
Implementation Support and Testing: Support the implementation of end-to-end solutions, assisting with testing, debugging, and deployment. Analyze solution performance post-implementation, providing feedback and suggestions for iterative improvements.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest AI technologies, automation tools, and software development practices. Participate in training and workshops to enhance technical skills and knowledge.


Qualifications


Master's degree in Industrial management or equivalent background with 0-2 years of relevant experience.
Strong knowledge in finance, statistics, industrial management, or a related field, with a keen interest in technology and its application within financial services.
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify patterns, extract insights from data, and develop effective optimization strategies.
Basic programming skills, particularly in Python, for scripting and automation purposes.
Basic understanding of databases and SQL.
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts, and a willingness to learn and apply AI tools and techniques.
Experience in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Looker).
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with stakeholders and diverse teams.
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and results-driven with a commitment to continuous learning and improvement.
Project management skills, a process-oriented mindset, and an awareness of change management practices.
A foundational understanding of technology, including automation tools and software development processes.


Growth Opportunities

This role provides excellent opportunities for professional growth and development within a dynamic and innovative organization. You will have the chance to work on cutting-edge projects, learn from experienced professionals, and contribute to the optimization of critical business processes.

About OSTTRA

Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.

OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.

Learn more at www.osttra.com.

What’s In It For You?

Benefits

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our Benefits Include


Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries

Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. 

US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf

20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)

Job ID: 309983

Posted On: 2025-04-02

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who isimmediate joinerand want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
Good knowledge of Terraform
Experience in building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
Experience in data modelling and transformation using dbt.
Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms.


Additional Information

Start:Immediate

Location:Stockholm, Sweden

Form of employment:Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

Locations:Stockholm

Note: Please apply only if you are currently residing in Sweden.

Title: Analytiker till PTS
Description:
Vill du vara med och analysera framtidens kommunikation? Som analytiker hos oss får du en central roll i att samla in, bearbeta och analysera information som påverkar allt från bredbandsutbyggnad till internationella jämförelser. Vill du vara med och skapa en tydligare bild av utvecklingen inom bredband, telekom och digitalisering? Då kan det här vara rollen för dig!




Vi jobbar med det alla tar för givet. Att kunna kommunicera. Hos oss får du se till att det fungerar nu och i framtiden. För alla.




Enheten för marknadsanalys och statistik jobbar med att tillgodose myndighetens dataförsörjning. I det ingår att samla in, kvalitetssäkra, förvara, gallra och analysera data, som även publiceras för allmänheten och skickas in för internationellt jämförbara mått. Data som samlas in av enheten utgör grunden för mycket av myndighetens kärnprocesser, som att tilldela stöd, reglera bredbandsmarknaden, tilldela frekvenser och främja bredbandstillgången.




”Jag som kommer att bli din chef heter Bianca Gustafsson Kojo. För mig är det viktigt att visa tillit och ge medarbetarna utrymme att ta ansvar och självständigt driva frågor utifrån sitt ansvarområde. För att stötta dig är det viktigt att jag är tillgänglig och att vi har en bra dialog som baseras på ett informellt samtalsklimat och tydlighet i förväntningar från min sida. Du bidrar med att lyfta vad du behöver för förutsättningar för att göra ett bra jobb och vi arbetar tillsammans för att lyckas med uppdraget och trivas på jobbet.”




Om rollen

Som analytiker på enheten deltar du i, eller leder, datainsamlingar och databearbetningar i syfte att sprida information om marknaden för elektronisk kommunikation. Rapporterna som enheten producerar har ett brett användningsområde, både utanför PTS och internt på myndigheten och insamlade data bidrar i flera av myndighetens kärnprocesser som reglering, spektrumtilldelning och främjande. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår hela processen för statistikinsamling, från behovsinventering och frågeformulering till databearbetning, kvalitetssäkring, analys och rapportskrivning.




Du kommer att ha kontakter internt på myndigheten för att säkerställa att behov av data fångas och presenterar resultat av genomförda insamlingar. Till detta kommer att delta i projekt som drivs från andra avdelningar på myndigheten där din roll blir att förse projekten med den data som behövs. I arbetet ingår även att ha kontakter med externa aktörer, framförallt operatörer, både i kvalitetssäkrande syfte och för att informera, förklara och förankra våra insamlingar.




Om teamet

Enheten består av ett blandat gäng, med en balans mellan män och kvinnor och spridning i åldrar. Vi har både ekonomer, geografer, statsvetare, jurist och statistiker placerade hos oss. Vi stöttar varandra och strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska få möjlighet att utvecklas genom att arbeta med olika frågor och för att leveranssäkra vår verksamhet.




Om dig

För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är samarbetsorienterad och kan lyfta dina egna perspektiv samtidigt som du lyssnar på andras. Du delar aktivt med dig av din kunskap och strävar efter att hitta gemensamma lösningar. Genom att anpassa presentationer av kvantitativa underlag efter målgruppen, både i tal och skrift säkerställer du att budskapet tas väl emot. Vidare är du lösningsorienterad och har förmågan att prioritera ditt arbete självständigt, även när förutsättningarna förändras. Du behåller fokus på leveransen, gör kloka avvägningar mellan tid, kvalitet och resurser samt hittar vägar framåt även i mer intensiva arbetsfaser. För oss är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga, därför kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dessa.




Vi söker dig som har:

Akademisk examen med inriktning mot statistik, statsvetenskap, ekonomi, geografi eller motsvarande.
Flerårig erfarenhet av att bearbeta och analysera data med hjälp av SQL, R, Stata eller liknande.
Erfarenhet av utredningsarbete och analys.
Mycket god förmåga av att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska.




Det är även meriterande om du har:

Erfarenhet av arbete inom offentlig förvaltning.
Erfarenhet av arbete med GIS program (QGIS, ArcGIS, MapInfo, m.m.).
Erfarenhet av datainsamling och/eller kunskap om den nationella statistikproduktionen.




Vårt erbjudande

Vi tar livet på allvar. Hos oss kan du ha ett liv på och utanför jobbet. Mår du bra, mår vi bra. Därför erbjuder vi konkurrenskraftiga löner, flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete. Vi har även generöst friskvårdsbidrag och två friskvårdstimmar varje vecka.




Dessutom får du förmånliga villkor för lunch, semester, föräldraledighet, pension och vid sjukdom. Här kommer du arbeta i moderna aktivitetsbaserade lokaler på Hälsingegatan 38. Som statlig myndighet erbjuder vi en trygg och stabil arbetsmiljö där du kan känna dig säker. Vi skapar morgondagens samhälle och måste ligga i framkant. Hos oss kommer du att växa med uppgifter hela tiden.




Bra att veta

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning om sex månader. Placering i Stockholm med start snarast möjligt enligt överenskommelse.




För att vi ska kunna göra en rättvis och objektiv bedömning av din kompetens ber vi dig att inte inkludera bild, personnummer eller adress i ditt CV. Vi har valt att inte efterfråga personligt brev då vi istället använder urvalsfrågor. Detta för att vi vill lägga fokus på din erfarenhet och kompetens, vilket bidrar till en mer effektiv och rättvis rekryteringsprocess. Tester kommer att ingå i processen. Om du har skyddade uppgifter, vänligen kontakta vår HR-specialist.




För ytterligare information, vänligen kontakta enhetschef Bianca Gustafsson Kojo på bianca.gustafssonkojo@pts.se eller HR-specialist Jessica Petersson på jessica.petersson@pts.se. För frågor relaterade till våra lokala fackliga arbetstagarorganisationer, vänligen maila till saco@pts.se eller st@pts.se.




Välkommen med din ansökan senast 25 april.




Klicka här för att se filmen om oss Vi är PTS

Show more

Rapporterna som enheten producerar har ett brett användningsområde, både utanför PTS och internt på myndigheten och insamlade data bidrar i flera av myndighetens kärnprocesser som reglering, spektrumtilldelning och främjande. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår hela processen för statistikinsamling, från behovsinventering och frågeformulering till databearbetning, kvalitetssäkring, analys och rapportskrivning.


Du kommer att ha kontakter internt på myndigheten för att säkerställa att behov av data fångas och presenterar resultat av genomförda insamlingar. Till detta kommer att delta i projekt som drivs från andra avdelningar på myndigheten där din roll blir att förse projekten med den data som behövs. I arbetet ingår även att ha kontakter med externa aktörer, framförallt operatörer, både i kvalitetssäkrande syfte och för att informera, förklara och förankra våra insamlingar.


Om teamet

Enheten består av ett blandat gäng, med en balans mellan män och kvinnor och spridning i åldrar. Vi har både ekonomer, geografer, statsvetare, jurist och statistiker placerade hos oss. Vi stöttar varandra och strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska få möjlighet att utvecklas genom att arbeta med olika frågor och för att leveranssäkra vår verksamhet.


Om dig

För att trivas i rollen ser vi att du är samarbetsorienterad och kan lyfta dina egna perspektiv samtidigt som du lyssnar på andras. Du delar aktivt med dig av din kunskap och strävar efter att hitta gemensamma lösningar. Genom att anpassa presentationer av kvantitativa underlag efter målgruppen, både i tal och skrift säkerställer du att budskapet tas väl emot. Vidare är du lösningsorienterad och har förmågan att prioritera ditt arbete självständigt, även när förutsättningarna förändras. Du behåller fokus på leveransen, gör kloka avvägningar mellan tid, kvalitet och resurser samt hittar vägar framåt även i mer intensiva arbetsfaser. För oss är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga, därför kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dessa.


Vi söker dig som har:

  • Akademisk examen med inriktning mot statistik, statsvetenskap, ekonomi, geografi eller motsvarande.
  • Flerårig erfarenhet av att bearbeta och analysera data med hjälp av SQL, R, Stata eller liknande.
  • Erfarenhet av utredningsarbete och analys.
  • Mycket god förmåga av att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska.


Det är även meriterande om du har:

  • Erfarenhet av arbete inom offentlig förvaltning.
  • Erfarenhet av arbete med GIS program (QGIS, ArcGIS, MapInfo, m.m.).
  • Erfarenhet av datainsamling och/eller kunskap om den nationella statistikproduktionen.


Vårt erbjudande

Vi tar livet på allvar. Hos oss kan du ha ett liv på och utanför jobbet. Mår du bra, mår vi bra. Därför erbjuder vi konkurrenskraftiga löner, flexibla arbetstider och möjlighet till distansarbete. Vi har även generöst friskvårdsbidrag och två friskvårdstimmar varje vecka.


Dessutom får du förmånliga villkor för lunch, semester, föräldraledighet, pension och vid sjukdom. Här kommer du arbeta i moderna aktivitetsbaserade lokaler på Hälsingegatan 38. Som statlig myndighet erbjuder vi en trygg och stabil arbetsmiljö där du kan känna dig säker. Vi skapar morgondagens samhälle och måste ligga i framkant. Hos oss kommer du att växa med uppgifter hela tiden.


Bra att veta

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning om sex månader. Placering i Stockholm med start snarast möjligt enligt överenskommelse.


För att vi ska kunna göra en rättvis och objektiv bedömning av din kompetens ber vi dig att inte inkludera bild, personnummer eller adress i ditt CV. Vi har valt att inte efterfråga personligt brev då vi istället använder urvalsfrågor. Detta för att vi vill lägga fokus på din erfarenhet och kompetens, vilket bidrar till en mer effektiv och rättvis rekryteringsprocess. Tester kommer att ingå i processen. Om du har skyddade uppgifter, vänligen kontakta vår HR-specialist.


För ytterligare information, vänligen kontakta enhetschef Bianca Gustafsson Kojo på bianca.gustafssonkojo@pts.se eller HR-specialist Jessica Petersson på jessica.petersson@pts.se. För frågor relaterade till våra lokala fackliga arbetstagarorganisationer, vänligen maila till saco@pts.se eller st@pts.se.


Välkommen med din ansökan senast 25 april.


Klicka här för att se filmen om oss Vi är PTS

Title: Analytiker till staben Ekonomisk analys på Finansinspektionen
Description:
Vill du jobba med att utveckla analys av hushåll, företag och det finansiella systemet? Tycker du om att utveckla metoder för analys? Då kan det här jobbet vara för dig.

Om jobbet

Som analytiker på staben Ekonomisk analys arbetar du med fokus på Finansinspektionens (FI) arbete inom makrotillsyn och finansiell stabilitet. Du kommer att delta i och ta fram grundläggande analyser för sårbarheter i hushålls- och företagssektorn samt arbeta med andra typer av fördjupade analyser och rapporter. Dessutom deltar du i arbetet med att ta fram interna promemorior, löpande omvärldsbevakning samt att vara delaktig i analys av makrofinansiella policyfrågor.

I rollen ingår även att vara med och utveckla analysen av finansiella stabilitetsrisker. Det kan till exempel innebära att delta i arbetet med FI:s stabilitetsrapport men även att arbeta med makrofinansiell analys, det vill säga kopplingen mellan den reala ekonomin och det finansiella systemet med fokus på banksektorn och kreditgivning. Dessutom deltar du i arbetet med att effektivisera hantering och användning av data samt utveckla och löpande följa mätbara indikatorer. Du har också nära kontakt med medarbetare på andra delar av myndigheten och kontakter och uppgifter kopplade till internationella organisationer.

Din utbildning och erfarenhet

Vi söker dig som


har akademisk magisterexamen eller högre nivå inom nationalekonomi, finansiell ekonomi eller liknande
är van att presentera och kommunicera analys och slutsatser i tal och skrift
uttrycker dig mycket väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du


har förståelse för ekonomiska analysmetoder
har något års erfarenhet av ekonomiskt analysarbete
har god förståelse för penningpolitik och finanspolitik
har god förståelse för det finansiella systemet och dess koppling till ekonomin
har goda kunskaper i användning av något statistik- och analysprogram.


Om dig

I det här jobbet behöver du


bidra till ett gott samarbete
planera, organisera och prioritera ditt arbete på ett effektivt sätt
vara effektiv även när uppgifterna är rutinartade
ha en god analytisk förmåga och kunna lösa komplexa uppgifter.


Om oss

Finansinspektionen (FI) bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.

På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/

Bra att veta

Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.

Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

Arbetspsykologiska tester kan ingå i rekryteringsprocessen.

På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/lediga-jobb/vi-erbjuder/

En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Sök jobbet

Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis.

Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.

Anställningsform:

Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.

Omfattning:

Heltid

Kontaktperson:

Magnus Karlsson, Enhetschef, 08-408 984 54

Sista ansökningsdag:

2025-04-23
Show more

Title: Global People Data Collector
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

This Is Us

At Scania, we are committed to leveraging data-driven insights to shape the future of our workforce. Our People & Culture (P&C) function plays a critical role in ensuring that data informs strategic decisions, enabling us to create a thriving, inclusive, and high-performing organization. As we continue to enhance our global data capabilities, we are looking for a dedicated Global P&C Data Collector to join our team and contribute to our journey towards data-driven excellence.

Role Summary

As a Global P&C Data Collector, you will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and managing workforce-related data from various geographic locations and multiple sources. You will act as a key link between local data analysts, the global Data Management team, and the global People Analytics team to ensure a comprehensive and accurate understanding of our workforce data. Your work will directly impact Scania’s ability to enhance its People & Culture strategies and make informed business decisions.

Your strong analytical skills and data expertise will be essential in maintaining the integrity, consistency, and accessibility of P&C-related data. You will play a crucial role in optimizing data collection processes, shaping reporting standards, and contributing to data governance frameworks.

Job Responsibilities

Data Collection & Management



Ensure the availability and integrity of P&C-related data by utilizing data architecture knowledge and collection tools.
Collect, consolidate, and format workforce-related data according to defined specifications and requirements.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability while sharing data with authorized stakeholders.



Data Reporting



Support P&C teams by providing clean and enriched data for reporting and analytics.
Develop and share reports in various formats using multiple platforms and tools to facilitate data-driven decision-making.



Data Engineering & Governance



Design and implement data flow processes to improve data collection and management.
Calibrate and modify data as needed to meet evolving business needs.
Contribute to defining data governance policies and specifications for the Data Warehouse.



Collaboration & Continuous Improvement



Work closely with P&C teams, data analysts, IT departments, and data experts to understand data needs and provide necessary support.
Promote standardized work methods and continuous improvement activities in data collection and management.
Share knowledge and best practices through established forums, tools, and learning channels at Scania.



Who You Are



Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proficiency in data collection, analysis, and reporting tools (Excel, HRIS, BI tools).
Possess a solid understanding of business processes and their impact on workforce data and analytics.
Knowledgeable about data models, architectures, and governance structures relevant to People Analytics and reporting.
Excellent communication skills and can present complex data insights in a clear and understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrate accountability, integrity, and ethical behavior in handling sensitive workforce data.
Committed to fostering a culture of learning, development, and continuous improvement.
Higher education or equivalent work experience.
Several years of experience working with workforce-related data in a global or multi-regional context.
Fluent in English.



Scania Offers

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-04-20. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact hiring manager Jana Sklenarova: jana.sklenarova@scania.com

We look forward to your application!

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact hiring manager Jana Sklenarova: jana.sklenarova@scania.com

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and help drive value for our clients. You’ll work with data from various digital channels (online, email, commerce), analyzing and modelling this data to optimize customer experiences and enhance digital performance. You’re passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make personalization work! You work with large data sets and econometric modelling to create actionable insights that help brands drive growth and effectiveness.

Your expertise in data science and statistics allows you to uncover trends and create strategies that directly impact client success. In this role, you’ll design and build predictive models, develop algorithms, and implement end-to-end solutions for our clients. You’re always on top of the latest technologies, like AI, and you love experimenting with new ways to elevate your work.

As part of a small, supportive team, you’ll collaborate on various tasks and occasionally assist with dashboard building. While you bring valuable experience, we support your continuous growth and development in the ever-evolving fields of data science and digital marketing.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyse datasets to generate actionable insights and optimize digital channels
Conduct marketing mix modelling projects together with a team of data scientists
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present insights and recommendations to clients and stakeholders
Stay updated on the latest data science and digital marketing trends



Qualifications:


Experience as a Data Scientist
Understanding of digital marketing data (online, email, commerce)
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and machine learning frameworks
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Fluent in Swedish and English and living in Sweden



What would make you really stand-out:


Documented experience in conducting marketing mix modelling projects
Hands-on experience with AI and machine learning
Experience with digital marketing platforms such as Google Ads, DV360, Adform, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc.



What We Offer:


An international work environment with colleagues from across the globe
A challenging role in a fast-growing market
Plenty of fun at work: table football, table tennis, team events, parties, and more
40 annual well-being hours, on top of 30 annual vacation days
Extensive learning and development opportunities, both in-person and online
A hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, the rest from home
Competitive salary and great benefits
Possibility to work from other EU/EES country up to 30 days per year
Opportunity to spend time on yourself during working hours; 40h wellbeing time and 40h personal development
Possibility to work 1 h less per day during summer (8-week period)
Collective agreements
30 days holiday entitlement



About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

  • 30 days holiday entitlement


About DD & Dentsu

Dentsu Data is Dentsu's center of excellence in data science, research, and business intelligence. Our vision is to become Sweden's leading consultants in data by leveraging data to inspire people-centered transformations that shape society. Our Business Science team offers services in data strategy and consulting, data engineering, business intelligence and advanced modelling (econometrics). DD operates in Stockholm and Gothenburg.

DD is part of Dentsu Sweden AB, which is part of a global communication network with 71,000 employees in more than 145 countries. We offer our employees the opportunity to work with several market-leading brands and exciting customers. Of course, we offer great colleagues, attractive career opportunities, modern benefits, unique and industry-leading talent programs. Here, each individual's strengths are encouraged, and you get the opportunity to be yourself, develop and reach your full potential. In all brands in the Dentsu Group, we are constantly working to develop our employees and leaders, and thus there are good development opportunities both at regional, Nordic and international level. We are happy to tell you more about the above in connection with any interview. All our Swedish companies are environmentally certified according to the Swedish Environmental Base and we work actively with our social and environmental responsibility as an employer and fellow human beings. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At dentsu we believe in the power of diversity. We welcome all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Contact:

We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com.

Location:

Stockholm

Brand:

Dentsu Media

Time Type:

Full time

Contract Type:

Permanent

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Company Description

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.

We are looking for you who isimmediate joinerand want to grow with us!

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

Job Description

We are hiring a Data Engineer to join the Sales & Service value stream within the Data & Analytics team. This value stream delivers digital solutions and processes for marketing, sales, and service operations, enabling exceptional customer and employee experiences.

Role Overview:

The role is focused initially on supporting legacy solutions, facilitating their decommissioning as part of a transition to modern cloud technologies. Once this phase is complete, the role will involve full-stack data engineering from source systems through to visualization using a modern Microsoft Azure-based Lakehouse platform, designed using Medallion architecture. The platform supports a wide range of data applications, including analytics, real-time monitoring, data science, and machine learning.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaborate with the business to define analytics requirements
Design, develop, test, and maintain scalable data solutions on Azure
Participate in decommissioning legacy systems and transitioning to new solutions
Implement robust data pipelines and integrate data from diverse source systems
Ensure that solutions are maintainable, secure, and aligned with business priorities
Work closely with team members during a critical transition phase, especially during May, which requires a higher onsite presence for knowledge transfer and workshops


Qualifications

Key Skills


6–8 years of experience as a Data Engineer
Proven experience as a Cloud Data Engineer or BI Developer
Strong hands-on expertise in:
Azure Databricks
SQL Spark / Python Spark
Azure Data Factory
Azure DevOps
Other relevant Azure services
Deep understanding of Lakehouse architecture and Kimball modeling
Familiarity with BI/DWH development patterns and methods
Experience working in SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) environments
Passion for breaking down complex data challenges into simple, scalable solutions


Additional Information

Position: Data Engineer

Location: Sweden (preferably close to Lund)

Work Mode: Hybrid (minimum 3 days per week onsite)

Number of Openings: 2

Title: Senior IT Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
Job ID: 29676

Would you like to be part in shaping the future organisation through automating processes, generating insights and enabling data-driven decisions?

Are you our new Senior Business Intelligence Analyst? We are now looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to grow as a person in a dynamic environment where you have the opportunity to get exposure to senior level stakeholders.

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Welcome to Technology Business Intelligence and Analytics. You’ll join Group Technology Office, where the Business Intelligence unit ensures transparency and analytics to support data-driven management decisions and provide insights.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, your primary responsibilities will be providing data analytics and developing new BI solutions as well as enhancing existing BI setup:


Develop dynamic dashboards to create valuable insights for senior management and stakeholders across the organisation
Build analytical models and provide data driven scenario/ predictive analysis
Act as a Subject Matter Expert and advisor in strategic initiatives
Solve the puzzle of integrating data sources
Develop processes and governance to ensure the right level of information quality


Furthermore, we expect you to take ownership and collaborate with stakeholders across the organisations.

You will be joining a team scoring the top 10% Employee Satisfaction score across Nordea. Your colleagues are highly competent and motivated group with a great team spirit who are sitting in Stockholm, Copenhagen and Gdynia/ Gdansk.

We offer a full-time employment agreement with various benefits, which may include private health and life insurance, learning opportunities, holiday subsidies, bonuses and many more, depending on the location.

We treasure flexibility. That’s why we offer a hybrid working model, where you can experience both working from our offices and from home.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best- and that we imagine you share with us.

Your interest consists not only in the technical tools, but you also have a natural curiosity in business processes and the data related to it, ensuring we can get the best insights of the data through story telling and user friendly solutions.

Your experience and background:


Academic degree in Data science, Statistics, Finance, Engineering or similar
3+ years’ experience in data modelling, database- and BI tools
Outgoing and eager to learn
Great analytical skills, self-driven and well organized with a keen eye for details and quality
It is seen as an advantage if you have experience with Alteryx and 3+ years experience with Power BI
It is also seen as an advantage if you are experienced in working with finance in financial institutions
Fluent in English, both written and spoken


If it sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 30/04/2025. Please be aware that selection and interviews might be held before last day of application.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

Title: Group Sourcing Data Analyst - Go Beyond Program
Description:
📍 Locations: Sweden, Kista

📅 Start Date: Q3 2025

Take Your Career Beyond the Ordinary

Welcome to GO Beyond—Ericsson’s flagship early-career rotational program designed to develop the next generation of problem solvers, innovators, and changemakers with 1-3 years of experience.

You’ve made an impact in your first role, and now you’re ready for the next challenge—something dynamic, fast-paced, and built for real career growth.

What Will I Be Doing at Ericsson?

You’ll join a team that’s driving change in sourcing and procurement, optimising the processes that support Ericsson’s global operations.

You won’t just oversee projects—you’ll actively contribute to strategic sourcing initiatives and process transformation using the latest AI, automation, and data tools.

As part of your journey, you’ll be trained in Six Sigma to improve project delivery and become skilled at leading transformation efforts that align with Ericsson’s broader business goals.

You’ll have mentors and buddies supporting your development, offering you opportunities to expand your skills and build relationships with senior leaders.

You’ll also learn to connect your work with Ericsson’s strategic vision, contributing to projects that help shape the company’s future.

What Makes GO Beyond Different?


Permanent Role with a 12-month program: Start in Group Sourcing, rotate to another business unit, and return to Group Sourcing as your permanent base.
Global exposure to hands-on transformation projects in sourcing and procurement and learning about other business units in Ericsson.
Lead change management efforts that align with Ericsson's digital strategy.


Your GO Beyond Journey


First 6 months: Work in GFGO Sourcing, learning and contributing to sourcing transformation initiatives, optimising digital processes, and enhancing the efficiency of sourcing strategies.
Next 6 months: Rotate to another business unit to expand your experience, working on broader strategic initiatives and contributing to larger transformation projects.
Permanent Role: After the rotation, return to Group Sourcing to continue making an impact, taking on more responsibility in ongoing projects, and becoming a strategic leader in sourcing.


Who Thrives in This Program?

We are looking for change-makers eager to take ownership and drive transformation. You should have:


1-3 years of experience in project management, procurement, or change management.
A strong ability to work across functions, collaborating with multiple teams to ensure successful project delivery.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
The drive to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt quickly to new challenges.


Why Choose GO Beyond?


Impactful Work: Drive key transformation projects within Ericsson’s sourcing and procurement functions.
Career Growth: Get exposure to senior leaders and develop the skills to advance into procurement, project management, or business transformation leadership roles.
Global Experience: Work with international teams across diverse markets, expanding your professional network and experience.
Clear Progression: Build the foundation for advancement into strategy, procurement, or digital transformation leadership roles.


How To Apply


Click Apply Now and check out our website for more details.
We review applications promptly—expect to hear from us soon!


Application Process:


Recruiter Screening
Online Assessments
Panel Interview
Final Hiring Manager Interview


About The Team

The Sourcing Projects team within Group Sourcing is responsible for leading strategic sourcing projects and driving change management initiatives that enhance procurement processes.

This team comprises cross-functional experts who work across departments to ensure sourcing strategies align with business goals and drive operational excellence.

The team is central in optimising sourcing operations through digital tools, AI, and process automation.

What the Team is Working On:


Leading transformation initiatives within sourcing to make processes more efficient and cost-effective.
Driving change management efforts to support adopting new sourcing systems and digital tools.
Implementing strategic sourcing solutions that support Ericsson’s broader business transformation goals.


Why You Should Work for This Team:

By joining the Sourcing Projects team, you’ll be at the heart of procurement transformation at Ericsson.

You’ll be able to drive high-impact projects that shape how sourcing processes are executed and optimised across the business. If you enjoy the challenge of leading projects, managing change, and working with cross-functional teams to create transformative business solutions, this team will help you grow and make a lasting impact.

https://www.ericsson.com/en/careers/student-young-professionals/early-career-rotation

Why join Ericsson?

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

What happens once you apply?

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

Primary country and city: Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Why This Role Matters

Internal Data & Analytics (IDA) is a centralised data function within the Product Development organisation. Our purpose is to facilitate a move to a decentralised data architecture that will put trustworthy, high-quality, and actionable data in the hands of every Funnel employee. We are expected to have a solid understanding of how our business operates, a strong sense of what our organisation needs, and a proactive mindset.

Our role spans both building software and serving analytics needs. While this role is officially titled "Analytics Engineer," it encompasses responsibilities that go beyond traditional analytics engineering. Depending on priorities, your focus may shift between data engineering, analytics engineering, and descriptive analytics.

We are a relatively new and small team with a lot of room for creativity within our problem space. As part of IDA, you can make a noticeable impact by helping more colleagues leverage analytics in their daily work and driving the data maturity of our organisation forward. Along the way, there will be plenty of opportunities to learn and grow in the fields we operate in—a pursuit we expect and encourage at Funnel.

What You’ll Do

As a team member of IDA, you will operate at the intersection of Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, and Data Platform Engineering. Your key responsibilities include:

Data Engineering


Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines to process and integrate data from other teams and systems into our team infrastructure.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define, document, and implement data governance policies, ensuring compliance and quality.


Data Product Delivery


Model the output of our pipelines into quality data assets that are ready for self-serve analytics.
Act as a technical advisor to teams looking to implement their own data solutions in a federated data ownership model.


Descriptive Analytics


Serve insights and best practices in order to drive adoption of data products and features.


Platform Development


Research and implement modern data engineering best practices (e.g., CI/CD processes, infrastructure as code, quality assurance).
Maintain and improve our architecture to ensure it is best in class and built to last.
Develop an efficient infrastructure on AWS that complies with our data security policies and certifications.


Team Collaboration


Be a willing collaborator, identify opportunities to support others, and offer timely help.
Seek and provide feedback through code reviews, retrospectives, and strategic discussions.
Learn by doing, share knowledge with others, and try out new things that could grow the team's skillset.
Promote the team's achievements, engage with our stakeholders, and drive adoption of our products.


What We’re Looking For


Strong SQL skills and experience building and maintaining data pipelines (ETL/ELT) in a cloud-based environment (e.g., GCP, AWS).
Proficiency in Python for data processing, automation, or API integrations.
Hands-on experience with modern data stack tools (e.g., dbt, Airflow, or similar).
Knowledge of data modelling techniques, particularly for analytics and business intelligence.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work across technical and non-technical teams.
A problem-solving mindset with a passion for delivering actionable insights.
Fluency in English


Nice to Have


Experience with SaaS metrics, product analytics, or revenue data.
Familiarity with Data Mesh principles and federated data ownership.
Understanding of data governance, privacy, and compliance frameworks.
Knowledge of CI/CD workflows and infrastructure as code for data pipelines.
Exposure to BI tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.


What We Offer


A position where you can shape the future of data and analytics within our organisation.
A high level of autonomy and responsibility for those who take initiative.
A collaborative team environment where your opinion matters.
A fast-paced environment with lots of opportunities for practical learning.


What Makes You a Great Match For Funnel

This role is designed for individuals who thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments and are excited about building the foundations of a world-class data organisation. Whether your expertise leans toward Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, or Data Platform Engineering, we believe the breadth of this role will provide ample opportunity to learn, grow, and make an impact.

Learn more about how we are developing our product in this blog post by our CTO, Jonas Björk: Building Funnel’s Data Platform for Marketing Analytics.

Additional Information

At this time, we can only consider applicants who are already located in Stockholm.

Benefits & Perks

We offer a competitive salary along with great benefits. → Take a look at our benefits here.

Office-first

At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays however, we avoid having standing remote days.

Interview Process

We have a 4-step recruitment process for most roles → Get an overview of the steps here.

Inclusiveness

Research shows that many candidates, especially women and individuals from underrepresented groups, may hesitate to apply for a role unless they meet every requirement. If this role excites you and your skills and experiences align, we strongly encourage you to apply. We’re interested in what you can bring, even if you don’t check every box.

About Funnel

Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.

Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.

Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.

All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.

Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.

Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.

Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.

We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

  • Seek and provide feedback through code reviews, retrospectives, and strategic discussions.
  • Learn by doing, share knowledge with others, and try out new things that could grow the team's skillset.
  • Promote the team's achievements, engage with our stakeholders, and drive adoption of our products.

What We’re Looking For

  • Strong SQL skills and experience building and maintaining data pipelines (ETL/ELT) in a cloud-based environment (e.g., GCP, AWS).
  • Proficiency in Python for data processing, automation, or API integrations.
  • Hands-on experience with modern data stack tools (e.g., dbt, Airflow, or similar).
  • Knowledge of data modelling techniques, particularly for analytics and business intelligence.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work across technical and non-technical teams.
  • A problem-solving mindset with a passion for delivering actionable insights.
  • Fluency in English

Nice to Have

  • Experience with SaaS metrics, product analytics, or revenue data.
  • Familiarity with Data Mesh principles and federated data ownership.
  • Understanding of data governance, privacy, and compliance frameworks.
  • Knowledge of CI/CD workflows and infrastructure as code for data pipelines.
  • Exposure to BI tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI.

What We Offer

  • A position where you can shape the future of data and analytics within our organisation.
  • A high level of autonomy and responsibility for those who take initiative.
  • A collaborative team environment where your opinion matters.
  • A fast-paced environment with lots of opportunities for practical learning.

What Makes You a Great Match For Funnel

This role is designed for individuals who thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments and are excited about building the foundations of a world-class data organisation. Whether your expertise leans toward Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, or Data Platform Engineering, we believe the breadth of this role will provide ample opportunity to learn, grow, and make an impact.

Learn more about how we are developing our product in this blog post by our CTO, Jonas Björk: Building Funnel’s Data Platform for Marketing Analytics.

Additional Information

At this time, we can only consider applicants who are already located in Stockholm.

Benefits & Perks

We offer a competitive salary along with great benefits. → Take a look at our benefits here.

Office-first

At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, through the holidays however, we avoid having standing remote days.

Interview Process

We have a 4-step recruitment process for most roles → Get an overview of the steps here.

Inclusiveness

Research shows that many candidates, especially women and individuals from underrepresented groups, may hesitate to apply for a role unless they meet every requirement. If this role excites you and your skills and experiences align, we strongly encourage you to apply. We’re interested in what you can bring, even if you don’t check every box.

About Funnel

Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.

Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.

Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.

All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.

Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.

Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.

Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.

We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

Title: Data Analyst till ICA Sverige
Description:
Vill du vara med och driva datadrivna beslut genom analys och visualisering? Som Data Analyst på ICA Sverige får du arbeta med en av Sveriges största databaser och skapa insikter som påverkar affärsstrategier. Här får du kombinera teknisk skicklighet med affärsförståelse och bidra till att utveckla innovativa lösningar inom dataanalys.

Om jobbet som Data Analyst  

Teamet du kommer jobba i består av ca 30 fantastiska Data Analyst kollegor och tillhör vår Data & Analytics funktion i Solna, men du kommer också arbeta i ett leveransteam med mixade data & analytics roller där man tillsammans stöttar ett av ICAs sponsorsområden – i detta fall Sortiment och Inköp.

  

Du som Data Analyst utgör en kritisk faktor när vi nu tar ICAs datadrivna arbete till nya nivåer och tvärs hela bolaget. I den här tjänsten kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta med en av Sveriges största databaser och utvecklas inom analytiska metoder tillsammans med skickliga, likasinnade kollegor. Du kommer att arbeta med hela värdekedjan inom analys – allt från att definiera behov, samla in, bearbeta och modellera data till visualisering och kommunikation av resultaten. Du kommer att samla data från olika källor och kombinera dessa för att skapa nya möjligheter till insikter och beslut. Vi arbetar med en modern tech stack som bl.a. inkluderar GCP, BigQuery, dbt och Tableau för att skapa innovativa lösningar inom dataanalys.

 

Är du den vi söker?

Vi söker just nu en Data Analyst som har jobbat minst 3 år i en liknande roll. Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av och är trygg med att utveckla i SQL och är van med att arbeta med stora datamängder och kombinerar data från olika källor. Vi ser även att du har erfarenhet av Tableau eller liknande BI visualiseringsverktyg. Det är ett plus om du har erfarenhet av GCP, Looker studio, GitHub, BigQuery och Python.

För att trivas på ICA ser vi att du är en affärsmässig och ansvarstagande person som har en god förmåga att arbeta både detaljorienterat och inta ett helikopterperspektiv. Du har lätt för att inspirera och coacha andra i det du brinner för - data data data! För dig är ingen fråga för stor eller för liten och du räds inte att själv söka svar på frågor i de djupaste av datalager. 

För att vara aktuell för denna roll måste du tala svenska och engelska obehindrat.

Vad händer nu?

Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av rekryterande chef Matilda Davidsson 076 861 77 81, och frågor om processen besvaras av ansvarig rekryterare, Klara Himmelstrand på 072 050 78 44.   

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, dock senast 21/4.  

Vi ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar kompetensbaserad rekrytering. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.




We are looking for Data Modeler cum Data Analyst in Stockholm, Sweden with below expertise:




Job Description

Analyst for Recovery Data monitoring reports in Information capability ART
Able to work independently with defined problems on an average
level within specific platform and competence area Experience
with developing IT solutions able to take partial responsibility for
minor projects Experience in requirements gathering data analysis
data modelling and provide input to solution design Good
knowledge of relevant tools and technology
Most important MODELLING EXPERIENCE




Mandatory Skills : Data Vault (ODS) Modeling, Dimensional Data Modeling, ER Studio, MS SQL Server

Good to Have Skills : ANSI-SQL
