Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Är du en analytisk och teknisk supertalang med ett tydligt affärsfokus i allt du gör? Vill du ta vår marknadsföring och kommunikation till nya höjder med hjälp av data, tillsammans med vårt Growth Data Science Analytics Team? Då är det här jobbet för dig!




Sedan BookBeat grundades år 2015 har data varit en högst central del av vår verksamhet och organisation. Att vi är ett datadrivet företag är tydligt inte bara i hur vi använder data för analys, utan även genom hur data påverkar våra marknadsinvesteringar och marknadsinsatser.




I rollen som Growth Data Analyst kommer du ingå i vårt Growth Data Science Analytics Team. Teamets huvudmål är att med hjälp av data ständigt optimera och förbättra aktiviteter som leder till BookBeats tillväxt. Eftersom vi jobbar korsfunktionellt kommer du även jobba nära marknadsavdelningen, Business Controllers, Performance Marketers och Data Engineers.




Rollen:

Du kommer med hjälp av data och analys jobba med att optimera våra marknadsinvesteringar från olika delar av kundens livscykel. Det handlar om alltifrån hur vi bör investera för att attrahera nya användare till hur vi arbetar med att vinna tillbaka tidigare användare. För oss är det viktigt att det inte bara är våra analytiker som har tillgång till data, utan hela vår organisation. Därför är en del av ditt arbete att skapa dashboards i exempelvis Power BI. Med dina expertkunskaper inom data kommer du även att stötta organisationen med analyser av nya initiativ, främst kopplade till marknad och tillväxt.




För att lyckas i rollen är du en nyfiken och analytisk problemlösare. Du är orädd, har ett entreprenöriellt mindset och kommer gärna med egna idéer. Precis som oss i teamet älskar du data och drivs av att utvecklas och lära dig nya saker. Du trivs i balansen mellan det tekniska och att arbeta fram affärsinsikter.




Vi söker dig som:

har en universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom ett kvantitativt område, t.ex. matematik, statistik, ekonomi eller motsvarande
är en analytisk problemlösare som är van att arbeta med och visualisera stora datamängder
har en god affärsförståelse samt en genuin nyfikenhet för marknadsföring och hur man driver tillväxt. En drivkraft som leder dig till att ständigt utmana gamla sanningar med data!
tycker om att komma på nya, pedagogiska sätt att visualisera data och även har viss erfarenhet av olika visualiseringsverktyg, t.ex. Power BI, Data Studio, Tableau, Qlik Sense och/eller ggplot
är van vid att arbeta korsfunktionellt i en snabbrörlig miljö
har förmåga att omvandla data till affärsinsikter
är bekväm med att jobba självständigt i SQL
har erfarenhet av, eller intresse för, att utvecklas inom Python eller R
kommunicerar på svenska och engelska




Vid eventuella frågor är du välkommen att kontakta BookBeats Growth Data Science Analytics Team Manager Christian Lönnquist på christian.lonnquist@bookbeat.com




Som anställd på BookBeat AB erbjuds du ett förmånspaket som inkluderar:

🌴 30 dagar semester per år

💰 ITP1-tjänstepension

💌 TGL (tjänstegrupplivförsäkring), TFA (trygghetsförsäkring vid arbetsskada) & tjänstereseförsäkring

🎾 Årligt friskvårdsbidrag

🤸‍♂️ Veckovis friskvårdstimme

💻 Arbetsutrustning (dator och telefon) samt abonnemang

🎧 BookBeat prenumeration




Utöver våra förmåner erbjuder vi dig också:

💜 En stabil och hållbar balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi använder flextid och jobbar 37,9 timmar per vecka

🏢 Ett kontor i centrala Stockholm

🏃‍♀️ … inklusive tillgång till ett fullt utrustat gym med bastu! Vi arrangerar också ett gäng roliga aktiviteter med koppling till hälsa och välmående, såsom vår egna springklubb

🏡 Flexibilitet i form av flexibla arbetstimmar och vår hybrid-policy när det kommer till arbete från kontoret/hemmet

🚀 Möjligheten att växa i din roll och karriär, inklusive utmanande och lärorika arbetsuppgifter samt andra möjligheter till utveckling

✨ Roliga aktiviteter tillsammans med dina kollegor! På BookBeat får du ta del av veckovisa "Friday afternoon mingles", månatliga företagsfrukostar och andra härliga arbetsrelaterade aktiviteter regelbundet tillsammans med hela företaget

🧪 Möjligheten att utforska projekt du inte har tid för i ditt dagliga arbete under våra Hack Days

🧠 Kunskapsdelningsmöjligheter, exempelvis under våra veckovisa "Friday demos" tillsammans med hela företaget där olika team delar vad de har jobbat på, jobbar på eller kommer jobba på. Kunskapsdelning är också en viktig del av vårt dagliga arbete!

🐶 Möjligheten att ta med din fyrbenta hundvän till jobbet (och att gosa med hundar på kontoret)! Vi har nyligen introducerat ett hundrum på vårt Stockholmskontor

🤛 (Sist men inte minst) ett härligt och kompetent team och chef som kommer stötta dig genom din anställning!




Om oss

År 2015 påbörjade vi vår resa mot målet att erbjuda Europas ledande tjänst för digitala böcker, och 2016 lanserade vi till allmänheten. Nu, snart 9 år efter vår breda lansering, används BookBeat av över 900 000 användare varje månad. Vi är ett ständigt växande företag inom Bonnierkoncernen och alla medlemmar som är del av vår resa har möjlighet att påverka vår utveckling – både på kort och lång sikt.




Idag består Team BookBeat av 160 nyfikna och engagerade "doers". Är du intresserad av att bli en del av vårt team? Underbart! Våra anställda är experter på många olika områden, men vi har fyra kärnvärderingar som enar oss alla:

🚀 Var fantastisk på det du gör

📣 Dela det du vet och kan

🔎 Nyfikenhet för våra användare och oss

🤝 Bygg Team BookBeat




Med andra ord: vi vill att våra medarbetare kontinuerligt ska djupdyka i och utvecklas inom sina kompetensområden, men också att de delar den kunskapen med sina kollegor – vi är alla del av Team BookBeat och samarbetar (oftast mycket) dagligen! Vi söker också medarbetare som är genuint nyfikna på våra användare samt på vår resa och organisation, en nyfikenhet som driver oss till att alltid testa nya saker i vår tjänst och att låta våra användare visa oss om vi är på rätt väg. Sist men definitivt inte minst vill vi att våra anställda ska bidra till Team BookBeats vardagliga samarbete och välmående – som redan nämnt är vi alla del av ett större team, ett team som vi vill ska må bra och ha kul på jobbet, något vi alla bidrar till på olika sätt.

Show more
HTML:
Är du en analytisk och teknisk supertalang med ett tydligt affärsfokus i allt du gör? Vill du ta vår marknadsföring och kommunikation till nya höjder med hjälp av data, tillsammans med vårt Growth Data Science Analytics Team? Då är det här jobbet för dig!


Sedan BookBeat grundades år 2015 har data varit en högst central del av vår verksamhet och organisation. Att vi är ett datadrivet företag är tydligt inte bara i hur vi använder data för analys, utan även genom hur data påverkar våra marknadsinvesteringar och marknadsinsatser.


I rollen som Growth Data Analyst kommer du ingå i vårt Growth Data Science Analytics Team. Teamets huvudmål är att med hjälp av data ständigt optimera och förbättra aktiviteter som leder till BookBeats tillväxt. Eftersom vi jobbar korsfunktionellt kommer du även jobba nära marknadsavdelningen, Business Controllers, Performance Marketers och Data Engineers.


Rollen:

Du kommer med hjälp av data och analys jobba med att optimera våra marknadsinvesteringar från olika delar av kundens livscykel. Det handlar om alltifrån hur vi bör investera för att attrahera nya användare till hur vi arbetar med att vinna tillbaka tidigare användare. För oss är det viktigt att det inte bara är våra analytiker som har tillgång till data, utan hela vår organisation. Därför är en del av ditt arbete att skapa dashboards i exempelvis Power BI. Med dina expertkunskaper inom data kommer du även att stötta organisationen med analyser av nya initiativ, främst kopplade till marknad och tillväxt.


För att lyckas i rollen är du en nyfiken och analytisk problemlösare. Du är orädd, har ett entreprenöriellt mindset och kommer gärna med egna idéer. Precis som oss i teamet älskar du data och drivs av att utvecklas och lära dig nya saker. Du trivs i balansen mellan det tekniska och att arbeta fram affärsinsikter.


Vi söker dig som:

  • har en universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom ett kvantitativt område, t.ex. matematik, statistik, ekonomi eller motsvarande
  • är en analytisk problemlösare som är van att arbeta med och visualisera stora datamängder
  • har en god affärsförståelse samt en genuin nyfikenhet för marknadsföring och hur man driver tillväxt. En drivkraft som leder dig till att ständigt utmana gamla sanningar med data!
  • tycker om att komma på nya, pedagogiska sätt att visualisera data och även har viss erfarenhet av olika visualiseringsverktyg, t.ex. Power BI, Data Studio, Tableau, Qlik Sense och/eller ggplot
  • är van vid att arbeta korsfunktionellt i en snabbrörlig miljö
  • har förmåga att omvandla data till affärsinsikter
  • är bekväm med att jobba självständigt i SQL
  • har erfarenhet av, eller intresse för, att utvecklas inom Python eller R
  • kommunicerar på svenska och engelska


Vid eventuella frågor är du välkommen att kontakta BookBeats Growth Data Science Analytics Team Manager Christian Lönnquist på christian.lonnquist@bookbeat.com


Som anställd på BookBeat AB erbjuds du ett förmånspaket som inkluderar:

🌴 30 dagar semester per år

💰 ITP1-tjänstepension

💌 TGL (tjänstegrupplivförsäkring), TFA (trygghetsförsäkring vid arbetsskada) & tjänstereseförsäkring

🎾 Årligt friskvårdsbidrag

🤸‍♂️ Veckovis friskvårdstimme

💻 Arbetsutrustning (dator och telefon) samt abonnemang

🎧 BookBeat prenumeration


Utöver våra förmåner erbjuder vi dig också:

💜 En stabil och hållbar balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi använder flextid och jobbar 37,9 timmar per vecka

🏢 Ett kontor i centrala Stockholm

🏃‍♀️ … inklusive tillgång till ett fullt utrustat gym med bastu! Vi arrangerar också ett gäng roliga aktiviteter med koppling till hälsa och välmående, såsom vår egna springklubb

🏡 Flexibilitet i form av flexibla arbetstimmar och vår hybrid-policy när det kommer till arbete från kontoret/hemmet

🚀 Möjligheten att växa i din roll och karriär, inklusive utmanande och lärorika arbetsuppgifter samt andra möjligheter till utveckling

✨ Roliga aktiviteter tillsammans med dina kollegor! På BookBeat får du ta del av veckovisa "Friday afternoon mingles", månatliga företagsfrukostar och andra härliga arbetsrelaterade aktiviteter regelbundet tillsammans med hela företaget

🧪 Möjligheten att utforska projekt du inte har tid för i ditt dagliga arbete under våra Hack Days

🧠 Kunskapsdelningsmöjligheter, exempelvis under våra veckovisa "Friday demos" tillsammans med hela företaget där olika team delar vad de har jobbat på, jobbar på eller kommer jobba på. Kunskapsdelning är också en viktig del av vårt dagliga arbete!

🐶 Möjligheten att ta med din fyrbenta hundvän till jobbet (och att gosa med hundar på kontoret)! Vi har nyligen introducerat ett hundrum på vårt Stockholmskontor

🤛 (Sist men inte minst) ett härligt och kompetent team och chef som kommer stötta dig genom din anställning!


Om oss

År 2015 påbörjade vi vår resa mot målet att erbjuda Europas ledande tjänst för digitala böcker, och 2016 lanserade vi till allmänheten. Nu, snart 9 år efter vår breda lansering, används BookBeat av över 900 000 användare varje månad. Vi är ett ständigt växande företag inom Bonnierkoncernen och alla medlemmar som är del av vår resa har möjlighet att påverka vår utveckling – både på kort och lång sikt.


Idag består Team BookBeat av 160 nyfikna och engagerade "doers". Är du intresserad av att bli en del av vårt team? Underbart! Våra anställda är experter på många olika områden, men vi har fyra kärnvärderingar som enar oss alla:

🚀 Var fantastisk på det du gör

📣 Dela det du vet och kan

🔎 Nyfikenhet för våra användare och oss

🤝 Bygg Team BookBeat


Med andra ord: vi vill att våra medarbetare kontinuerligt ska djupdyka i och utvecklas inom sina kompetensområden, men också att de delar den kunskapen med sina kollegor – vi är alla del av Team BookBeat och samarbetar (oftast mycket) dagligen! Vi söker också medarbetare som är genuint nyfikna på våra användare samt på vår resa och organisation, en nyfikenhet som driver oss till att alltid testa nya saker i vår tjänst och att låta våra användare visa oss om vi är på rätt väg. Sist men definitivt inte minst vill vi att våra anställda ska bidra till Team BookBeats vardagliga samarbete och välmående – som redan nämnt är vi alla del av ett större team, ett team som vi vill ska må bra och ha kul på jobbet, något vi alla bidrar till på olika sätt.

Title: Insight Consultant – Stockholm
Description:
The role

We are looking for Insight Consultants to strengthen our Managed Services team at Cambri, based in either Helsinki or Stockholm. 

In this role, you’ll contribute to delivering high-quality insights that help some of the world’s largest FMCG companies improve their product innovation outcomes. You’ll work closely with data, technology, and people - combining analysis, collaboration, and project management to make a real impact. 

What You’ll Do

As an Insight Consultant, you will play a key role in helping global FMCG companies improve their innovation outcomes by turning data into meaningful business decisions. Drawing on your experience in insights, analytics, and project management, you’ll deliver measurable impact to leading brands. 


Use your analytical and communication skills to lead projects that influence the product strategies of global FMCG leaders. 
Transform complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive successful innovation and product development. 
Apply AI-powered tools to help clients increase their innovation success rate and reduce time to market. 
Work cross-functionally to ensure projects are delivered efficiently on time, and to a high standard—enhancing client satisfaction and retention. 
Contribute to scaling a modern consultancy model within a fast-growing SaaS company by improving how we deliver value at scale. 
Report to the Head of Managed Services and actively shape Cambri’s approach to insight delivery and client success. 


What's Important In This Role


2–5 years’ experience in market research, consulting, or FMCG insights.
Proficient in English (written and spoken).
Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, engineering, or similar.


What We Value

We’re looking for someone who is:


Analytical and structured in problem-solving.
Curious about consumer behavior and data-driven innovation.
Collaborative and effective in team settings.
Organised and detail-oriented in project delivery.
Driven and self-motivated.
Client-focused, with strong communication skills
Proficient in MS Excel and PowerPoint; familiarity with R/Python/SPSS is a plus.


Our company and its mission:

"We help consumer brands to bring new products successfully to market."

Cambri’s mission is to reduce waste from people’s lives and the planet by helping companies to avoid launching products that do not have a true consumer need.

Cambri is a rapidly growing SaaS start-up setting a new standard for agile product innovation and consumer insights. Cambri’s clients include well-known international consumer brands such as Carlsberg, Nestlé, Electrolux, Valio and Fiskars.

Insights, product and brand teams use Cambri’s AI powered platform throughout the innovation process to test often, learn fast, and bring winning ideas to the market. We help companies improve their innovation success and to only launch successful products!

Cambri has about 50 devoted team members based in Finland, Sweden, the UK, and the US.

Internally, we encourage an open, collaborative, inclusive working environment. We follow our values Ambition, Velocity, One Team, Impact and Curiosity to fulfill our mission.

We’re hiring ambitious team players to help us transform how consumer insights can contribute to more efficient and successful innovation. Join us!

Title: Junior Analytics Engineer
Description:
IPercept Technology AB

Job Title:  Junior Analytics Engineer

Job Type: Starting with an internship, with the potential to turn into full-time employment

Location: Stockholm, Sweden 

Job Summary

We are looking for a motivated Junior Analytics Engineer to join our team, starting as an intern with the opportunity to transition into a full-time role in the summer. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent graduate or a final-year MSc student in Mechatronics/Mechanical/Vehicle Engineering or similar with a strong technical background and a passion for analytics in mechanical and production systems.

We are looking for someone with a keen interest and knowledge in the following areas: 

What You’ll Do


Work with mechanical systems and production machinery data
Develop analytics solutions using Python and signal processing techniques (FFT, filters, etc.)
Assist in extracting insights from machine data to improve efficiency and performance
Collaborate with engineers to enhance data-driven decision-making


Must-haves 


Knowledge of mechanical systems  
Understanding of production machinery
Python 
Signal Processing (FFT, Filters, etc.) 


Nice to have


Software Engineering Fundamentals
SQL


What’s in it for you?   


Being a young company it’s all about the people - we’re a bunch of passionate and driven people with whom you will have a great time.   
Psychological safety and internal trust - flexible working hours, high expectations combined with a humane approach to work/life balance.  
Flat organization - we hire you because we believe in you. So challenge what we take for granted, express yourself and wear what you always dreamed of wearing to work, have fun, participate and make this the company you always dreamed of working for. 


How To Apply   

Submit a resume and cover letter outlining your interest and relevant experience

About IPercept

Imagine knowing the mechanical health of a machine without touching it, being alerted well in advance before something breaks, understanding how a machine is truly being used, and identifying what needs attention on a component level before visiting the machine.

At IPercept, we make this possible. Our insights help manufacturers understand their machines’ true state and usage throughout the machine life-cycle, achieving a 30% increase in efficiency. This quick ROI is realized by minimizing downtime, enhancing productivity, and reducing scrap rates, tooling costs, maintenance parts, and energy consumption.

In just two years, over 20 of Europe’s largest manufacturers have trusted us, and none have looked back.

We look forward to seeing your application!

/ IPercept Team

Title: Sustainability Analyst
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

As the Sustainability Analyst you will report to our Head of Sustainability and collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders to drive the development and implementation of our global sustainability strategy and communication, work proactively to ensure sustainability performance and compliance with environmental regulations and industry standards, and contribute to building the Voi brand sustainability content. This will include:




Sustainability strategy: Collaborate closely with the Head of Sustainability and other colleagues to define and implement Voi’s sustainability strategy, including optimising resource use to reduce environmental impact, and drive progress to position Voi as a global leader in sustainability.
Monitoring & supporting change: Work continuously to stay up to date on sustainability related regulations, industry peer activity, academic research, assess risk associated with the sustainability goals, and initiate and support change initiatives to achieve key sustainability goals.
Data collection: Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to collect data related to sustainability metrics, e.g. carbon emissions, energy consumption and waste management, ensuring transparency, traceability, accountability and compliance with regulations, e.g. CSRD, CBAM and the EU taxonomy.
Analysis & reporting: Analyse data and develop recommendations for sustainability management and sustainability performance reports.
Communication: Support the sustainability-, tender-, investor relations- and marketing teams in crafting and delivering the Voi sustainability narrative based on the strategic sustainability direction and progress.




WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK

We’re looking for an analytical, thorough and solution oriented sustainability professional, with the ability to manage and sanity check large data sets, and collaborate efficiently with diverse stakeholders. Apart from being fluent in English, self-sufficient and goal-oriented, we believe the right person has:




B.Sc. in Engineering or Business, preferably with a sustainability specialisation
Experience from management consulting, sustainability consulting or a similar position in a fast-paced dynamic environment
Experience from managing data collection, data analysis and projects with multiple stakeholders
Experience from working with large data sets and data bases, experience using SQL and python is a merit
Experience of sustainability-, CSR or ESG controlling/reporting, industry standards (e.g. GRI, CSRD) and environmental management system (e.g.ISO 14001) is a merit
Experience with sustainable procurement and audits of external suppliers is a merit




WHY VOI?

Working at Voi is more than just a job; Our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:




Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Have a direct impact on Voi’s sustainability strategy, brand sustainability content and position as a global leader in sustainability
Collaborate with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution




Are you ready to become a Voiager?

Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.




Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy & Management (Private & Business Banking)
Description:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.

As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunar’s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.

What will you do?

Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.

Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.

Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.

Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.

Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.

Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).

Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).

Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.

Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.

Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.

Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.

Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Show more
HTML:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.

As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunar’s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.

What will you do?

  • Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.

  • Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.

  • Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.

  • Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.

  • Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.

Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

  • 3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).

  • Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).

  • Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.

  • Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.

  • Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.

  • Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.

  • Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.

Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Solution Design Analyst - Early Career
Description:
About The Role

Solution Design Analyst - Early Career

We are looking for a Solution Design Analyst with a background in Industrial Management or equivalent to join our team at OSTTRA. This is an early-career role focused on analyzing and improving our client service workflows, particularly within Salesforce. You will work closely with the client services teams to understand and analyze their tasks and processes. You will use data analysis, programming, and AI tools to identify inefficiencies and develop solutions. The position involves working with product development teams to design and implement technology solutions that enhance our operations. If you have a background in industrial management, an interest in finance, statistics and programming, and are keen to apply technology within financial services, we encourage you to apply.

Key Responsibilities


Operational Analysis and Data Gathering: Conduct detailed analyses of client service workflows, particularly within Salesforce, to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, manual processes, and areas ripe for automation and self-service solutions. Gather data, interview stakeholders, and document existing processes. Analyze historical support cases to identify trends and recurring issues, informing optimization strategies.
AI-Driven Analysis and Prototyping: Utilize AI and machine learning tools to analyze data, identify patterns, and develop prototypes for AI-driven solutions. Experiment with generative AI models for data augmentation, synthetic data generation, and automation of insights.
Development and Scripting: Develop scripts and basic applications (e.g., Python) to automate data collection, processing, and reporting. Create proof-of-concept solutions and prototypes to demonstrate feasibility and gather feedback.
Cross-Functional Solution Design Support: Assist in partnering with product development teams and product managers to design and specify technology solutions that optimize identified operational needs. Contribute to the design and enhancement of both central solutions and product-specific features and services. Help develop detailed specifications and documentation to guide technology implementation.
Implementation Support and Testing: Support the implementation of end-to-end solutions, assisting with testing, debugging, and deployment. Analyze solution performance post-implementation, providing feedback and suggestions for iterative improvements.
Continuous Learning: Stay up-to-date with the latest AI technologies, automation tools, and software development practices. Participate in training and workshops to enhance technical skills and knowledge.


Qualifications


Master's degree in Industrial management or equivalent background with 0-2 years of relevant experience.
Strong knowledge in finance, statistics, industrial management, or a related field, with a keen interest in technology and its application within financial services.
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify patterns, extract insights from data, and develop effective optimization strategies.
Basic programming skills, particularly in Python, for scripting and automation purposes.
Basic understanding of databases and SQL.
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts, and a willingness to learn and apply AI tools and techniques.
Experience in data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Excel, Looker).
Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with stakeholders and diverse teams.
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and results-driven with a commitment to continuous learning and improvement.
Project management skills, a process-oriented mindset, and an awareness of change management practices.
A foundational understanding of technology, including automation tools and software development processes.


Growth Opportunities

This role provides excellent opportunities for professional growth and development within a dynamic and innovative organization. You will have the chance to work on cutting-edge projects, learn from experienced professionals, and contribute to the optimization of critical business processes.

About OSTTRA

Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.

OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.

Learn more at www.osttra.com.

What’s In It For You?

Benefits

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our Benefits Include


Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries

Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. 

US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf

20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)

Job ID: 309983

Posted On: 2025-04-02

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

Title: Senior IT Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
Job ID: 29676

Would you like to be part in shaping the future organisation through automating processes, generating insights and enabling data-driven decisions?

Are you our new Senior Business Intelligence Analyst? We are now looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to grow as a person in a dynamic environment where you have the opportunity to get exposure to senior level stakeholders.

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Welcome to Technology Business Intelligence and Analytics. You’ll join Group Technology Office, where the Business Intelligence unit ensures transparency and analytics to support data-driven management decisions and provide insights.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, your primary responsibilities will be providing data analytics and developing new BI solutions as well as enhancing existing BI setup:


Develop dynamic dashboards to create valuable insights for senior management and stakeholders across the organisation
Build analytical models and provide data driven scenario/ predictive analysis
Act as a Subject Matter Expert and advisor in strategic initiatives
Solve the puzzle of integrating data sources
Develop processes and governance to ensure the right level of information quality


Furthermore, we expect you to take ownership and collaborate with stakeholders across the organisations.

You will be joining a team scoring the top 10% Employee Satisfaction score across Nordea. Your colleagues are highly competent and motivated group with a great team spirit who are sitting in Stockholm, Copenhagen and Gdynia/ Gdansk.

We offer a full-time employment agreement with various benefits, which may include private health and life insurance, learning opportunities, holiday subsidies, bonuses and many more, depending on the location.

We treasure flexibility. That’s why we offer a hybrid working model, where you can experience both working from our offices and from home.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best- and that we imagine you share with us.

Your interest consists not only in the technical tools, but you also have a natural curiosity in business processes and the data related to it, ensuring we can get the best insights of the data through story telling and user friendly solutions.

Your experience and background:


Academic degree in Data science, Statistics, Finance, Engineering or similar
3+ years’ experience in data modelling, database- and BI tools
Outgoing and eager to learn
Great analytical skills, self-driven and well organized with a keen eye for details and quality
It is seen as an advantage if you have experience with Alteryx and 3+ years experience with Power BI
It is also seen as an advantage if you are experienced in working with finance in financial institutions
Fluent in English, both written and spoken


If it sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 30/04/2025. Please be aware that selection and interviews might be held before last day of application.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

Title: BI-specialist – Utveckla och optimera BI-lösningar för verksamhetens beslutstöd
Description:
Vi på Vindex söker en erfaren och drivande Business Intelligence Specialist med stark teknisk kompetens till ett spännande interimsuppdrag hos vår kund. I rollen har du en viktig position där du leder utvecklingen av BI-lösningar som möjliggör datadrivna beslut i hela verksamheten.




Uppdraget pågår i cirka 12 månader och startar i mitten av maj.







Om rollen




I rollen som BI-specialist kommer du att ansvara för att driva digital utveckling inom finansiell analys och rapportering. Du kommer att arbeta nära verksamheten för att tillgängliggöra data som kan stötta beslut på olika nivåer i organisationen. Ditt arbete kommer att vara centralt för att säkerställa att data används strategiskt för att skapa insikter och driva affärsförbättringar. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med ekonomifunktion, controlling och IT – där du fungerar som en brygga mellan verksamhetens behov och tekniska lösningar. Du kommer även att delta i initiativ för att standardisera rapporteringsstrukturer, effektivisera dataleveranser och stötta organisationen i att arbeta mer datadrivet.







Placering: Stockholm







Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter




Utveckling och underhåll av BI-lösningar, främst med hjälp av Microsofts BI-stack (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI).
Ansvara för datamodellering och design av ETL-processer.
Samarbeta med verksamheten för att säkerställa att rätt data är tillgänglig för beslutsfattande.
Arbeta i agila team för att leverera lösningar i linje med verksamhetens behov.
Delta i vidareutveckling och optimering av datalager och BI-plattformar.
Etablera en centraliserad strategi för BI-verktyg, utveckla rapporter samt utbilda interna användare.
Översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar och kravspecifikationer.
Utveckla dashboards och visualiseringar som ger ökad insikt i verksamhetens nyckeltal.
Delta i datakvalitetsarbete och bidra till förbättringar av masterdata.







Kvalifikationer




Minst 5 års erfarenhet av BI-utveckling, inklusive arbete med Microsofts BI-verktyg (SSIS, SSRS, Power BI).
Gedigen kompetens inom datamodellering, dataanalys och SQL.
Relevant akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, ekonomi eller liknande.
Erfarenhet av datalager lösningar, ETL-processer och integrationer.
Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder.
God förståelse för ekonomiska processer, finansiell rapportering och nyckeltal.
Meriterande med erfarenhet från offentlig sektor samt Azure Data Factory och Synapse Analytics.
Meriterande med kunskaper inom data governance eller informationsarkitektur.







Om dig




För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en självgående och analytisk person som trivs med att arbeta i team och mot högt ställda mål. Du har ett stort systemintresse och stark teknisk kompetens inom BI-verktyg, och en gedigen erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence. Du engageras av att lösa komplexa problem genom att tillgängliggöra data som kan skapa värde för verksamheten. Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och är van vid att omsätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar. Du är kommunikativ och trivs i en roll där du får vara en brygga mellan teknik och verksamhet. Din erfarenhet från BI-utveckling gör att du snabbt kan sätta dig in i nya uppdrag och leverera lösningar som gör skillnad.







Ansökan




Låter detta som en roll för dig - skicka in din ansökan idag! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Skicka ditt CV i Word-format till oss på Vindex och ange referensnummer AXBI2859. Tveka inte att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Alexander Butler (alexander.butler@vindex.se, 0709-208 492) vid fler frågor kring rollen.




Välkommen med din ansökan!







Vad vi erbjuder




Under din anställning som konsult hos Vindex får du alltid fast månadslön och omfattas av både olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring.




Som en del av processen för varje roll utförs en bakgrundskontroll på de aktuella slutkandidaterna som då kommer att informeras i förväg.







Om Vindex




Vindex är en rekryteringsbyrå som specialiserar sig på att hitta rätt talanger för ekonomiska och finansiella roller. Vi strävar efter att skapa långsiktiga och värdefulla relationer med både våra kunder och kandidater. Hos oss får du hjälp av erfarna rekryterare som förstår din kompetens och hjälper dig att hitta nästa spännande utmaning i karriären. Är du intresserad av fler spännande tjänster och uppdrag? Kika in under fliken Lediga tjänster.

Show more

  • Översätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar och kravspecifikationer.
  • Utveckla dashboards och visualiseringar som ger ökad insikt i verksamhetens nyckeltal.
  • Delta i datakvalitetsarbete och bidra till förbättringar av masterdata.



Kvalifikationer


  • Minst 5 års erfarenhet av BI-utveckling, inklusive arbete med Microsofts BI-verktyg (SSIS, SSRS, Power BI).
  • Gedigen kompetens inom datamodellering, dataanalys och SQL.
  • Relevant akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, systemvetenskap, ekonomi eller liknande.
  • Erfarenhet av datalager lösningar, ETL-processer och integrationer.
  • Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder.
  • God förståelse för ekonomiska processer, finansiell rapportering och nyckeltal.
  • Meriterande med erfarenhet från offentlig sektor samt Azure Data Factory och Synapse Analytics.
  • Meriterande med kunskaper inom data governance eller informationsarkitektur.



Om dig


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är en självgående och analytisk person som trivs med att arbeta i team och mot högt ställda mål. Du har ett stort systemintresse och stark teknisk kompetens inom BI-verktyg, och en gedigen erfarenhet inom Business Intelligence. Du engageras av att lösa komplexa problem genom att tillgängliggöra data som kan skapa värde för verksamheten. Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och är van vid att omsätta affärsbehov till tekniska lösningar. Du är kommunikativ och trivs i en roll där du får vara en brygga mellan teknik och verksamhet. Din erfarenhet från BI-utveckling gör att du snabbt kan sätta dig in i nya uppdrag och leverera lösningar som gör skillnad.



Ansökan


Låter detta som en roll för dig - skicka in din ansökan idag! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Skicka ditt CV i Word-format till oss på Vindex och ange referensnummer AXBI2859. Tveka inte att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Alexander Butler (alexander.butler@vindex.se, 0709-208 492) vid fler frågor kring rollen.


Välkommen med din ansökan!



Vad vi erbjuder


Under din anställning som konsult hos Vindex får du alltid fast månadslön och omfattas av både olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring.


Som en del av processen för varje roll utförs en bakgrundskontroll på de aktuella slutkandidaterna som då kommer att informeras i förväg.



Om Vindex


Vindex är en rekryteringsbyrå som specialiserar sig på att hitta rätt talanger för ekonomiska och finansiella roller. Vi strävar efter att skapa långsiktiga och värdefulla relationer med både våra kunder och kandidater. Hos oss får du hjälp av erfarna rekryterare som förstår din kompetens och hjälper dig att hitta nästa spännande utmaning i karriären. Är du intresserad av fler spännande tjänster och uppdrag? Kika in under fliken Lediga tjänster.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you driven by Technology? 🔴




If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge! We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation. Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions. From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business. With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.




Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.




Join the Wolfpack as a Data Engineer - Hybrid (The Nordics):




What skills do you need to have?




+3 years' in Data Engineer;
Advanced expertise in Python, SQL and Power BI;
Experience in executing ETL, Reports, Dashboards and KPI´s;
We value experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics;
English proficiency.




Some of your responsibilities will be:




Creating blueprints for data flow and integration within analytics platforms
Execute end-to-end ETL processes, ensuring accuracy and efficiency in data transformation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data requirements and provide analytical solutions.
Strong understanding of data modeling principles and practices
Design scalable and efficient architectures for data processing and analysis







RED CODE

A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking! Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice. Red Follow Up

Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas? No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out. Red Hours

Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!




Keywords: Data Engineer, Dashboards, Reports, ETL, Azure, SQL, Microsoft, Power BI, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Vi på Akkodis söker en erfaren Data Engineer till ett viktigt uppdrag hos en myndighet inom energisektorn

Vill du vara med och bidra till energiomställningen och skapa framtidens lösningar för en hållbar elöverföring? Nu söker vi på Akkodis en skicklig och engagerad Data Engineer till ett långsiktigt uppdrag i ett av Sveriges viktigaste digitaliseringsprogram.




Om uppdraget

Vår kund är en myndighet med ett nationellt ansvar för ett säkert, miljöanpassat och kostnadseffektivt elöverföringssystem. I takt med att digitaliseringen och energiomställningen intensifieras, pågår flera stora satsningar där datadriven utveckling står i fokus. Därför behöver teamet nu förstärkning av en senior konsult med spetskompetens inom data engineering.




Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat omfatta:

Design, utveckling och förvaltning av data pipelines i Microsoft SQL Server
Acceptanstester i nära dialog med slutanvändare
Förvaltning och vidareutveckling av lösningar kopplade till Machine Learning-modeller
Dokumentation av system och flöden
Incidenthantering, felsökning och buggfixar i pågående IT-förvaltning
Koordinering av det agila arbetet – möjlighet att axla rollen som Scrum Master

Du blir en viktig del i ett agilt DevOps-team där du samarbetar med Data Scientists, systemutvecklare, lösningsarkitekter och testledare.




Teknikstack och miljöer

Python, Hadoop, Kafka, Windows PowerShell
SQL-databaser, Kubernetes/OpenShift
Agilt arbetssätt i tvärfunktionella team




Kravprofil

Vi söker dig med:

5–9 års erfarenhet som Data Engineer eller liknande roll
Hög kompetens inom relevanta tekniker
Vana av att arbeta i komplexa miljöer och leda delar av uppdrag
Erfarenhet av att arbeta självständigt och i team
Förmåga att fungera som förebild för andra konsulter
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.

Role Summary

Our department plays an important role in Scania’s data strategy to deliver top analytical solutions. We enable and enhance data to empower our employees to perform at their best by providing excellent solutions that increase and secure the right decisions to reach and exceed business goals.

You will be a part of a Squad consisting of Data Engineers and a Service Delivery Manager working towards the People and Culture business area. You will be part of a like-minded team that has a passion for working with BI solutions, and together you will create data solutions that bring value to our customers. You will also be involved and contribute to the Centers of Excellence (CoEs) in the organization. We work closely with the business (Business & IT as One) and with various stakeholder groups to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs.

We use scrum methodologies and sprints to follow up our work. Together with the squad, you will be developing high-quality BI solutions. You will develop new data products and work with our existing portfolio as well as documentation and performance adjustments. Our technical platforms are in the cloud and on-premises. The cloud setup is in AWS with Snowflake as a data warehouse, Matillion as our ETL/ELT tool, and PowerBI as a visualization tool. Our legacy on-premises platform with the Scania common data warehouse is Oracle-based with Oracle 19C and Oracle Data Integrator. We are in a transition phase to move away from on-premises into our highly capable cloud platform.

Who You Are



4+ years of experience with DW development and support
2+ years of experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS/Snowflake
Deep knowledge of dimensional modeling, data access, and data storage
Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases
Working experience with both low-code and high-code environments for ETL
Knowledge of PowerBI in Cloud, Tabular Editor, and other BI/DW tools is meriting
Basic understanding of git branching, and the ability to push and pull code to and from a git repository
Strong English language skills
Good knowledge of requirements collection for reporting applications



These skills are a bonus but not a must:



Experience in people and culture domains, procurement, or finance
Experience and enjoyment of agile methods and DevOps to deliver value continuously
An academic degree in computer science or equivalent



We hope that you are someone that adds energy to the group and push the team to reach new levels. You take responsibility for your own and the team’s development and are happy to drive improvements within both processes and tools. You are a team player who dares to take initiative and easily adapts to different situations and work conditions. You communicate fluently in English and have the ability to connect with users and their representatives, understanding requirements and analyzing data. You meet users’ expectations and bring clarity to unclear requirements through dialogue. Additionally, a person who enjoys having fun with colleagues is much appreciated!

Scania Offers

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.

Application

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-04 Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

We look forward to your application!

We look forward to your application!

Title: Data Analyst med Arkitektfokus
Description:
Tycker du också att åsikter kräver insikter? Att viktiga affärsbeslut ska tas med analys och data som underlag? Är du en analytisk problemlösare som är van att arbeta med och visualisera stora datamängder? Kom och joina oss som Data Analyst på ICA Sverige!

Det här är ditt blivande jobb

Teamet du kommer jobba i består av ca 30 fantastiska kollegor och tillhör vår Data & Analytics funktion i Solna, men du kommer också arbeta i ett leveransteam med mixade data & analytics roller där man tillsammans stöttar ett av ICAs sponsorsområden.

Du som Data Analyst med arkitektfokus utgör en kritisk faktor när vi nu tar ICAs datadrivna arbete till nya nivåer och tvärs hela bolaget. I den här tjänsten kommer du att få möjlighet att arbeta med en av Sveriges största databaser och utvecklas inom analytiska metoder tillsammans med skickliga, likasinnade kollegor.

I denna roll kommer du att fungera som en viktig länk mellan våra dataanalytiker och arkitekter. Du kommer att arbeta både hands-on som dataanalytiker i ett av våra produktteam och samtidigt arbeta som arkitekt med fokus på vårt analyslager. Du kommer att leda initiativ som främjar gemensamma arbetssätt inom dataanalytikergruppen, förbättrad prestanda och tekniska vägval vid nya use case.

Vem är du?

Vi söker just nu en Data Analyst som har flera års erfarenhet i en liknande roll och som har jobbat med modellering och arkitektfrågor. Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av och är trygg med att utveckla i SQL och är van att arbeta med stora datamängder och kombinerar data från olika källor. Vi jobbar med Tableau så vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av den, eller en liknande BI visualiseringsverktyg och någon molnlösning. Det är ett plus om du har erfarenhet av GCP, Looker, DBT, GitHub, BigQuery och Python.

För att trivas på ICA ser vi att du är en affärsmässig och ansvarstagande person som har en god förmåga att arbeta både detaljorienterat och inta ett helikopterperspektiv. Du har lätt för att inspirera och coacha andra i det du brinner för - data data data! För dig är ingen fråga för stor eller för liten och du räds inte att själv söka svar på frågor i de djupaste av datalager.

För att vara aktuell för denna roll måste du tala svenska och engelska obehindrat.

Kontaktinformation

Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av rekryterande chef Magnus Gidlund på 072 220 02 93, och frågor om processen besvaras av ansvarig rekryterare, Bojana Mijocevic tel 076-695 15 33.

Sista dag för ansökan

Ansök så snart som möjligt, då vi gör löpande urval, dock senast 2025-05-04.

Vi ska spegla våra kunder såväl som samhället i stort och är beroende av medarbetare med olika kompetenser. Vi strävar efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund och värdesätter den kunskap och erfarenhet det medför. Vi värnar om goda förutsättningar för ett hållbart arbetsliv för våra medarbetare med god arbetsmiljö och möjlighet till ständig utveckling. Vi tillämpar kompetensbaserad rekrytering. Vi tillämpar drogtestning i samband med rekryteringsförfarandet.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer to Savings Offering at SEB in Stockholm
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech aena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

About The Role

The Data and Integrations team within Savings Offering is looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our transformation journey to develop a new savings investment platform. You will focus on building scalable and secure services to handle data. Your role involves leading the creation of pipelines to integrate data from various sources, including databases, mainframe systems, APIs, and message queues. You will work in the Google Cloud Platform environment and be involved in decision-making and technical guidance for the Savings Investments tribe.

Key responsibilities:


Build scalable and secure services for data within and outside the Savings Investment area.
Implement the technical roadmap for SEB's journey to Google Cloud Platform.
Collaborate with architects, developers, and stakeholders.
Participate in code reviews, mob programming, and knowledge sharing.


We use a wide range of technologies, and the followings serve only as an example:


Container-based technology: Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, and others.
Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Infrastructure as Code: Terraform.
API development: GraphQL, REST APIs, Swagger.
Programming languages: Python and bash scripts.
Databases: BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Redis or any relational, non-relational, in-memory databases that are suitable for the work.
DevSecOps tools.


To thrive in this role, we believe you have:

We are seeking a skilled data engineer with a technical background in data integration, pipelines, and management. You should be a team player with great communication skills, a positive mindset, and the ability to collaborate and motivate others in a multicultural environment.

Key qualifications :


Several years of software development experience and some experience with Cloud, preferably Google Cloud Platform.
Ability to navigate GCP services, discuss them in detail, and quickly prototype designs.
Understanding of system design and data structures.
Forward-thinking mindset to drive change and continuous improvement.
Analytical mindset to tackle complex business and technical challenges with the team's help.


We aim to lead SEB's digital transformation towards GCP and expect you to drive your work and potentially lead the technology within the team

What We Offer


Extensive training and learning opportunities.
Attractive compensation and benefits.
Hybrid way of working.
Work-life balance.
Friendly and welcoming culture.
International opportunities and working environment.
Agile and modern ways of working.


Learn more about working at SEB  www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in or where they come from.

Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.

Ready to join?

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of April. If you have questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager, Thanh Truong, at thanh.truong@seb.se

HTML:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech aena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.

About The Role

The Data and Integrations team within Savings Offering is looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our transformation journey to develop a new savings investment platform. You will focus on building scalable and secure services to handle data. Your role involves leading the creation of pipelines to integrate data from various sources, including databases, mainframe systems, APIs, and message queues. You will work in the Google Cloud Platform environment and be involved in decision-making and technical guidance for the Savings Investments tribe.

Key responsibilities:

  • Build scalable and secure services for data within and outside the Savings Investment area.
  • Implement the technical roadmap for SEB's journey to Google Cloud Platform.
  • Collaborate with architects, developers, and stakeholders.
  • Participate in code reviews, mob programming, and knowledge sharing.

We use a wide range of technologies, and the followings serve only as an example:

  • Container-based technology: Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, and others.
  • Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Infrastructure as Code: Terraform.
  • API development: GraphQL, REST APIs, Swagger.
  • Programming languages: Python and bash scripts.
  • Databases: BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Redis or any relational, non-relational, in-memory databases that are suitable for the work.
  • DevSecOps tools.

To thrive in this role, we believe you have:

We are seeking a skilled data engineer with a technical background in data integration, pipelines, and management. You should be a team player with great communication skills, a positive mindset, and the ability to collaborate and motivate others in a multicultural environment.

Key qualifications :

  • Several years of software development experience and some experience with Cloud, preferably Google Cloud Platform.
  • Ability to navigate GCP services, discuss them in detail, and quickly prototype designs.
  • Understanding of system design and data structures.
  • Forward-thinking mindset to drive change and continuous improvement.
  • Analytical mindset to tackle complex business and technical challenges with the team's help.

We aim to lead SEB's digital transformation towards GCP and expect you to drive your work and potentially lead the technology within the team

What We Offer

  • Extensive training and learning opportunities.
  • Attractive compensation and benefits.
  • Hybrid way of working.
  • Work-life balance.
  • Friendly and welcoming culture.
  • International opportunities and working environment.
  • Agile and modern ways of working.

Learn more about working at SEB  www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in or where they come from.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of April. If you have questions about the position, please contact the hiring manager, Thanh Truong, at thanh.truong@seb.se

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Fortum's Asset & Markets data platforms team is seeking individuals to work with advanced technologies and develop data solutions using Databricks for internal customers. This team aims to deliver clean energy and support the decarbonisation of industries in the Nordic region.

About The Role

You will be working in a team which is developing and operating cloud data platforms, integrations and data science applications for Fortum's internal customers. We are strong believers in using ci/cd and orchestration tools in automating our development and deployment processes. As your first assignment you will be working with collecting, processing, and sharing data from Fortum’s energy production assets and multiple other internal and external sources.

You will be a good fit for the team if you appreciate CI/CD pipelines, orchestration tools, linting rules, good IaC practices, unit testing and release and review processes.

The team is working in a hybrid model of remote time and office time. In this role you can either be located in Espoo, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden.

Key Responsibilities:



Contribute to the development, operation, and architectural design of complex data platforms
Transform complicated business problems into data solutions and pipelines
Create and manage cloud infrastructure with Terraform and CI/CD tools
Work together with a team of data engineers and collaborate also with business stakeholders
Actively find ways to learn from team members and stakeholders, and share knowledge beneficial to the team
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements and improve team ways of working and the quality of our work



About You

You have an Sc. or M.Sc. degree, for instance Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics, or you have comparable skills gathered through work experience that are relevant to the role. You have hands on knowledge in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure or GCP). You have developed integrations, managed data processing pipelines and worked with Spark. You have experience in Scala or Python programming, and you have solid skills with SQL.

Other key professional requirements:



An understanding of agile software processes, data-driven development, and data security concepts.
Highly motivated and proactive mentality towards responsibilities.
Willingness and ability to learn more and grow in the role and beyond.
Good communication and presentation skills in English, both written and oral.
A well-organized and structured working style.



Nice to have, considered as your benefit:



Strong Databricks experience.
Hands on experience in IoT data and streaming data.
Experience in data architecture and data modelling work.



We offer you

At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.

Interested?

Please submit your application in the system by 2024-04-21 at the latest. We will process the applications continually with screening and interviews. The position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application date, so please apply as soon as possible.

If you would like more information about this opportunity, please do not hesitate to contact recruiting manager Elina Saunamäki via e-mail elina.saunamaki@fortum.com

For contact with Swedish union representatives, please call +46 8 671 70 00.

Fortums Akademiker: Malin Nordenhall

Unionen: Birgitta Henriksson Ledarna: Lars-Ola Andersson

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination which may include a drug test.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com 
Show more
