Title: Data Analytiker
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dataanalytiker med god forretningsforståelse

Skab overblik og indsigt i medlemmernes adfærd og præferencer




Realdania ønsker at styrke relationen til og engagementet hos flere medlemmer og fremtidssikre foreningens mangfoldige medlemsskare med interesse for det byggede miljø. For at understøtte foreningens arbejde med dette, søger vi en ny dataanalytiker til at skabe indsigter fra vores medlemsdata til formidling i form af analyser, notater, rapportering og i Power BI.




Jobbet

Du vil være det primære kontaktpunkt for dataanalyser og rapportering, der vedrører medlemsdata og vores foreningsstrategi og du vil bistå strategiske udviklingsprojekter med indsigter og optimering af processer. Stillingens indhold er blandt andet:

Forstå forretningsbehov, skabe nye indsigter og sikre at medlemsdata stilles til rådighed i en indsigtsfuld og organiseret form. Du vil fungere som sparringspartner og bidragsyder til analyser, notater og datadrevne beslutningsoplæg, ligesom du selv vil være projektleder på forskellige dataanalyseprojekter.
Indgå i den fortsatte udvikling af datavarehus og Business Intelligence på tværs i Realdania, herunder en kommende migrering til en ny platform.
Samarbejde med andre afdelinger og analysere og sikre, hvordan vi kan forbedre data og udvikle foreningens brug af AI og digital forretningsudvikling.




Hvem leder vi efter?

Dataanalyse og Business Intelligence motiverer dig. Det omfatter overblik over interne og eksterne data, modellering af data til automatiseret og digitaliseret rapportering samt at gøre denne information tilgængelig i overensstemmelse med behovene i organisationen.




Du har en relevant uddannelsesmæssig baggrund og nogle års praktisk erfaring.




Vi forestiller os at du:

er erfaren i dataanalyse og formidling heraf til ledelse og kolleger.
har stor erfaring med Excel.
har erfaring med eller interesse i at formidle og præsentere data i et Business Intelligence værktøj, for eksempel Power BI.
har erfaring med at bearbejde relationelle data – for eksempel via SQL, R, Python eller lignende.
har nemt ved at sætte dig ind i komplekse problemstillinger og anvende data til at beskrive, analysere og forstå dem.
er digitalt kyndig og kan medvirke i faciliteringen af Realdanias digitaliseringsdagsorden og fortsatte udvikling af vores dataplatform i samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af huset og eksterne konsulenter.
er engageret og kvalitetsbevidst med opmærksomhed på detaljen, har gode samarbejdsevner og trives med at arbejde på tværs i organisationen.
ønsker at blive eksperten i de data og forretningsprocesser, der understøtter foreningens arbejde på medlemsområdet, så du kan være med til at udvikle analyser og processer, og understøtte Realdanias foreningsstrategi.
er interesseret i at blive en del af Realdania, som er en filantropisk forening med et levende medlemsdemokrati og mange interessenter.




Vi tilbyder

Du ansættes som dataanalytiker i Foreningssekretariatet med otte faste medarbejdere og tre studentermedhjælpere. Du refererer til sekretariatschefen for Foreningssekretariatet.




Vi er en arbejdsplads, der er præget af faglighed og kvalitet og af hjælpsomhed og gode kolleger. Vi har et engageret miljø både fagligt og socialt, og vi har gode rammer om vores arbejde, en personaleforening med mange sociale aktiviteter, forsikringer, god frokostordning m.m.




Spørgsmål

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, kan du kontakte Christian Bonde fra KAR+CO på telefon 40 27 59 00.




Ansøgningsfrist

Ansøgningsfristen er den 21. april 2025. Upload din ansøgning til KAR+CO ved at klikke på knappen ”Søg stilling”.




Ansøgninger modtages kun via ansøgningssystemet. Kan du ikke uploade din ansøgning, bedes du derfor kontakte KAR+CO.




Vi læser ansøgninger løbende og forventer at holde samtaler i uge 17 og 18.




Vi håber på tiltrædelse 1. juni 2025 og ellers efter nærmere aftale.




Bemærk, at vores annoncer automatisk og løbende bliver fornyet på jobportalerne, indtil stillingen er endeligt besat. En fornyelse af stillingen, om end det kan se sådan ud, er således ikke et udtryk for genopslag. Du kan kun søge stillingen via systemet og kun én gang. Jf. GDPR bedes du undlade at fremsende ansøgning på ny via mail eller lignende uden forudgående aftale.




Realdania er en filantropisk forening med knap 190.000 medlemmer. Foreningen arbejder med filantropi på basis af afkastet af sin investeringsformue. Vi støtter store og små projekter over hele landet, der samlet set bidrager til at nå vores filantropiske mål og vores mission: at skabe livskvalitet for alle gennem det byggede miljø. Vores arbejde skal samlet set gavne alle i Danmark, og vi ønsker at gøre en forskel for både nuværende og kommende generationer. Realdania har siden år 2000 støttet cirka 5000 filantropiske projekter med 24 mia. kr. Alle, der ejer fast ejendom, kan gratis blive medlem. I 2025 fylder Realdania 25 år, og det markeres med en stor jubilæumsindsats, der blandt andet støtter små fællesskaber over hele landet med fysiske rammer.




Foreningssekretariatet i Realdania understøtter medlemsdemokratiet ved at sikre medlemshåndtering, planlægning og afholdelse af valg til repræsentantskabet og gennemførelse af repræsentantskabets møder. Vi har sammen med vores kollegaer i Medlemsteamet kontakten til medlemmerne og har styr på foreningens vedtægter og en stor mængde medlemsdata, der skal håndteres korrekt. Vi arbejder for at sikre de bedst mulige betingelser for at kunne yde professionel medlemsservice og videreudvikle de administrative processer i forhold til dette. Dit bidrag som dataanalytiker er med til at understøtte denne rejse, som vi håber du vil med på.




Arbejdssted: Jarmers Plads 2, København V

Show more
HTML:
Dataanalytiker med god forretningsforståelse

Skab overblik og indsigt i medlemmernes adfærd og præferencer


Realdania ønsker at styrke relationen til og engagementet hos flere medlemmer og fremtidssikre foreningens mangfoldige medlemsskare med interesse for det byggede miljø. For at understøtte foreningens arbejde med dette, søger vi en ny dataanalytiker til at skabe indsigter fra vores medlemsdata til formidling i form af analyser, notater, rapportering og i Power BI.


Jobbet

Du vil være det primære kontaktpunkt for dataanalyser og rapportering, der vedrører medlemsdata og vores foreningsstrategi og du vil bistå strategiske udviklingsprojekter med indsigter og optimering af processer. Stillingens indhold er blandt andet:

  • Forstå forretningsbehov, skabe nye indsigter og sikre at medlemsdata stilles til rådighed i en indsigtsfuld og organiseret form. Du vil fungere som sparringspartner og bidragsyder til analyser, notater og datadrevne beslutningsoplæg, ligesom du selv vil være projektleder på forskellige dataanalyseprojekter.
  • Indgå i den fortsatte udvikling af datavarehus og Business Intelligence på tværs i Realdania, herunder en kommende migrering til en ny platform.
  • Samarbejde med andre afdelinger og analysere og sikre, hvordan vi kan forbedre data og udvikle foreningens brug af AI og digital forretningsudvikling.


Hvem leder vi efter?

Dataanalyse og Business Intelligence motiverer dig. Det omfatter overblik over interne og eksterne data, modellering af data til automatiseret og digitaliseret rapportering samt at gøre denne information tilgængelig i overensstemmelse med behovene i organisationen.


Du har en relevant uddannelsesmæssig baggrund og nogle års praktisk erfaring.


Vi forestiller os at du:

  • er erfaren i dataanalyse og formidling heraf til ledelse og kolleger.
  • har stor erfaring med Excel.
  • har erfaring med eller interesse i at formidle og præsentere data i et Business Intelligence værktøj, for eksempel Power BI.
  • har erfaring med at bearbejde relationelle data – for eksempel via SQL, R, Python eller lignende.
  • har nemt ved at sætte dig ind i komplekse problemstillinger og anvende data til at beskrive, analysere og forstå dem.
  • er digitalt kyndig og kan medvirke i faciliteringen af Realdanias digitaliseringsdagsorden og fortsatte udvikling af vores dataplatform i samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af huset og eksterne konsulenter.
  • er engageret og kvalitetsbevidst med opmærksomhed på detaljen, har gode samarbejdsevner og trives med at arbejde på tværs i organisationen.
  • ønsker at blive eksperten i de data og forretningsprocesser, der understøtter foreningens arbejde på medlemsområdet, så du kan være med til at udvikle analyser og processer, og understøtte Realdanias foreningsstrategi.
  • er interesseret i at blive en del af Realdania, som er en filantropisk forening med et levende medlemsdemokrati og mange interessenter.


Vi tilbyder

Du ansættes som dataanalytiker i Foreningssekretariatet med otte faste medarbejdere og tre studentermedhjælpere. Du refererer til sekretariatschefen for Foreningssekretariatet.


Vi er en arbejdsplads, der er præget af faglighed og kvalitet og af hjælpsomhed og gode kolleger. Vi har et engageret miljø både fagligt og socialt, og vi har gode rammer om vores arbejde, en personaleforening med mange sociale aktiviteter, forsikringer, god frokostordning m.m.


Spørgsmål

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, kan du kontakte Christian Bonde fra KAR+CO på telefon 40 27 59 00.


Ansøgningsfrist

Ansøgningsfristen er den 21. april 2025. Upload din ansøgning til KAR+CO ved at klikke på knappen ”Søg stilling”.


Ansøgninger modtages kun via ansøgningssystemet. Kan du ikke uploade din ansøgning, bedes du derfor kontakte KAR+CO.


Vi læser ansøgninger løbende og forventer at holde samtaler i uge 17 og 18.


Vi håber på tiltrædelse 1. juni 2025 og ellers efter nærmere aftale.


Bemærk, at vores annoncer automatisk og løbende bliver fornyet på jobportalerne, indtil stillingen er endeligt besat. En fornyelse af stillingen, om end det kan se sådan ud, er således ikke et udtryk for genopslag. Du kan kun søge stillingen via systemet og kun én gang. Jf. GDPR bedes du undlade at fremsende ansøgning på ny via mail eller lignende uden forudgående aftale.

Realdania har siden år 2000 støttet cirka 5000 filantropiske projekter med 24 mia. kr. Alle, der ejer fast ejendom, kan gratis blive medlem. I 2025 fylder Realdania 25 år, og det markeres med en stor jubilæumsindsats, der blandt andet støtter små fællesskaber over hele landet med fysiske rammer.


Foreningssekretariatet i Realdania understøtter medlemsdemokratiet ved at sikre medlemshåndtering, planlægning og afholdelse af valg til repræsentantskabet og gennemførelse af repræsentantskabets møder. Title: Junior Data Engineer
Description:
Calling on Junior Data Engineer




At Maersk Tankers, our purpose is to pioneer shipping solutions for our partners and the planet. We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion to make this happen, including providing equal opportunities for all. We offer a global and flexible workplace where passion and engagement are met with opportunities to pioneer professional and personal development.




Your opportunity to join the adventure




In Technology, you will join a team of 6 talented and welcoming colleagues.

As a Junior Data Engineer, you'll be part of a dynamic team, developing and providing solutions for the IT Security and Platforms team. With a collaborative mindset, you'll work closely with team members and business product owners to understand, define, and develop solutions that enhance performance across the organization.

Are you part of the solution?

At Maersk Tankers, you can come as you are and be among people who will expand your horizon. As our new Junior Data Engineer, we do, however, expect that you can contribute with the following:




Bring enthusiasm and an open mind. Here’s what you’ll be doing:




Translating business needs into technical designs and solutions: You'll learn to create and operate data integrations, and participate in or facilitate the prototyping of new solutions and technologies
Ingesting and cleaning data: You'll work with various data sources and formats, from internal operation data to external market data
Collaborating with business users: You'll contribute to creating concise and meaningful data assets that fit into our platform architecture
Operating data pipelines: You'll ensure high robustness, fault tolerance, and availability, making optimizations and scheduling improvements along the way
Maintaining CI/CD and data platform infrastructure: You'll keep the platform secure and robust while minimizing costs




Technologies you'll be working with:




Python Azure Functions for ingestion
Azure DevOps for CI/CD, repository storage, and package repository
PySpark and Scala Spark for data pipelines
Azure Synapse Analytics




Maersk Tankers | Calling New Horizons




Maersk Tankers is a service company that provides commercial management solutions for shipowners in the tanker industry, operating one of the largest tanker fleets in the world. Our purpose is to pioneer shipping solutions for our partners and the planet. Founded in 1928, we have a century of expertise in management of tankers, which we use to develop and deploy solutions that help shipowners boost the economic and environmental performance of their vessels. Maersk Tankers employs approximately 300 employees in Denmark, Singapore, United Kingdom, India and the U.S. and is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Title: Business Insights Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
JOB TITLE – Business Insights Manager, Next Generation Products

LOCATION – Copenhagen, Denmark

HOURS – Full Time

About The Role

We are excited to offer an incredible opportunity as Business Insights Manager for Scandinavian Tobacco Group’s growing Next Generation Products team. In this pivotal role, you will be essential in tracking and following up upon our strategic initiatives through commercial insights. To succeed, you must be able to build up a strong understanding of market dynamics and translate findings into commercial actions across functions within our organizational teams. You will be responsible for tracking our global footprint and identifying our synergetic thresholds - internally and externally.

Your role as a self-reliant professional is crucial in our fast-paced environment. A key part of your role will involve ensuring clear communication and alignment within the organization, while fostering robust professional relationships. You will be reporting to the Head of Commercial Insights.

WHAT WILL YOU BE RESPONSIBLE FOR?


Collecting Data & Tracking of strategic and commercial initiatives:
Collecting data and insights across functions and teams to conduct analysis and reporting on commercial initiatives within our product life cycle: from P&L, budgets and forecasting to product launches, marketing initiatives and activations, market performances, growth tendencies and portfolio adaptions.
Develop and implement comprehensive tracking tools for our global performances and organizational teams, ensuring synergetic effects across markets are captured and distributed ongoingly.
Understand, develop and adapt strong methodological frameworks and reports to capture and consolidate our performances within organizational teams.
Lead and ensure a data driven approach to commercial initiatives, capturing enhancers of growth and profitability across markets.


Foster insights into strategic performance culture


Understand stakeholder capabilities, targets and ambitions and convert these into trackable KPIs.
Identify, evaluate and share insights ongoingly and ensure fostering of insights into tangible and trackable decisions across functions and teams.
Evaluate adaptability and scalability of local, regional and global know-how and winning formulars to build the NGP teams’ insights toolbox.
Assess global and local dynamics and convert proven concepts into trackable actions across organizational teams, ensuring synergetic effects.


Follow Up And Global Collaboration


Follow up on commercial and strategic decisions across teams via KPIs and ensure distribution of commercial insights to stakeholders.
Work closely with regional and local teams to adapt insights to local market needs and ensure successful growth.
Drive a cohesive approach to data management and decisions across markets, driving synergies and efficiencies globally.
Enable repeatability of proven concepts across functions.
Contribute to and drive data driven performance culture across global teams.


Performance driven approach through data


Collection, analysis and tracking of data can’t stand alone in this role. You will be the enabler of translating and distributing insights into recommended actions to our global stakeholders across functions.
Our team will lead the exploration and validation of proven concepts through data and commercial insights.
We will conceptualize insights into tangible actions and trackable KPIs to ensure repeatability.
You will work closely with R&D, category, operational, marketing, and sales teams to ensure relevance and implementation of insights to reach the organization’s strategic targets and profitability.


WHAT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WILL BE REQUIRED?


3-5 years of experience as business and/or data analysist, ideally within multinational FMCG companies.
In-depth experience with BI-tools, Powerquery and Excel is required. PowerPoint skills and proven experience in utilizing other data analytics tools is a great plus.
Strong analytical skills and strategic thinking with a track record of identifying and capitalizing on growth opportunities.
Comfortable with ambiguity and ability to build assumptions based on limited data.
Desire to shape the role in line with the dynamic environment and evolving needs
Deep understanding of consumer behaviour, what drives their decisions and how we can adjust our strategies to fit their needs and expectations.
Excellent project management skills, with experience leading cross-functional teams & influence senior stakeholders.
Strong communication and relationship-building abilities across diverse global teams.
Fluency in English and ability to travel 5-10% of time.


OUR HIRING PROCESS

Requirements

Before we enter a hiring process, your job application will be reviewed by a member of our recruiting team. Your application will be reviewed in line with the hiring competencies we have for the role you have applied for. If your experience aligns with the requirements, you will enter our hiring process which will consist of the following:


Recruiter Screen
Hiring Manager Interview
Behavioral Assessment
Final Task


WHAT IS ON OFFER?

At Scandinavian Tobacco Group, we offer a competitive compensation package, including a generous pension scheme, healthcare, dental, and career development opportunities. We also provide you with the chance to be part of a dynamic, results oriented & global company that values continuous growth, sustainability with consumer at the heart of everything we do.

About Scandinavian Tobacco Group

Scandinavian Tobacco Group is a global leader in cigars and tobacco products, with a rich heritage dating back 250 years. Since our formation in 1961, we've grown into a truly international company, operating in over 100 countries with a diverse workforce of more than 10,000 employees representing numerous nationalities and cultures. Our success is built on a portfolio of iconic brands including Signature, Cohiba, Macanudo, CAO, and Partagas. We specialize in crafting cigars and tobacco products that are synonymous with moments that matter - celebrations, achievements, and life's special occasions. We're proud of our dynamic growth strategy, having successfully acquired and integrated multiple companies over the past decade. This approach has not only expanded our market presence but also enriched our organizational culture with diverse perspectives and expertise. Sustainability is at the heart of our operations. We're committed to minimizing our environmental footprint and implementing responsible practices across our supply chain. This dedication to sustainability extends to our relationships with employees, partners, and the communities where we operate. At Scandinavian Tobacco Group, we foster an inclusive, international work environment where collaboration and knowledge-sharing are key. We believe that our diverse team is our greatest strength, driving innovation and helping us to continuously evolve in a changing global market. We're always looking for talented individuals who share our passion for excellence and our commitment to creating a positive impact. By joining our team, you'll have the opportunity to contribute to a company that values creativity, embraces change, and encourages you to craft a career that truly makes you more. Whether you're collaborating with colleagues across continents, contributing to our sustainability initiatives, or helping to integrate newly acquired businesses, you'll be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking organization that's shaping the future of our industry.

Please be informed that this Direct Search is conducted exclusively by Scandinavian Tobacco Group. We do not accept applications from agencies, and we will not provide compensation for unsolicited CVs.

Title: Data & Analytics Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
ARE YOU READY TO ENABLE GANNI TO SCALE BY ENABLING BETTER DATA ANALYSIS AND DECISION-MAKING WITH OUR NEW MODERN DATA PLATFORM?

WE ARE LOOKING FOR A DATA MANAGER TO JOIN OUR EXCITING GROWTH JOURNEY.

Your Missing & Responsibilities Ahead Of You

GANNI is on an exciting growth journey, aiming to become a digital-first, direct-to-consumer brand. To achieve this, our Digital Development & Data department plays a key role in building a future-proof technical landscape that supports our ambitions.

We are currently in a transition phase, establishing a modern, scalable data platform and reporting framework based on Microsoft Fabric. This means you’ll have the opportunity to work with new technology while also shaping the way we do things. Your expertise will help define best practices and ensure our data infrastructure is built for the future.

The Data & Analytics Manager you will be responsible for the data team consisting of a Data Engineer and a Data Analyst. The Data team is part of the Digital Development & Data Management department which covers a lot of different areas from Data platform & Analytics, Integrations, ERP, Omnichannel & PMO.

As a Data Manager be responsible for the Data Platform & Analytics development backlog. You will take the lead and participate in stakeholder meetings with different departments, scoping sessions and work hands-on with development ensuring we follow architectural guidelines.

We’re looking for someone who actively ensures stable and efficient operations while continuously improving and refining our data infrastructure as well as securing a good and professional work environment for your team.

You have experience collaborating across all levels of the business and working closely with departments like Finance, Sales, Operations, and Marketing. We see you as a trusted advisor for all things related to Business Intelligence, automation, and reporting - someone who can provide guidance on any questions that arise. You act as a technical sparring partner, supporting new business initiatives and advising on how to best utilize and activate data.

We believe that this position holds a lot of space for you to grow professionally in an international environment where you combine data, people and technology! You enjoy a dynamic environment in a growth organisation where you will have the opportunity to develop yourself over time with new responsibilities.

Responsibilities Ahead Of You


Being a people manager and leading a team of two (Data Engineer and Data Analyst) as well as 1-2 external data engineers in all development related work in all from data integration, data transformation to data visualisation.
Maintain and steer the Data Platform & Analytics backlog and priorities.
Participate and lead scoping sessions with business stakeholders.
Responsible for translating business requirements into a technical solution
Making sure to have a consistent technical direction of the data deliverables to ensure a futureproof architecture
Be an advisor and sparring partner for different departments as well as for the department manager.
Perform code reviews for and with colleagues and externals
Ensure a stable data platform and reporting landscape meeting end-user expectations
Collaborate closely with ex. Integration Architects to support each other on integration and for enabling data products for the integration platform
Like and thrive in working hands-on and can support when needed on technical issues and development.


Must Have Requirements


Have experience from roles as a Data/BI architect, Senior BI consultant or Data Engineer either in-house or from a consultant company.
Experience as a manager (formal or informal) or team lead is an advantage.
We expect that you have a broad knowledge of Azure Data Services ex. Microsoft Fabric, Synapse Analytics, Data Pipelines, Cosmos DB, Azure SQL DB, Azure Data Lake and Power BI.
Have a minimum of 5 years experience working within Data analysis, Data Engineering and/or Business Intelligence.
Experienced in creating star-schemas and data modelling especially working in a data lakehouse architecture.
Have experience with SQL, Spark SQL, PySpark, DAX and Power BI and working with Notebooks
Have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage and communicate with senior business-leaders.
Have experience of working with several external development vendors and vendor management.
Thrive in a fast-moving and dynamic business environment where operations and business requirements might change fast.
Have experience with different source systems, having experience with Microsoft Navision/Trimit, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, NewStore, InRiver, Bloomreach, JIRA and SharePoint is an advantage.
A plus would be to have experience with Customer Data Platforms and a business focused on Direct-to-consumer.
Maybe you have experience with object-oriented programming like Python or C#.


THE GANNI WAY

You are proactive by nature and understand the value of well-planned processes combined with high data quality provided at the right time in the right place. We believe you are comfortable working with hands-on operational tasks such as answering questions about data and fixing bugs as well as providing day-to-day support to colleagues and customers.

We believe that you have strong analytical skills while you easily visualise and communicate to stakeholders from various departments and different levels to make sure the message goes through. You are enjoying a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to be a key-player and an impact maker. We believe you continue to help the organisation, team and your colleagues to grow by bringing in a new perspective.

BE BOLD AND JOIN OUR GANNI COMMUNITY!

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel motivated to join our team and become a part of the GANNI community. If you have more questions regarding the position please contact Jasmine Lidh, Director of Digital & Data at jasmine.lindh@ganni.com

We will be interviewing candidates continuously and kindly ask you to send your application and CV as soon as possible. Please use the “Apply for position” button.

We welcome applications from all people regardless of gender identities, sexual orientations, ethnicities, racial identities, religious beliefs, disability statuses and personal expressions. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV.

Quick Apply

You don’t need to upload a cover letter to apply for this position - your CV is enough! We want to make the process easy for you, so you can quickly apply by simply attaching your CV. If you have a cover letter, you’re welcome to include it, but it’s not required. We look forward to hearing from you!

HTML:
ARE YOU READY TO ENABLE GANNI TO SCALE BY ENABLING BETTER DATA ANALYSIS AND DECISION-MAKING WITH OUR NEW MODERN DATA PLATFORM?

WE ARE LOOKING FOR A DATA MANAGER TO JOIN OUR EXCITING GROWTH JOURNEY.

Your Missing & Responsibilities Ahead Of You

GANNI is on an exciting growth journey, aiming to become a digital-first, direct-to-consumer brand. To achieve this, our Digital Development & Data department plays a key role in building a future-proof technical landscape that supports our ambitions.

We are currently in a transition phase, establishing a modern, scalable data platform and reporting framework based on Microsoft Fabric. This means you’ll have the opportunity to work with new technology while also shaping the way we do things. Your expertise will help define best practices and ensure our data infrastructure is built for the future.

The Data & Analytics Manager you will be responsible for the data team consisting of a Data Engineer and a Data Analyst. The Data team is part of the Digital Development & Data Management department which covers a lot of different areas from Data platform & Analytics, Integrations, ERP, Omnichannel & PMO.

As a Data Manager be responsible for the Data Platform & Analytics development backlog. You will take the lead and participate in stakeholder meetings with different departments, scoping sessions and work hands-on with development ensuring we follow architectural guidelines.

We’re looking for someone who actively ensures stable and efficient operations while continuously improving and refining our data infrastructure as well as securing a good and professional work environment for your team.

You have experience collaborating across all levels of the business and working closely with departments like Finance, Sales, Operations, and Marketing. We see you as a trusted advisor for all things related to Business Intelligence, automation, and reporting - someone who can provide guidance on any questions that arise. You act as a technical sparring partner, supporting new business initiatives and advising on how to best utilize and activate data.

We believe that this position holds a lot of space for you to grow professionally in an international environment where you combine data, people and technology! You enjoy a dynamic environment in a growth organisation where you will have the opportunity to develop yourself over time with new responsibilities.

Responsibilities Ahead Of You

  • Being a people manager and leading a team of two (Data Engineer and Data Analyst) as well as 1-2 external data engineers in all development related work in all from data integration, data transformation to data visualisation.
  • Maintain and steer the Data Platform & Analytics backlog and priorities.
  • Participate and lead scoping sessions with business stakeholders.
  • Responsible for translating business requirements into a technical solution
  • Making sure to have a consistent technical direction of the data deliverables to ensure a futureproof architecture
  • Be an advisor and sparring partner for different departments as well as for the department manager.
  • Perform code reviews for and with colleagues and externals
  • Ensure a stable data platform and reporting landscape meeting end-user expectations
  • Collaborate closely with ex. Integration Architects to support each other on integration and for enabling data products for the integration platform
  • Like and thrive in working hands-on and can support when needed on technical issues and development.

Must Have Requirements

  • Have experience from roles as a Data/BI architect, Senior BI consultant or Data Engineer either in-house or from a consultant company.
  • Experience as a manager (formal or informal) or team lead is an advantage.
  • We expect that you have a broad knowledge of Azure Data Services ex. Microsoft Fabric, Synapse Analytics, Data Pipelines, Cosmos DB, Azure SQL DB, Azure Data Lake and Power BI.
  • Have a minimum of 5 years experience working within Data analysis, Data Engineering and/or Business Intelligence.
  • Experienced in creating star-schemas and data modelling especially working in a data lakehouse architecture.
  • Have experience with SQL, Spark SQL, PySpark, DAX and Power BI and working with Notebooks
  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage and communicate with senior business-leaders.
  • Have experience of working with several external development vendors and vendor management.
  • Thrive in a fast-moving and dynamic business environment where operations and business requirements might change fast.
  • Have experience with different source systems, having experience with Microsoft Navision/Trimit, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, NewStore, InRiver, Bloomreach, JIRA and SharePoint is an advantage.
  • A plus would be to have experience with Customer Data Platforms and a business focused on Direct-to-consumer.
  • Maybe you have experience with object-oriented programming like Python or C#.

THE GANNI WAY

You are proactive by nature and understand the value of well-planned processes combined with high data quality provided at the right time in the right place. We believe you are comfortable working with hands-on operational tasks such as answering questions about data and fixing bugs as well as providing day-to-day support to colleagues and customers.

We believe that you have strong analytical skills while you easily visualise and communicate to stakeholders from various departments and different levels to make sure the message goes through. You are enjoying a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to be a key-player and an impact maker. We believe you continue to help the organisation, team and your colleagues to grow by bringing in a new perspective.

BE BOLD AND JOIN OUR GANNI COMMUNITY!

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel motivated to join our team and become a part of the GANNI community. If you have more questions regarding the position please contact Jasmine Lidh, Director of Digital & Data at jasmine.lindh@ganni.com

We will be interviewing candidates continuously and kindly ask you to send your application and CV as soon as possible. Please use the “Apply for position” button.

We welcome applications from all people regardless of gender identities, sexual orientations, ethnicities, racial identities, religious beliefs, disability statuses and personal expressions. We only want to know why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV.

Quick Apply

You don’t need to upload a cover letter to apply for this position - your CV is enough! We want to make the process easy for you, so you can quickly apply by simply attaching your CV. If you have a cover letter, you’re welcome to include it, but it’s not required. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Student Analyst
Description:
Nabla Technologies er en mindre energy trading virksomhed beliggende midt i Aarhus. Vi specialiserer os i modelbaseret og automatiseret kortsigtet energy trading på de fleste amerikanske energimarkeder.




Vi søger en engageret Student Analyst, der har flair for både datahåndtering og analyse. Du vil blive en del af vores dynamiske team, hvor du får mulighed for at arbejde med- og lære fra erfarne fagfolk inden for økonomi, statistik og softwareudvikling. Stillingen er ideel for dig, der ønsker at supplere dine studier med praksisnær erfaring inden for energy trading og databehandling.




Dine opgaver

Udvikling og automatisering af dataudtræk og rapporter
Analyser, der understøtter vores algoritmiske handelsaktiviteter
Mulighed for let Python-programmering til datahåndtering og scripting




Dine kvalifikationer

Solid erfaring med SQL
Kendskab til Python, gerne i forbindelse med dataanalyse eller scripting
Det er en fordel, hvis du er interesseret i finansielle og økonomiske emner
Du arbejder selvstændigt og tager ansvar for dine opgaver




Vi tilbyder

Fleksible arbejdstider, der passer til din studiekalender
Et inspirerende miljø med mulighed for at lære om automatiseret energy trading
Tæt samarbejde med et ambitiøst og hjælpsomt team
Mulighed for at omsætte teoretisk viden til praktisk erfaring




Om os

Nabla Technologies blev etableret i slutningen af 2021 og fokuserer på kortsigtet energy trading på de fleste amerikanske energimarkeder. Vores team består af specialister med stærke baggrunde inden for økonomi, statistik og datalogi. Vi opererer udelukkende med automatiserede tradingsystemer uden manuelle tradere.




Hos Nabla Technologies værdsætter vi personlig frihed og en sund work-life balance højt. Vi tilbyder fleksible arbejdstider og dyrker en positiv og afslappet atmosfære. Trods vores beskedne størrelse har vi opnået betydelige resultater.




Alle medarbejdere hos Nabla Technologies får fra starten et stort ansvar og gode muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling. Vores arbejdsmiljø giver medarbejdere friheden til selv at strukturere deres arbejdstid på den måde, der bedst passer deres individuelle behov og kalender.




Vi har ikke ambitioner om at vokse til en stor organisation, men foretrækker at bevare en mindre og højkompetent gruppe af medarbejdere. Denne struktur holder os agile, innovative og tæt forbundne. Vi sætter stor pris på hver enkelt medarbejders ekspertise og arbejder kontinuerligt sammen om at forbedre vores teknologi og processer. Vores ambition er at være på forkant inden for automatiseret energy trading, samtidig med at vi nyder godt af et samarbejdende, støttende og inspirerende arbejdsmiljø.




Praktiske oplysninger

Startdato: Hurtigst muligt
Lokation: Fysisk på vores kontor i Aarhus eller delvist remote
Kompensation: Konkurrencedygtig løn med mulighed for bonus og/eller medarbejderaktier
Arbejdstider: Fleksible, men primært inden for normale kontortider.




Kontakt os

Hvis du mener, at du er et godt match til denne stilling, bedes du sende din ansøgning, CV, samt karakterblad hvis du har under to års erfaring, til thomas@nablatech.net. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig. Undlad venligst at ansøge via "Easy Apply" på LinkedIn, da disse ansøgninger ikke vil blive taget i betragtning.




Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du også velkommen til at kontakte Thomas Hoffmann Nielsen på thomas@nablatech.net.




Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy & Management (Private & Business Banking)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀

So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.

As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.

As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunar’s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.

What will you do?

Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.

Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.

Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.

Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.

Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.

Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).

Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).

Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.

Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.

Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.

Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.

Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰

Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Show more

Title: Junior dataanalytiker
Description:
Hos Finansrådgiverne leder vi efter en ny kollega til vores back office. Mon det er dig, der elsker struktur, har forretningsforståelse og som formår at omsætte data til værdi?




Dine opgaver

I finansafdelingen arbejder vi sammen om at strukturere vores data, så det bliver værdiskabende. Dine opgaver bliver bl.a. at:




indsamle, strukturere og vedligeholde forretningsdata
udvikle og automatisere rapporter og dashboards
omsætte data til konkret beslutningsstøtte for ledelse og forretning
bidrage til at opbygge vores datastruktur og BI-funktion fra bunden
deltage i udviklingsprojekter omkring data og systemer




Hvem er du?

Du kan være mange ting. Måske er du nyuddannet eller i gang med en kandidat, fx på CBS eller ITU – måske cand.merc., cand.it eller lignende. Stillingen er fuldtid - det kan være på sigt, hvis du nu er ved at afslutte uddannelse. Det vigtigste er ikke, hvad du har læst, men at du har mod på at lære og vil være med til at bygge noget op. Vi forestiller os, at du:




har styr på Excel og er nysgerrig på Power BI, SQL eller lignende værktøjer
er struktureret og detaljeorienteret
trives med ansvar og kan arbejde selvstændigt
tænker forretning, ikke bare data – du vil forstå helheden




Du skal ikke kunne alt fra starten. Det vigtigste er, at du har gejst, stiller spørgsmål, tager ansvar og har mod på at være med til at bygge noget op.




Hvad træder du ind i?

Finansrådgiverne blev stiftet i 2017. Siden da, har vi hver dag arbejdet for at skabe værdi for vores kunder gennem en uvildig og nærværende pensionsrådgivning. I dag er vi 60+ medarbejdere, og vi er flere om et år.




Du bliver en del af en virksomhed, der vokser. Det betyder, at der er tempo på. Det betyder også, at du hurtigt kan få ansvar og udvikle dig – hvis du ønsker det.




Vi har en flad organisation og har et tæt samarbejde på tværs af afdelinger og roller. Kulturen er uformel og familiær – med plads til både fredagsbar, faglig in-house uddannelse og ugentligt fælles fagligt forum. Vi hjælper hinanden, og du kan regne med opbakning hele vejen – men vi forventer også, at du har lyst til selv at tage fat.




Lyder det som noget for dig?

Så vil vi elske at høre fra dig. Send dit CV eller en opdateret LinkedIn-profil via formularen nedenfor.




Vi afholder samtaler løbende og lukker jobopslaget, når vi har tre-fem kandidater, som vi arbejder videre med.




Har du noget, der skal afklares først? Så ring til rekrutteringskonsulent Ane-Mette Isaksen på telefon 20483642.

Show more

Title: VIE - Data Analyst, Denmark, Engesvang
Description:
How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

Specialty Gases is a team of 7 experienced colleagues with different ages and gender. We work between 7:00-16:00 producing different mixtures every day were no day is as the previous one. The laboratory is a team of 3 experienced women with good routines and procedures. We work very close together and enjoy the work as well as the breaks.

The goal is to achieve an accreditation for ISO 17025 (Laboratory) & ISO 17034 (Specialty Gases) to provide a better variety of products with shorter leadtimes to our customers in the Nordics. This is important for Air Liquide to achieve profitable growth in the Nordics.

You will be the project manager on this way ensuring that we will stay on track, use our resources in the best way and bring the results and stakeholders together to achieve the goal. The main interactions will take place with the specialty gas team and the laboratory as well as the accreditation body but also colleagues and experts in Europe. The project will benefit from the experience of other plants in europe that already have achieved the accrediation.

The mission requires very good English communication skills in both verbal and writing with people at various level internally as well as externally.

___________________

Are you a MATCH?

Educational Qualifications:


Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a specialization in chemistry, physics, mathematics, or similar disciplines.



Essential Skills and Competencies:


Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
Strong sense of responsibility, open-mindedness, and a results-driven mindset.
Highly motivated and committed to achieving project goals.
Proficient in uncertainty calculations and preparation of official reports.
Advanced skills in Google Sheets for data analysis and reporting.



Nice to have:


Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders
Proven experience in project planning and leadership.
Expertise in data evaluation and analysis.
Familiarity with accreditation processes and standards.



Language:


Fluency in English (both written and spoken).
Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Norwegian, Danish, or Swedish) is advantageous



Please send the CV and cover letter in English.

Position open only for candidates eligible to the VIE program. Therefore, only the applicants meeting the requirements of the French V.I.E program will be taken into consideration. Please visit this website for more information about these requirements

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en/what-is-the-vie-french-international-internship-program

The V.I.E., an international young graduate program, enables young professionals who are less than 28 and European Union nationals to work for a French company in any country of the world. Becoming part of this program means going abroad to carry out a professional assignment for up to 24 months whilst benefiting from social care coverage and an interesting salary, which depends on the host country.

Business France, the French agency for international business development, is in charge of all the administrative procedures of your assignment. For further information, please visit the following link:

https://mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr/en

Our Differences make our Performance

At Air Liquide, we are committed to build a diverse and inclusive workplace that embraces the diversity of our employees, our customers, patients, community stakeholders and cultures across the world.

We welcome and consider applications from all qualified applicants, regardless of their background. We strongly believe a diverse organization opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to innovate by living our fundamentals, acting for our success and creating an engaging environment in a changing world.
Show more
HTML:
How will you CONTRIBUTE and GROW?

Specialty Gases is a team of 7 experienced colleagues with different ages and gender. We work between 7:00-16:00 producing different mixtures every day were no day is as the previous one. The laboratory is a team of 3 experienced women with good routines and procedures. We work very close together and enjoy the work as well as the breaks.

The goal is to achieve an accreditation for ISO 17025 (Laboratory) & ISO 17034 (Specialty Gases) to provide a better variety of products with shorter leadtimes to our customers in the Nordics. This is important for Air Liquide to achieve profitable growth in the Nordics.

You will be the project manager on this way ensuring that we will stay on track, use our resources in the best way and bring the results and stakeholders together to achieve the goal. The main interactions will take place with the specialty gas team and the laboratory as well as the accreditation body but also colleagues and experts in Europe. The project will benefit from the experience of other plants in europe that already have achieved the accrediation.

The mission requires very good English communication skills in both verbal and writing with people at various level internally as well as externally.

___________________

Are you a MATCH?

Educational Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a specialization in chemistry, physics, mathematics, or similar disciplines.


Essential Skills and Competencies:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
  • Strong sense of responsibility, open-mindedness, and a results-driven mindset.
  • Highly motivated and committed to achieving project goals.
  • Proficient in uncertainty calculations and preparation of official reports.
  • Advanced skills in Google Sheets for data analysis and reporting.


Nice to have:

  • Strong interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders
  • Proven experience in project planning and leadership.
  • Expertise in data evaluation and analysis.
  • Familiarity with accreditation processes and standards.


Language:

  • Fluency in English (both written and spoken).
  • Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Norwegian, Danish, or Swedish) is advantageous

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the “Team Data Science Process” or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, by phone at +45 31624481.

Show more

Title: Panel Administrator ( Maternity Cover )
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Nielsen, we are passionate about our work to power a better media future for all people by providing powerful insights that drive client decisions and deliver extraordinary results. Our talented, global workforce is dedicated to capturing audience engagement with content - wherever and whenever it’s consumed. Together, we are proudly rooted in our deep legacy as we stand at the forefront of the media revolution. When you join Nielsen, you will join a dynamic team committed to excellence, perseverance, and the ambition to make an impact together. We champion you, because when you succeed, we do too. We enable your best to power our future.




About the position:

Are you adept at problem-solving and able to provide a high level of service to colleagues and members? As a Panel Administrator you will be integral in fostering and maintaining high engagement and strong cooperation from Nielsen’s panel members in Denmark. 

The Panel Administrator maintains a close relationship with individual panel members as well as field technicians in order to ensure smooth and efficient data collection from the panel.




Responsibilities:
Provide clear and effective telephone and written support for both panel members and Nielsen field technicians
 Ensure that information in databases is accurate, valid and up to date
Ensure that data received from participating households adheres to quality control standards
Resolve problems by clarifying issues, researching and exploring answers and alternative solutions, implementing solutions, and escalating unresolved problems
Manage projects from start to finish (ideation/initiation to execution and evaluation), that can improve overall data quality and efficiency





Key Competencies:
University degree (preferably long-term higher education programme) within fields such as business administration, sociology, media studies
Able to speak Danish fluently.
Analytical skills and an ability to work with data in a structured manner
Able to drive continuous process improvements.A good understanding of media usage habits. 
Advanced knowledge of the ever-changing media landscape. 
Have a good sense for Tone of Voice when communicating with panel members
Able to speak and communicate in English

Nice to have :
General good IT skills (e.g. Google Sheets/Excel)
Adept at understanding and learning to use new IT systems and applications











Please be aware that job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by scammers seeking personal data or money. Nielsen recruiters will only contact you through official job boards, LinkedIn, or email with a nielsen.com domain. Be cautious of any outreach claiming to be from Nielsen via other messaging platforms or personal email addresses. Always verify that email communications come from an @nielsen.com address. If you're unsure about the authenticity of a job offer or communication, please contact Nielsen directly through our official website or verified social media channels.

Title: Commercial Insight Specialist
Description:
Apply now »

08/04/2024

DNK-Randers, Danish Crown Vej

Commercial Insight Specialist

Do you want to accelerate your career in an international food company? Do you have a solid analytical mindset and thrive in a data-driven environment? Are you motivated by creating actionable business insights from large datasets? Then you might be the Commercial Insight Specialist we are looking for.

Join us on our journey towards creating a more sustainable future for food

Danish Crown is on a transformation journey to becoming an international food company through a dedicated focus on creating even better products and brands for the benefit of consumers. In our Commercial Insight team, we contribute to this journey by turning data into fact-based insights and recommendations for how to deliver on the commercial agenda. As our new Commercial Insight Specialist, you will join a team of five skilled and dedicated colleagues who are working together in a professional and informal atmosphere to deliver the best solutions for our stakeholders. The team is anchored in our Global Sales & Categories organization, and we are responsible for driving key processes around commercial development and insights.

Gain Valuable Experience With Commercial Tasks

Specifically, you will become part of the Commercial Insight team that supports our global sales and category organizations with analytical tools, insights, and recommendations for data-driven commercial decision-making. Together with your colleagues you will be working on quantitative analyses that provide insights into our categories and customers. We are working as internal consultants and you will be involved in all phases of the analysis, from defining the problem, driving the analysis, translating it into actionable recommendations and presenting your results. You will be the go-to person for selected sales and category teams, while you will also assume responsibility for some of our tools and data sources.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities Will Include


Acting as a trusted advisor for sales and category organisations on commercial insight topics
Analysing and optimizing our categories and customers from a data-driven perspective
Supporting on annual customer negotiations and category deep dives etc.
Preparing materials for presentations and communicating your findings to stakeholders
Developing tools and reports for the commercial business


Who are you?

You have a master’s degree within business or economics (e.g. cand.merc, cand.oecon or the like). Ideally, you have 2-4 years of experience from a similar position as Business Analyst, Data Analyst or Commercial Analyst. Alternatively, you can also be newly graduated with relevant experience from student job or internship. In both cases, you have above average skills in Excel and PowerPoint. If you have experience with PowerBI, PowerQuery or Think-cell it is a plus. You are proficient in both English and Danish.

As a person you are enthusiastic about working with numbers and see data as your most valuable resource. You can apply your commercial understanding to convert data into actionable insights and recommendations. At the same time, you manage to convey your messages through simple and visual PowerPoint-presentations. You are structured and thorough in your work and able to navigate ad hoc tasks and long-term projects at the same time. You have a good amount of curiosity and are motivated by following your tasks all the way through - even if there are bumps on the way there.

What do we offer? Glad that you asked!

Danish Crown isn't just a big player in the food industry; it's also a workplace with top-notch facilities and a lifestyle-oriented approach to employee well-being. Our brand new, sustainable headquarters (DGNB Heart Certification) provides an inspiring environment designed to foster collaboration and creativity.

In this position, you will have the opportunity to work closely with multiple stakeholders in one of Denmark's leading food companies. For the right candidate, the position can therefore also be a steppingstone towards a career in a large international food company.

Appetite for more?

If you are curious to hear more about the position before handing in your CV and motivated application, you are more than welcome to contact Director, Andreas Muff on +45 3089 1385.

Please send your CV and cover letter as soon as possible in Danish or English, as we evaluate and contact candidates continuously. We will remove the post once the right candidate is selected.

We are a food company owned by Danish farmers supplying high-quality food to customers and consumers all over the world. From butchers to business developers, we’re more than 23,000 colleagues, all committed to lowering our carbon footprint and becoming climate neutral by 2050, for better food and a brighter future.

Job Segment: Sustainable Agriculture, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Intern, Social Media, Agriculture, Technology, Data, Entry Level, Marketing

Apply now »

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Azure Data Engineer


Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.


cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.


Hvilken rolle får du?


Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.


Din rolle bliver at


  • rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
  • rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
  • bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
  • sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
  • fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger


Hvad forventer vi af dig?


  • Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
  • Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
  • Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
  • Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
  • Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
  • Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
  • Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling


Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

  • Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere


Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.


Hvad tilbyder vi?


Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.


Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?


Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.


Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.


Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.


Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.


Interesseret?


Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.


Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:


Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com


Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Graduate Data Scientist
Place: Vester Hassing, North Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
The Company

Veovo is a market leader in Airport Smart Technology. With a global footprint of customers and capabilities that cover Airport Operations, Revenue management and Passenger Flow. Some of the world’s largest airports rely on Veovo.  Focused on driving airport performance, our solutions enable airports to handle more aircraft and more passengers, with less delays and less queues. Our platforms are built on a modern tech stack, often delivered from the cloud as SaaS and leveraging intelligence to enable our customer to “go brilliantly”.

Our clients span continents, but all share one thing in common~ they’re big names in airport excellence, with even bigger digital goals. With offices in the UK, Poland, Denmark, New Zealand and the US, Veovo offers a world of opportunity

At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports. At Veovo we strive to deliver predictable collaborative solutions that are the platform of great airports.

The Opportunity

We focus on solutions in the analysis of queue and movement patterns as well as capacity forecasts. Our product, is cloud-based system that collects and analyzes data via proprietary (Bluetooth / WiFi) sensors, as well as third-party data sources such as camera, radar, infrared counters, coils, boarding cards, calendars, etc.

The solution primarily helps airports to forecast passenger appearance, optimize staff resources, reduce queue and travel times, and improve the experience for the passengers. In addition, we also create solutions for road traffic, railway stations, ports, ski resorts and amusement parks, with similar work and end-results.

Are you ready to be part of the team that brings our brilliant solutions "live" around the world?

The size of our installations are growing rapidly, and we are therefore seeking a skilled analytical person, who can help implement our solutions to help airports predict passenger arrival and flow. The implementation covers requirements, design, and calibration of the system. The calibration is carried out in-house via the setup of our filtering engine.

The Specifics


Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Combine models through ensemble modeling
Present information using data visualization techniques
Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
Collaborate with engineering and product development teams


What We Are Looking For


Knowledge of R, SQL and Python; familiarity with Scala, Java or C++ is an asset
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field
Analytical mind and business acumen
Experience in data mining
Problem-solving aptitude
Excellent communication and presentation skills


What We Offer In Return


A job in a growing industry.
Employment immediately or by agreement.
An exciting position in a company with good working conditions with an open, direct and informal tone
A company where ideas are accelerated into action, and everyone can play a part in the development.
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development through independent work assignments.
Workplace~ Hækken 2, Vester Hassing, 9310 Vodskov
37 hours working week


Show more
