Title: Senior Data Analyst - Commercial Strategy & Management (Private & Business Banking)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a data-driven strategist ready to fuel growth in a dynamic fintech environment? Lunar is revolutionizing Nordic banking, and we need a Senior Business Data Analyst to optimize monetization, sales, and partnerships across our private and business platforms.

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀




So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.




As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Business Data Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making across monetization, sales, and partnerships so that we can optimize growth and commercial impact.




As our new Senior Business Data Analyst, you will be part of our Commercial team, reporting to Christian Sillesen, Head of Commercial. The team currently comprises a talented and ambitious group across Copenhagen and Stockholm, working on enhancing Lunar’s commercial performance through data-driven insights within the broader Commercial function, led by Mats Persson, Chief Commercial Officer.




What will you do?

Monetization Optimization: Analyze user behavior and optimize pricing, promotions, and revenue generation.
Sales Lead Generation & Performance: Leverage data to improve lead generation and develop predictive sales models.
Partnership Performance Analysis: Evaluate ROI and track performance of strategic partnerships.
Price & Deposit Analysis: Conduct pricing and deposit trend analysis and provide competitive insights.
Data-Driven Insights & Reporting: Extract, clean, and analyze data to generate actionable business insights.




Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.




We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:

Who are you?

3-7 years experience as a Data Analyst (commercial/fintech/banking preferred).
Strong expertise in SQL (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling.
Ability to analyze large datasets and extract key trends.
Strong understanding of commercial KPIs.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with HubSpot or similar CRM systems is a plus.
Familiarity with pricing analysis and working with data engineers is a plus.




Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let’s find out more!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰




Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer, Data & Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Engineer, Data & Analytics, Global IT

Are you passionate about data? Do you have experience in preparing data to facilitate innovative analytics solutions? Do you aspire to empower businesses to employ self-service analytics in a global organization focused on brain health? If that sounds like you, Lundbeck wants to hear from you!

Your new role

You will contribute to empower our business to leverage and gain value from our state-of-the-art data platform within an ambitious, dynamic & international team.

Collaborating with fellow data engineers, data professionals in our business units, and other stakeholders in cross-functional teams, you will contribute to creating and enabling impactful data products to our global lines of business in R&D, commercial, and manufacturing.

Working as a data engineer at Lundbeck, you will get a unique opportunity to leverage advanced technologies together with motivated colleagues in a company committed to restoring brain health.

Your future team

As our data engineer, you will join a team committed to bringing cutting-edge data platform technologies and bespoke data deliveries to the Lundbeck business based on best-practice data management principles.

We leverage dbt and Snowflake as the core of our data deliveries, using Python and SQL as our go-to languages for development. The rest of our stack is mainly focused on enabling efficient DataOps and we strive to build things right. Upon joining, we'll provide comprehensive onboarding to get you up to speed on our DevOps, and DataOps tools.

The Data & Platform team is part of our new Data & Analytics department in Global IT, a department currently consisting of approx. 25 data-, software-, and AI engineers. We are on a mission to provide innovative solutions to the whole of Lundbeck focusing on unlocking the value of our data.

What You Bring To The Team

Whether your greatest strength is in solving technical challenges or igniting enthusiasm in delivering quality products, your colleagues would agree that you are a role model in collaboration and co-creation, and that you are technically adept. You are passionate about leveraging technology to deliver best-in-class data models.

In addition, you have:


Minimum of a bachelor’s degree or equivalent.
Extensive experience ingesting, preparing, modeling and orchestrating data in data engineering or similar role, for example in sales, manufacturing, or research domains.
Advanced ability to collaborate in cross-functional teams, effectively interpreting and translating user requirements into practical data solutions.
Experience with bridging the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders is beneficial.
Familiarity with developing BI products and dashboards is advantageous.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include your motivation for applying. No separate cover letter is needed. We ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions or want to hear more, please feel free to contact Kjetil Lavik, Head of Data & Platform at kjla@lundbeck.com.

Applications must be received by 4th of May, but don’t wait to apply as we will be having interviews ongoingly.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

#EveryBrainInTheGame

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
TimeLog is a leading Professional Services Automation (PSA) software, dedicated to helping professional service organizations streamline business processes and boost productivity. TimeLog fills the GAP between Project Managers and the Finance Department in the consulting business, empowering Project Managers to manage project financials in a way compliant with the requirements set by finance.

We are currently looking for a skilled Data Engineer who is passionate about building and operating a robust data platform that enables powerful analytics, reporting, and insights across our product and organization.

📢 About The Position

As our new Data Engineer, you will serve as the primary technical driver for our data platform, which sits at the heart of all TimeLog data processing, reporting, and analytics – both internal and customer-facing.

You will manage and evolve the entire data pipeline and ensure that our platform is performant, reliable, cost-efficient, and secure. This role combines hands-on responsibility for production data infrastructure with the opportunity to influence architectural decisions and data strategy in collaboration with our Senior Software Architect.

You will report to the Chief Product and Technology Officer and work closely with colleagues across software development, product, and infrastructure.

🎯 In This Role, Your Responsibilities Are

Data Platform Operations & Ownership


Manage and contribute to the entire data pipeline from source databases to analytics platforms
Monitor the production environment and maintain system reliability
Optimize data platform performance, cost and efficiency while ensuring high availability
Develop innovative approaches to data analysis and information generation
Ensure data governance, compliance, and quality across the platform


Developer Support & Enablement


Support developers in building reports and new processing pipelines
Make data accessible, well-documented, and reliable for internal and customer use


Strategic Contribution & Innovation


Collaborate closely with the Senior Architect to evolve the technical data architecture
Contribute to strategic data decisions and develop innovative solutions
Ensure data security and compliance with company and regulatory standards


🏆 Your Qualifications

Experience & Technical Skills


Strong hands-on experience with Databricks
Proficiency in Change Data Capture (CDC) methodologies
Good knowledge of relational database systems, specifically SQL Server
Experience with Delta Live Tables and stream processing
Working experience with Kafka and Debezium for data streaming
Understanding of data security principles and DataOps practices
Bonus: Some experience in data science or analytics tooling


Mindset & Collaboration


You take ownership of platform reliability and love making things run smoothly
You thrive in cross-functional teams and enjoy supporting others through data
You’re a structured problem-solver who can prioritize and execute effectively
You stay updated on modern data technologies and want to make an impact


🎁 We Offer


A dynamic, inclusive company culture that promotes teamwork and innovation
Opportunities for professional growth and career development
Flexible working hours and a healthy work-life balance
Centrally located office in Copenhagen
A high-impact role where your work directly powers product and business decisions


🏠 Location:

You will be working from our offices in Copenhagen
Show more
HTML:
TimeLog is a leading Professional Services Automation (PSA) software, dedicated to helping professional service organizations streamline business processes and boost productivity. TimeLog fills the GAP between Project Managers and the Finance Department in the consulting business, empowering Project Managers to manage project financials in a way compliant with the requirements set by finance.

We are currently looking for a skilled Data Engineer who is passionate about building and operating a robust data platform that enables powerful analytics, reporting, and insights across our product and organization.

📢 About The Position

As our new Data Engineer, you will serve as the primary technical driver for our data platform, which sits at the heart of all TimeLog data processing, reporting, and analytics – both internal and customer-facing.

You will manage and evolve the entire data pipeline and ensure that our platform is performant, reliable, cost-efficient, and secure. This role combines hands-on responsibility for production data infrastructure with the opportunity to influence architectural decisions and data strategy in collaboration with our Senior Software Architect.

You will report to the Chief Product and Technology Officer and work closely with colleagues across software development, product, and infrastructure.

🎯 In This Role, Your Responsibilities Are

Data Platform Operations & Ownership

  • Manage and contribute to the entire data pipeline from source databases to analytics platforms
  • Monitor the production environment and maintain system reliability
  • Optimize data platform performance, cost and efficiency while ensuring high availability
  • Develop innovative approaches to data analysis and information generation
  • Ensure data governance, compliance, and quality across the platform

Developer Support & Enablement

  • Support developers in building reports and new processing pipelines
  • Make data accessible, well-documented, and reliable for internal and customer use

Strategic Contribution & Innovation

  • Collaborate closely with the Senior Architect to evolve the technical data architecture
  • Contribute to strategic data decisions and develop innovative solutions
  • Ensure data security and compliance with company and regulatory standards

🏆 Your Qualifications

Experience & Technical Skills

  • Strong hands-on experience with Databricks
  • Proficiency in Change Data Capture (CDC) methodologies
  • Good knowledge of relational database systems, specifically SQL Server
  • Experience with Delta Live Tables and stream processing
  • Working experience with Kafka and Debezium for data streaming
  • Understanding of data security principles and DataOps practices
  • Bonus: Some experience in data science or analytics tooling

Mindset & Collaboration

  • You take ownership of platform reliability and love making things run smoothly
  • You thrive in cross-functional teams and enjoy supporting others through data
  • You’re a structured problem-solver who can prioritize and execute effectively
  • You stay updated on modern data technologies and want to make an impact

🎁 We Offer

  • A dynamic, inclusive company culture that promotes teamwork and innovation
  • Opportunities for professional growth and career development
  • Flexible working hours and a healthy work-life balance
  • Centrally located office in Copenhagen
  • A high-impact role where your work directly powers product and business decisions

🏠 Location:

You will be working from our offices in Copenhagen

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Do you want to join one of the world’s fastest-growing energy trading companies and play a key role in building our new Macro Trading portfolio? Keep reading; we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our newly established Macro Trading team.







In Macro Trading, we combine macroeconomic insights and data analysis with market-specific knowledge of power, gas, and emissions to generate trading decisions. The macro portfolio is like a start-up with a high degree of autonomy and the opportunity to explore new ideas to innovate and rethink European Energy Trading, while having the backing of a larger and mature organization, increasing the probability of success.




As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be key in building our quantitative macroeconomic framework. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with traders, quants, and other analysts to develop quantifiable and actionable analysis.




Your journey as a Quantitative Analyst

We seek a highly analytical and detail-oriented Quantitative Analyst with a dedicated focus on macroeconomics and econometrics to support our energy trading activities. In this role, you will leverage macroeconomic data—such as interest rates, inflation, and growth - and advanced econometric techniques to create proprietary models that forecast market prices and support our trading strategies.




The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of the global macroeconomic landscape and how it influences commodity prices, energy supply, and demand, paired with exceptional skills in econometric modeling and quantitative research.




We will ensure you are ready to take on your new role by giving you the best possible introduction to the team, our business, and our organization. You will be introduced to our macroeconomic framework, and any potential knowledge gaps will be addressed to maximize your success.




At InCommodities, we do not believe in bureaucracy, stringent processes, or micro-management. Instead, we grant you high autonomy, which we believe unlocks greater engagement and ensures that the best decisions are made – always by those closest to the job.'




Key Responsibilities

Develop and implement econometric models that predict key macroeconomic variables
Incorporate macroeconomic factors to predict energy prices and supply-demand dynamics
Collaborate with traders and quants to translate macroeconomic data and econometric insights into actionable trading strategies.
Continuously monitor and refine models to reflect changes in the macroeconomic environment




Qualifications – we imagine that you:

Hold a master’s degree or PhD in Economics, Finance, or a similar field with a focus on econometrics
Have experience with time-series analysis, forecasting, and other advanced econometric techniques
Possess excellent coding skills (Python is an advantage)
Preferably have knowledge of energy markets (oil, natural gas, electricity)
Have great communication skills enabling you to present complex macroeconomic insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Personal skills – we expect that you:

Are super passionate and knowledgeable about econometrics
Actively follow and understand what is happening in the world of macroeconomics
Have a curious and competitive mindset
Can be direct with your colleagues in a constructive way
Can work independently with a strong drive towards achieving results
Are a team player who will do what is best for the team and InCommodities




What you can expect from us:

You will join a team of experienced colleagues and will have the opportunity to work closely together with quants, analysts, and traders to build a macro trading desk
We will provide you with opportunities to develop both professionally and personally
We will provide you with flexibility and autonomy to drive real impact
You will be part a unique company culture where we live up to our values: Honesty, Transparency, and Rethink and where you don't have to abide by a dress code or a strict hierarchy, so you won't be frustrated with too many rules, policies, or bureaucratic processes.




Practical details

Location: Aarhus N, Denmark

Full-time job




Application deadline: As soon as possible




If you have any questions, please contact:

Morten Kold, Head of Macro Trading

Mail: mkj@in-commodities.com

Show more

Title: Senior Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Er du fascineret af at arbejde med data og omsætte det til værdifulde indsigter og tiltag for dine kolleger? Som Senior Data & Analytics Consultant i Telenor får du mulighed for at supportere vores kundevendte kanaler med rapportering. Lige nu er vi i gang med en større datatransformation, hvor vi skal udskifte vores nuværende BI-værktøj med Looker, og klæde forretningen på til fremtidens data-setup. Det kan du få en stor rolle i at bidrage til, og skabe de bedste forudsætninger for nem, korrekt og retvisende rapportering. Interesseret?

”Hvis du har en stor interesse for data og analyse, vil du virkelig trives hos os. Vores opgave er at understøtte vores samarbejdspartnere i Telenors kundevendte kanaler med hurtig, rigtig og nem rapportering, så de kan lægge deres energi og fokus i vores kunder.”

– Vibeke Gilbak, Head of Channel Management

Vi transformerer og optimerer data for at fremme værdien for Telenor

Vores formål er at understøtte Telenors kundevendte kanaler med brugbar og intuitiv rapportering, og sikre at vores ledelse kan tage datadrevet beslutninger. Du vil være med til at udvikle og vedligeholde datamodeller til dashboards og KPI’er, som dagligt bruges af Telenors Kundeservice, Retail, Partnere og stabsfunktioner. Det er en brugerbase på flere hundrede kollegaer, som hver dag anvender dit arbejde. Med din assistance og dataindsigt, kan dine kollegaer fokusere på at give vores kunder den bedst mulige oplevelse.

Vi står foran en spændende transformation, hvor vi skal udskifte vores nuværende rapporteringsplatform, Qlik Sense, med Google Looker. I dag foregår både udvikling og anvendelse af rapportering i Qlik Sense, og som vores nye kollega får du en central rolle i at sikre en god balance mellem den daglige drift og overgangen til det nye setup. Derfor er der også rig mulighed for, at du kan udvikle dig – både fagligt og personligt –, når vi i samarbejde i teamet skal forme den måde hvorpå, vi arbejder med data og rapportering fremadrettet.

Det tætte samarbejde med forretningen er en vigtig del af jobbet, og du bliver en central sparringspartner for vores stakeholders. Med forretningens behov som omdrejningspunkt skaber du løsninger, der giver mening i praksis og understøtter gode brugeroplevelser. Derfor er det afgørende, at du trives med at være tæt på brugerne, forstå hvordan data skaber værdi i praksis, og tilpasse dine løsninger derefter.

Du kan sætte dig ind i dine samarbejdspartneres behov og bearbejde data på en brugbar måde

I rollen som Senior Data & Analytics Consultant, anvender du dine analytiske færdigheder til at omdanne data til viden, der skaber værdi for dine samarbejdspartnere. Du er nysgerrig og går gerne på oplevelse efter måder, hvorpå tingene kan optimeres. Samtidig betragter du modgang som en mulighed for at lære og vokse.

Ligesom os, er du engageret i at udforske data. Om det er analyser, visualiseringer, eller opbygning af datamodeller, så er du i dit es. Du har en dybdegående forståelse for data, hvilket giver dig evnen til at sætte dig ind i store datamængder og omsætte det på en brugbar og anvendelig måde. Samtidig er du motiveret for at forstå, hvordan forretningen fungerer og arbejder, og du bruger den viden til at finde de bedste løsninger. Vi forestiller os, at du har erfaring med Qlik Sense, Python og SQL. Vigtigst er dog, at du er interesseret i at sætte fremdrift i egne opgaver, kan kaste dig ud i nye ting, og at du går op i at lære og udvikle dig.

En arbejdsplads fyldt med Fantastiske forbindelser

Du bliver en del af en foranderlig organisation, hvor der, på tværs af forretningen, venter engagerede og dygtige kolleger, som kontinuerligt arbejder for at udvikle fremtidens teleselskab. Vi arbejder agilt, fokuserer indsatsområder ved hjælp af Kanban og praktiserer Tight-Loose-Tight som ledelsesfilosofi.

Som en del af Channel Management får du 13 engagerede kollegaer, der arbejder på tværs af en bred række arbejdsopgaver indenfor driftsoptimering og rapportering. Vi har et mindset om at tingene skal være nemme, automatiske og selvdrevne, så de kan driftes med et minimalt fingertryk. Det er afspejlet i vores kultur, hvor vi hele tiden skubber til hinanden og udforsker muligheder for ny viden og læring. Vi trives i at være sociale sammen og prioritere fælles dage på kontoret. Samtidig arbejder vi ud fra vores "Flexible Work"-koncept, som tilbyder fleksible rammer og mulighed for hjemmearbejde med henblik på at give dig de bedste betingelser for at opretholde engagement, motivation og performance.

Du kan læse mere om os her .

Interesseret?

Vi søger lige nu to nye Fantastiske forbindelser til stillingen.

Hvis du er blevet nysgerrig og vil vide mere, kan du kontakte Head of Channel Management, Vibeke Gilbak på oplysningerne til højre.

Sidder du med en følelse af, at det lige er dig, vi leder efter, søger du blot via linket her på siden. Vi ser frem til at modtage dit CV og dine svar på vores ansøgningsskema. Ansøgningsfristen er den 21. april, og vi forventer at holde samtaler umiddelbart derefter.
Show more

Title: Student Assistant AI
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a student skilled in AI ready to apply your knowledge of AI and software development in a real-world setting?

Become a part of our AI and Innovation team, where we develop innovative AI solutions that reshape our interaction with technology. Our aim? To Bring People Closer through AI-driven innovation—and we want you to be part of it!

The Team You Will be Part of

Join an innovative and inclusive AI and Innovation team that thrives on collaboration and creativity! Our team consists of a collaborative group of innovative thinkers focused on providing valuable AI solutions. We believe that diverse perspectives fuel innovation, and we encourage every team member to share their ideas and insights. Together, we create a space that honors every voice, allowing everyone to engage in our collective effort to transform the way we interact with technology through AI. This position allows you to learn from knowledgeable experts and work with peers who also value the evolving landscape of AI!

Your contribution is appreciated, and you will:


Develop AI Solutions: Assist in designing, coding, and testing AI applications and software tools.
Experiment & Innovate: Work with machine learning models, data processing pipelines, and automation tools.
Collaborate & Learn: Participate in brainstorming sessions, team discussions, and code reviews.
Optimize & Improve: Advance system performance, scalability, and AI model accuracy.


To fulfill your responsibilities in the role, we imagine that you:


Are currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field, with a specialization in Artificial Intelligence.
Have experience with Python, Java, or similar programming languages and an understanding of AI/ML frameworks.
Are interested in AI and its real-world applications.
Are motivated, adaptable, and willing to explore—you enjoy solving problems and experimenting with new technologies in collaboration with others.


We encourage you to apply

Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we warmly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills. We highly value the right mindset. We consider that personal capabilities are vital for contributing to valuable results.

We prioritize creating an inclusive recruitment experience where every candidate is valued equally in the hiring process.

Join us in bringing people closer

GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We support people with hearing loss to overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses, and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiasts.

Joining GN as a Student Assistant

In GN, our Student Assistants typically work 15-20 hours a week. We value flexibility and will collaborate with you to ensure your working hours complement your studies.

You also have the possibility to join the GN Students Network. This expansive network connects students from various departments and frequently hosts events like Friday happy hours, student lunches, and other engaging social activities.

How to apply?

To apply, use the ‘APPLY’ link no later than 23rd of April, 2025. Applications are assessed on a continuous basis, so don’t wait to send yours.

Quick apply

You are welcome to use our Quick Apply function, where you only submit your up to date CV, including a few sentences outlining you motivation for applying – quick and easy.

We encourage you to submit your CV without a photo to ensure an equal and fair application process.

Should you have any special requirements for the Interview please let the hiring manager know upon accepting invitation to interview.

If you would like to know more about the position, please contact Thomas Grønfeldt Senger on trgoenfeldtsenger@gn.com.

We hope you will join us on this journey and look forward to receiving your application!


Show more

Title: eCommerce Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Ecommerce Analyst

Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Reports to: Ecommerce Analytics Manager

Department: Ecommerce Analytics & Insights

Managerial Responsibility: No

About the Role:

Are you passionate about data and eager to make an impact on a global scale? Pandora is seeking a talented Ecommerce Analyst to join our Analytics & Insights team in Copenhagen. As a key player in driving the success of Pandora’s ecommerce strategy, you will be instrumental in supporting our global analytics initiatives by fostering consistency in metrics, improving data quality, and providing actionable insights to drive growth.

This is a unique opportunity to be part of a global team focused on enhancing ecommerce performance, ensuring high-quality data, and empowering decision-makers across the business. You will collaborate closely with regional teams and HQ, supporting best practices in analytics, unlocking ecommerce growth potential through high quality analysis and helping to align global systems with a unified data catalogue.

Key Responsibilities:


Business Impact: Design analytical approaches that quantify business phenomena, develop compelling business cases, and drive actionable business outcomes.
Data Analysis: Identify and resolve discrepancies in metrics, creating a unified data catalogue for global use.
Training & Knowledge Sharing: Support the development and execution of training programs, helping regional teams improve their analytical capabilities.
Data-Driven Insights: Apply statistical techniques to provide insights into ecommerce performance, including predictive models and regression analyses using tools like Python and SQL.
Standardize Metrics: Collaborate with regional and HQ teams to standardize and document key ecommerce metrics, ensuring consistency across different data systems.
Data Quality: Audit data quality and work with data teams to improve data consistency and integrity.
Collaboration: Engage with stakeholders across the global team, contributing to knowledge-sharing initiatives and ensuring the effective use of data insights in decision-making.



Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):


Engagement and feedback from training programs and the global analytical community.
Impact of statistical analyses and predictive models on business performance.
Improvement in data quality and integrity.
Effectiveness of business cases and analytical recommendations leading to measurable improvements.
Completion and adoption of harmonized metric documentation.
Reduction in discrepancies in metrics across systems.



About You:

You are a logical thinker with strong commercial reasoning, capable of deriving actionable insights from data. Your ability to collaborate with diverse global teams and communicate complex analytical concepts in a clear and business-relevant manner makes you a strong candidate for this role. You are eager to contribute to continuous improvement and have a passion for data-driven decision-making.

Experience & Qualifications:


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
Experience: 1-3 years of experience in data analysis or a similar role, ideally with experience in ecommerce or digital analytics.
Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (especially Excel), statistical software and/or coding language (Python, SQL).
Languages: Fluency in English, both written and spoken.



Personal Competencies:


Strong ownership and accountability for delivering quality work.
Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, with a structured approach to tasks.
Critical thinker who identifies opportunities for improvement and innovation.
Strong collaboration and stakeholder management skills across global teams.
Ability to visualize and present analytical findings in a compelling, business-relevant way.



What We Offer:


The opportunity to be part of a fun, ambitious, and globally connected analytics team.
A role where you can directly contribute to the growth and success of Pandora’s ecommerce strategy.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for personal and professional development within a global organization.



Apply Now!

If you are passionate about data and analytics and want to make a difference in a dynamic, global company, we would love to hear from you. Join us in transforming Pandora’s ecommerce experience!
Show more

Title: Digital Technology Early Career Student Worker(s), Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Our Digital Technology team share ideas and explore possibilities to make every LEGO® experience awesome. We experiment, innovate and create to change the way our colleagues work, and LEGO fans play, all around the world. 

We’re on the lookout for our next generation of digital talent. So, if you want to build a career full of support, learning, opportunities and play, join us. 

Are you our future talent?

We view our student workers as the future talents of our organization. We provide opportunities for learning and growth, aiming to equip you with the skills needed to become strong candidates for full-time positions – our mindset is Hire4Career.

We believe in fostering flexibility in career growth, ensuring that your studies can seamlessly integrate with work in a healthy balance.

As our student worker, you will be considered a full team member and you will from day one be an integral part of our Digital Technology teams, contributing to the development of a wide range of projects, and you will of course also have the opportunity to seek for internal internships an case collaborations with us, as part of our student worker program.

You are also invited to join our Early Career community organizing fun, energizing and social events for you can meet fellow student colleagues sharing a similar experience to yours. Read more about our student community, benefits and available facilities here Start en karriere i Digital Technology - Careers - LEGO.com

The Learning Journey we offer

During your journey with us, you will right from the start receive mentoring and training toward your passions and skills. We have 7 overall tracks in digital technology and within the tracks there is flexibility for you to be in the driver seat of your career and skills progression all supported by mentors and training we offer.

Within the tracks here you’d focus on…





Software engineering … coding standards, development methodologies, and participating in the entire software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering to deployment e.g. front-end, back-end or full stack development within modern programming languages like Go, GoLang, C#, and more. 
Data & AI, large-scale processing systems and databases. Data Science, Data Engineering, machine learning algorithms, data mining techniques, natural language processing, Phyton, LLM, Databricks and more. 
Cloud Dev/Ops, platforms like AWS, Azure, Gen-AI, Kubernetes, GitHub Co-Pilot, cloud services, network architecture, and security practices to support cloud-based applications, data storage solutions and more.  
Cybersecurity, protecting information systems, networks, and data from cyber threats and vulnerabilities. E.g. security principles, technologies, and practices, such as encryption, intrusion detection systems, secure software development and more.
Business Systems Engineering, ERP systems to setup, customization, and maintenance of ERP software to align with an organization's business processes e.g. work with engineering or configuration to streamline, automate business functions and more.  
Digital product design, interfaces and experiences of digital products such as websites, mobile apps, and software applications with e.g. design principles, wireframing, prototyping, and user testing, to create intuitive and engaging products.  
Digital Consulting & Product Management value delivery of a specific Digital product area and engage with business partners to conceptualize, assemble and ultimately effectively manage the lifecycle of digital projects, in the mindset of Agile to participate in successful implementation of technology solutions. 




Do you have what it takes?

We’re hiring few student workers within Back-end and Full-Stack Engineering track in our Copenhagen Digital Hub, and we’d love for you to bring curiosity, creativity, and a desire to grow with us!

To thrive in these roles, you’ll likely be curious and energized by exploring product groups and technologies such as





C#, Typescript, Python, React – Join Product Delivery Technology team, ideal for those passionate about building engaging user interfaces and robust applications.
Python, Databricks, AWS & Azure – Join a digital marketing team using data to drive smarter decisions and boost the impact of our marketing investments.
Typescript, Node.js, AWS & Serverless – Help power backend solutions as part of our Point of Sale (POS) team, contributing to seamless retail experiences.




These are examples of the tech stacks you might encounter depending on the product teams you join. Don't worry if you don't know them all – we’ll support you with mentoring and training along the way.

We’re looking for students who





Are currently enrolled in Denmark in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Erhvervsakademi (professional academy) program in fields such as Computer Science, Software Development or a related digital discipline.
Preferably graduating 2027 or beyond having at least 2 years left of studies
Are curious and willing to learn, with a positive, team-player attitude.
Can be present 15–20 hours per week, ideally with 1–2 days at our Copenhagen Digital Hub.
Are passionate about digital technology and eager to contribute to real projects.




If you're interested in joining us, please prepare your CV and cover letter in English. Upon submission, you'll receive a questionnaire to help us learn more about you. This will help us better match with hiring managers seeking specific skills and passion.

The application portal will remain open from 7 April to 28 April 2025. If you are shortlisted, you will be invited to attend our Assessment Day on 15 May 2025 at our Digital Hub in Copenhagen. Following the Assessment Day, there will be one final interview round. The expected start date for successful candidates is either 1 July or 1 August 2025.

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Data Engineering Student Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive Meaningful Change

Are you ready to support a dynamic Data Engineering team and grow your skills in building scalable data solutions? Join our team at Abacus Medicine Group, where you’ll play an integral role in developing and maintaining data pipelines while contributing to impactful projects. You will be part of a fast-paced, collaborative environment, gaining hands-on experience and enhancing your technical capabilities.

Get a Glimpse of Our World

The Data Engineering team is a growing team of skilled professionals responsible for building and maintaining the backbone of our company’s data ecosystem. We work closely with various departments and stakeholders, ensuring that data infrastructure and workflows run smoothly and efficiently. We value curiosity, innovation, and collaboration, making this an exciting place to grow both professionally and personally.

As a Data Engineering Student Analyst, you will work alongside experienced Data Engineers, supporting various teams while contributing to the development and optimization of our data infrastructure. If you’re looking for a fast-moving and dynamic team where you can apply your skills and learn new technologies, this is the right place for you.

Realize Your Opportunities as Data Engineering Student Analyst

The Data Engineering Student Analyst will support the Data Engineering team in developing, maintaining, and optimizing data pipelines and infrastructure. You will work on data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes, monitor and troubleshoot workflows, and collaborate with different teams to improve our data systems.

Your Main Responsibilities Include


Developing and maintaining data pipelines that extract, transform, and load data from various sources.
Monitoring and troubleshooting data workflows, identifying and resolving issues proactively.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design scalable data solutions.
Optimizing data storage and retrieval processes to enhance system performance.
Staying up to date with emerging data engineering trends and contributing to continuous improvements.


Fuel for Your Success in the Role

We are looking for someone who is proactive, curious, and eager to learn, with a strong interest in data engineering. You should be comfortable working independently while also contributing to a collaborative team.

Furthermore, We Hope The Following Points Describe You


You have 2 to 3 years left of your education in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
You have proficiency in Python and an understanding of SQL.
You can work independently while also being a strong team player.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud) is an advantage, but not required.
Prior knowledge of the Azure data stack (Data Factory, Databricks, Data/Delta Lake) is a strong advantage but not required.
You have strong communication skills in English and a proactive mindset.


Would you like to know more about us?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.

Interested?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.
Show more

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Lead & Shape the Future of Marketing Analytics at Lunar!

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀




So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.




As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to lead and develop our marketing analytics function. This is a pivotal role where you will take full ownership of our marketing data strategy, driving advanced analytics and automation to optimize marketing ROI and scale our growth across the Nordics.




Be in the Driver’s Seat

As our new Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you won’t just be working with data—you will be shaping and evolving the way we leverage data across marketing. You will set the vision for how we use analytics to fuel our marketing efforts, establish best practices, and build a function that delivers high-impact insights and measurable business outcomes.




You’ll be based in Copenhagen, embedded within our Audience and Acquisition team, reporting to Sally Armstrong. The team currently comprises 5 amazing individuals focused on leveraging data-driven insights to fuel customer acquisition and engagement within the broader Marketing function, led by Manuel Douchez. But you’ll be the one steering the marketing analytics ship - driving strategy, developing methodologies, and making sure data is at the heart of every decision we make.




What Will You Do?

Set and drive the strategy for marketing analytics, defining how we measure and optimize marketing effectiveness.
Establish and implement best practices for data analysis, reporting, and visualization, ensuring marketing performance is continuously improved.
Lead and innovate in advanced attribution modeling, leveraging machine learning, MMM (Marketing Mix Modeling), and Bayesian techniques to optimize marketing investments.
Develop and champion best-in-class marketing measurement methodologies, ensuring data integrity and actionable insights.
Take ownership of incrementality testing and media experimentation to enhance ROI and inform strategic decision-making.
Collaborate cross-functionally with data teams in Commercial, Product, and Finance to ensure alignment in methodologies, shared learnings, and commercial impact.
Act as the key strategic partner for marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that shape our marketing approach.
Automate marketing analytics processes, leveraging AI and cutting-edge tools to enhance efficiency and insight generation.
Serve as the go-to expert for marketing data, ensuring all marketing initiatives align with broader business intelligence efforts.




Curious About the Lunar Culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

Is This You? Let’s Find Out!




We’re looking for someone who is eager to take ownership, build something incredible, and truly shape the future of marketing analytics at Lunar. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Proven experience in a marketing data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally with a strong commercial focus.
Expertise in advanced attribution models, including MMM, machine learning, Bayesian techniques, and media mix modeling.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools.
Experience with Looker, Funnel.io, dbt, AWS, Redshift, Airflow, Git, or similar technologies.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and executive-level reporting.
A passion for automation, AI-driven analytics, and streamlining marketing data processes.
Experience working cross-functionally, ensuring data-driven marketing decisions are aligned with commercial goals.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience in high-volume, complex data environments such as fintech, banking, or large-scale consumer technology companies.




Are You Ready to Build the Future?

Apply now and let’s explore how you can take Lunar’s marketing analytics to the next level!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰




Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Show more

Lead & Shape the Future of Marketing Analytics at Lunar!

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀


So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.


As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to lead and develop our marketing analytics function. This is a pivotal role where you will take full ownership of our marketing data strategy, driving advanced analytics and automation to optimize marketing ROI and scale our growth across the Nordics.


Be in the Driver’s Seat

As our new Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you won’t just be working with data—you will be shaping and evolving the way we leverage data across marketing. You will set the vision for how we use analytics to fuel our marketing efforts, establish best practices, and build a function that delivers high-impact insights and measurable business outcomes.


You’ll be based in Copenhagen, embedded within our Audience and Acquisition team, reporting to Sally Armstrong. The team currently comprises 5 amazing individuals focused on leveraging data-driven insights to fuel customer acquisition and engagement within the broader Marketing function, led by Manuel Douchez. But you’ll be the one steering the marketing analytics ship - driving strategy, developing methodologies, and making sure data is at the heart of every decision we make.


What Will You Do?

  • Set and drive the strategy for marketing analytics, defining how we measure and optimize marketing effectiveness.
  • Establish and implement best practices for data analysis, reporting, and visualization, ensuring marketing performance is continuously improved.
  • Lead and innovate in advanced attribution modeling, leveraging machine learning, MMM (Marketing Mix Modeling), and Bayesian techniques to optimize marketing investments.
  • Develop and champion best-in-class marketing measurement methodologies, ensuring data integrity and actionable insights.
  • Take ownership of incrementality testing and media experimentation to enhance ROI and inform strategic decision-making.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with data teams in Commercial, Product, and Finance to ensure alignment in methodologies, shared learnings, and commercial impact.
  • Act as the key strategic partner for marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that shape our marketing approach.
  • Automate marketing analytics processes, leveraging AI and cutting-edge tools to enhance efficiency and insight generation.
  • Serve as the go-to expert for marketing data, ensuring all marketing initiatives align with broader business intelligence efforts.


Curious About the Lunar Culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

Is This You? Let’s Find Out!


We’re looking for someone who is eager to take ownership, build something incredible, and truly shape the future of marketing analytics at Lunar. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

  • Proven experience in a marketing data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally with a strong commercial focus.
  • Expertise in advanced attribution models, including MMM, machine learning, Bayesian techniques, and media mix modeling.
  • Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools.
  • Experience with Looker, Funnel.io, dbt, AWS, Redshift, Airflow, Git, or similar technologies.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and executive-level reporting.
  • A passion for automation, AI-driven analytics, and streamlining marketing data processes.
  • Experience working cross-functionally, ensuring data-driven marketing decisions are aligned with commercial goals.
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
  • Experience in high-volume, complex data environments such as fintech, banking, or large-scale consumer technology companies.


Are You Ready to Build the Future?

Apply now and let’s explore how you can take Lunar’s marketing analytics to the next level!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰


Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Data Engineer (Student Assistant)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Management PrimeServ DK

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Student Assistant Data Engineer to join our Data Management department. This role offers an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data engineering, working with cutting-edge technologies and contributing to the development of our data infrastructure.

As a Student Assistant Data Engineer, you will support the team in managing and optimizing our data systems, ensuring data quality, and developing data pipelines. You will work closely with experienced data engineers and analysts to deliver high-quality data solutions.

You Will Play An Important Role In


Assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines (ETL/ELT processes) using Azure services.
Writing and optimizing SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
Supporting data modeling efforts to ensure data is structured effectively for analysis.
Implementing data quality checks and monitoring data integrity.
Developing and deploying machine learning and AI models in the cloud.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather data requirements and deliver data solutions.
Assisting in the development and maintenance data products documentation.
Conducting research and staying updated on the latest data engineering, AI, and cloud development trends and technologies.
Providing support in data visualization and reporting tasks.


We Imagine That You


Are currently enrolled in a university program (preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field that includes Business Analytics or AI).
Have a basic understanding of core data concepts, including data types, quality, governance, and security.
Have had an introduction to SQL and have touched upon concepts such as data modeling and pipelines.
Have some experience with programming languages such as Python.
Have an interest in AI and machine learning, with some knowledge of basic ML concepts.
Are familiar with data tools (e.g., Power BI or Excel) and can create basic reports and dashboards.
Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Are able to work independently and as part of a team.
Have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Are fluent in English.


Benefits


Gain hands-on experience in data engineering and data management.
Help solve real business problems using ML or AI models.
Work in a dynamic and supportive environment.
Flexible working hours to accommodate your academic schedule.
Opportunity to contribute to significant data and AI projects and make an impact.


Welcome to Data Management in PrimeServ DK

Our department is dedicated to managing and optimizing the organization's data assets. We work collaboratively to ensure data quality, develop data solutions, and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. Our team values innovation, continuous learning, and teamwork.

Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future

We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow – whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.

At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.

We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.

In 2027, MAN Energy Solutions will move to Trekroner in Roskilde. Here we will consolidate all our current locations on Zealand into one large site.

About The Student Network

The MAN Student Network is a community made for students by students at MAN Energy Solutions Denmark. The network has the purpose of connecting students in Denmark with the benefit of establishing strong academic and social relationships across group departments, but also as an opportunity to expand the academic network, which ultimately may prove to provide the first full scale step toward a future career at MAN Energy Solutions.

The students within the network have the opportunity to provide recommendations and improvements and actively affect the concept of this network.

About MAN Energy Solutions


250 years of experience in advanced engineering
We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe
We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy
We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are more than 2,500 passionate employees from over 55 nationalities


Build your own future

Please submit your application to us no later than Wednesday, the 30th of April, 2025. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Francisco Moreano Lasso by phone (+45) 81 75 80 58. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com .

In MAN Energy Solutions, we strive for an inclusive and fair recruitment process for our job applicants based on equity. We encourage all qualified candidates, regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position. Therefore, please refrain from attaching a photo to your CV or cover letter. Furthermore, assistive tools will be available when needed, for example for dyslexia.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Er du klar til at dykke ned i de nyeste teknologier i Azure og Microsoft Fabric? Hos Kvik A/S har vi en mission: Vi vil bygge et vindende hold og skabe exceptionelle forretningsindsigter gennem data og applikationer. Vores mål er at vækste virksomheden og realisere vores ambitiøse digitale rejse.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


Hybrid arbejdsplads (minimum 2 dage på kontoret)
Hands-on erfaring med Microsoft Fabric
Spændende projekter samt et sjovt og udfordrende arbejdsmiljø
Muligheder for personlig og faglig udvikling
Fokus på jobtilfredshed i en åben og ærlig atmosfære
Ansvar og indflydelse i et selvstændigt team


Arbejdsområder

Som BI Consultant hos Kvik A/S vil du have følgende arbejdsområder:


Analyse og afdækning af forretnings behov
Løfte og udvikle eksisterende cloud platform til Fabric setup
Design, udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger
Sikring af datakvalitet
Rådgive og understøtte stakeholders i brugen af BI-værktøjer
Identificere og implementere muligheder for automatisering og optimering
Tværfagligt samarbejde med andre teams om dataintegration og -analyse projekter
Vedligeholdelse og fejlfinding i eksisterende BI-systemer
Bidrage til at udforme og forbedre BI-strategier og -processer


Den ideelle kandidat

Vi ser den ideele kandidat besidde følgende:


Erfaring med SQL, Azure Data Factory, Microsoft Fabric, Python og datamodellering
Generel forståelse for agile arbejdsprincipper (DevOps) og git
Solid forretningsforståelse til at understøtte dialog med stakeholders


Om vores team

Vi er et ungt og dygtigt team, der trives med samarbejde, innovation og et omskifteligt landskab. Vi omfavner den agile metode og tror på at udfordre grænser, lære af fejl og fejre succeser sammen.

Din profil

Er du proaktiv og ansvarsfuld? Vi søger en kollega, der ikke er bange for at udfordre normen. Som BI Consultant kombinerer du teknisk viden med forretningsbehov.


Ansvar og initiativ: Du tager ansvar for dine opgaver
Nysgerrighed: Du stiller de svære spørgsmål og udforsker nye løsninger
Formidling af tekniske løsninger: Du kan oversætte komplekse tekniske begreber til forståeligt sprog for stakeholders
Samarbejde: Du trives med tværfagligt samarbejde
Minimum 2 års erfaring


For yderligere detaljer om denne fantastiske mulighed, kontakt vores Senior BI Architect, Victor D. K., på telefonnummer 22600424. Denne fuldtidsstilling er baseret hos Kvik A/S, Mosevej 3, 8240 Risskov. Der kan forekomme kørsel til hovedkontoret i Vildbjerg.
Show more

Title: Product Analyst with Power BI skills
Place: Brøndby Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Product Analyst with Power BI skills 

Do you want a rare opportunity to make an extraordinaire impact as part of a great team? 

If you have a passion for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data – and you know how to leverage Power BI in this context – this role offers a unique career opportunity. As part of Milestone’s transformation, your expertise will be a key asset for future growth. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to shape how the company works with telemetry data, giving you significant influence and learning opportunities. And you’ll do it as part of a well-functioning, collaborative team where teamwork, knowledge sharing, and mutual support are part of everyday life. 

Turn data into clear and insightful PowerBI dashboards 

Your primary mission is to help business colleagues achieve better results by providing them with valuable data-driven insights. You’ll engage in dialogue with stakeholders across various business areas to understand their goals and needs. Using this knowledge, you’ll collaborate with the Power BI backend team to to request, refine, and test data in our cross-organizational data model. From there, you’ll transform data into compelling, easy-to-understand Power BI dashboards. At the same time, you’ll continuously contribute ideas for optimizing our overall setup. Your primary tasks will be to:  



Engaging with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives 
Building Power BI dashboards in collaboration with the backend team 


Acting as the data/Power BI lead in various business projects 


Developing an understanding of how usage data fits into the overall value chain 


Assisting project teams in setting up data-driven metrics and coaching them on data interpretation (e.g., through workshops) 


Contributing to the compilation of monthly and quarterly royalty reports 



Experience in Power BI for telemetry, usage, and behavioral data 

We are looking for you that thrive on handling tasks independently while at the same time knowing when to engage with your colleagues to create 1 + 1 = 3. We are also looking for your entrepreneurial spirit as you shall play a key role in building the future way of working for your workstream. As part of this, you must be curious on new trends, technologies and tools.  Additionally, it is important that you like dialogue and collaboration with many different people covering multiple professions and nationalities. Finally, you can tick of the below:  



Degree in data science or equivalent experience  


Experience with telemetry/usage/behaviour data, preferably in a software company  


Power BI frontend experience, especially in visualization and storytelling of data with the data user in mind 


Knowledgeable of DAX and star schema models / the Power BI platform  


Experience with Azure DevOps and user story processes 



Your new team 

Your new workplace will be Milestone’s headquarters in Brøndby, Copenhagen, where you’ll join a team of eight skilled colleagues in the Product Operations team where you will be part of the Product Analytics and Performance workstream. Our team brings together experts in product excellence, performance, telemetry, qualitative research, and outcome-driven product management. We work cross-functionally to enable product teams to make informed, customer-centered decisions and deliver real impact.  

Just as important. You can look forward to being part of a highly functional, professional, and socially engaging environment. Our team is diverse – we are eight people representing seven different nationalities. At Milestone, you’ll experience a positive and welcoming culture with frequent social activities, an on-site gym, private health insurance, and additional perks like free drinks, fruit, lunch, Friday bars, and more. Flexibility is also a natural part of life at Milestone. 

Contact and application 

Please apply at our website using the ”Apply” button.  

You will experience an inclusive and unbiased recruitment process where all employment decisions are based on qualifications rather than race, color, ethnicity, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and religion. We advise you not to attach a cover letter to your application but instead, we encourage you to write a few lines about why you are applying for the position in your resume/CV. Additionally we recommend you not to add a photo in your resume/CV. 

If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Christina Hampson, Head of Product Operations at +45 2552 9352. 

We are looking forward to receiving your application.  

At Milestone, your work goes beyond what the human eye can see. With our unique video technology software, you help people make wiser and more responsible decisions – in and beyond security. Whether you advance our software, inspire to new integrations, or elevate our customers, you are part of a growth company recognized by the industry. We have a unique people-first approach to everything we do, and it’s not just empty words. Being part of a fun, friendly, and flexible environment you’ll find, that working here almost feels like a home away from home. If you are curious to know more about who we are, we suggest you visit http://milestonesys.com/career  

 


Show more

Title: Student Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Student Quantitative Analyst

At MFT Energy, we are at the forefront of energy trading, driving market efficiency, and facilitating the green transition. We are seeking a talented student quantitative analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team trading European power. Collaborate with experienced professionals, who are dedicated to excellence every day.

About The Role

As a Student Quantitative Analyst, you will play an instrumental role in our dynamic Intraday team. You will work alongside highly skilled quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, execution-algo developers, system developers, and traders.

You will be part of a team working on machine-learning models that automatically execute in the market meaning you will get direct feedback on performance. With time, we will bring you into various decision-making processes as we believe in responsibility being a key driver for your success.

Your Key Responsibilities


Acquire and maintain data from external sources.
Contribute to existing trade signal frameworks.
Maintain and develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge.


Your Qualifications And Personal Skills


Studying: Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar.
A proactive approach and general interest in algorithmic trading.
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, etc. is considered a plus.
Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.
The ability to work independently and structure your workload.
A positive and competitive attitude but at the same time a valued team player.
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English.


Above all, we cherish passion and creativity. If you have made hobby projects, feel free to share them.

Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are more than 180 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Türkiye, Australia, New York City, and Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best—we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.

We Offer


A part-time student position with a high degree of influence and autonomy, requiring on-site presence at our Aarhus C office to foster close collaboration and learning
A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.


Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a CV, a short cover letter, and your grade transcript. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Deadline: As soon as possible.

Start date: Flexible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.
Show more
HTML:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Student Quantitative Analyst

At MFT Energy, we are at the forefront of energy trading, driving market efficiency, and facilitating the green transition. We are seeking a talented student quantitative analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team trading European power. Collaborate with experienced professionals, who are dedicated to excellence every day.

About The Role

As a Student Quantitative Analyst, you will play an instrumental role in our dynamic Intraday team. You will work alongside highly skilled quantitative analysts, machine-learning experts, execution-algo developers, system developers, and traders.

You will be part of a team working on machine-learning models that automatically execute in the market meaning you will get direct feedback on performance. With time, we will bring you into various decision-making processes as we believe in responsibility being a key driver for your success.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Acquire and maintain data from external sources.
  • Contribute to existing trade signal frameworks.
  • Maintain and develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge.

Your Qualifications And Personal Skills

  • Studying: Data Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar.
  • A proactive approach and general interest in algorithmic trading.
  • Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, etc. is considered a plus.
  • Strong analytical skills and an eye for detail.
  • The ability to work independently and structure your workload.
  • A positive and competitive attitude but at the same time a valued team player.
  • Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English.

Above all, we cherish passion and creativity. If you have made hobby projects, feel free to share them.

Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We are more than 180 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Türkiye, Australia, New York City, and Singapore, and several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best—we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.

We Offer

  • A part-time student position with a high degree of influence and autonomy, requiring on-site presence at our Aarhus C office to foster close collaboration and learning
  • A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment.
  • Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions.
  • Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach.
  • A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.

Make the Most of Your Talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with a CV, a short cover letter, and your grade transcript. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.

Deadline: As soon as possible.

Start date: Flexible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

As a global and independent energy trading hub, we specialize in power, gas, and environmentals trading 24/7 in 41 countries. At MFT Energy, we innovate energy trading through our people and technology, supported by our unique partner model. Our belief is that fostering a sense of ownership among employees is the most effective way to advance our business.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hjælp verdens mest innovative virksomheder med at forbedre deres AI-modeller ved at give menneskelig feedback. Er du en erfaren matematikekspert, der gerne vil give din ekspertise til at træne AI-modeller?

Om Muligheden

Vi leder efter en talentfuld matematikekspert til at hjælpe med at træne generative kunstig intelligens-modeller. Denne freelancemulighed er fjern, og arbejdstiden er fleksible, så du kan arbejde, når det passer dig bedst. Du kan bidrage med din ekspertise ved at...

Vurdering af faktualitet og relevans af domænespecifik tekst produceret af AI-modeller

Udarbejdelse og besvarelse af spørgsmål relateret til matematik

Evaluering og rangering af domænespecifikke svar genereret af AI-modeller

Eksempler På Ønskelig Ekspertise

En bachelor eller højere grad i matematik eller et beslægtet fag

Erfaring med at arbejde som matematikprofessionel

Evne til at skrive klart om begreber relateret til matematik på flydende engelsk og Dansk

Betaling

Priserne varierer baseret på ekspertise, kompetencevurdering, placering, projektbehov og andre faktorer. For eksempel kan højere takster tilbydes ph.d.er. For ikke-kernearbejde, såsom under indledende projektonboarding eller projektoverarbejde, kan lavere takster gælde. Visse projekter tilbyder incitamentsbetalinger. Gennemgå venligst betalingsbetingelserne for hvert projekt.
